title: Great place
review: Restoration activities in process the place has a strange feel to it, the destroyed houses are really unsettling.

title: Nothing special
review: The village are basically ruins, there are some old houses still undamaged, but the rest are just rocks. Nice to see, but nothing special if you don't have a guide at least. The safari usually includes a first stop here, so it doesn't worth to go there just to visit the place

title: Overhyped!!!
review: This place is definitely overhyped, rajasthan tourism has advertised it too much.

title: Tad disappointing
review: Well had high hopes with the cursed and haunted village where inhabitants are supposed to have vanished leaving behind their stuff as well.

title: historical remains of a village now haunted/inhabited.
review: ASI has done well to preserve this 200 year old haunted village amid a sandy desrt. once vacated by villagers under duress, was never habited again . slightly off from way to Sam sand dunes from jaisalmer. worth a visit for history enthusiasts.

title: Can skip this
review: There are just ruins of villages abandoned by the people for reasons unknown. There are 2-3 theories but no one knows for sure. It’s out of the city and would need a cab/taxi to reach. They usually take 1500-2000 rupees to visit the village and a Jain temple on the way.

title: Nothing much to boast about.
review: As this was very close to Jaisalkot resort I went early morning to catch the abandoned village with the sunrise. I did get some lovely shots of the sunrise with the village entrance and of the small pond just outside the village. Could not enter as it was locked. Came again later in the day to drive in, gave ₹50!at the gate but the drive in was done in less than 10 minutes and not even worth one picture. Waste of ₹50 and no receipt.

title: Abandoned village in between desert
review: Abandoned village in between desert. Govt have mage this a tourist spot. There is a saying that ghost comes at night. We are not allowed to stay there at night. All are broken and houses. Only one temple is standing. Govt restoration mark is there.

title: Creative photographic opportunities- the old mixed with the new!
review: Like bada bragh, this abandoned village photographs better at sunrise. Still, the evening sunsets taken from behind Kuldhara village can be surprisingly, breathtaking. Here, you will see the old with a healthy mix of new restoration..

title: Nothing creepy, pleasant visit
review: Sunset is the best time to visit for lovely photographs. Parking available, could not see any F&B outlets, quite walkable, interesting history, nothing really spooky about it. Great place to visit if u have your own car. Don’t rely on google to navigate, ask around, we had to take a really long detour for a missed turn.

title: Awesome Rajasthan
review: We have visited this so called India’s own ghost village on the way to our desert safari in the morning(ideal timing). We suggest you before going to this place please know the history behind it.

title: Haunted village tour - disappointing
review: We went to the so called Haunted Abandoned village at Kuldhara on our way back to Jaisalmer from the desert camps. The place is a full on tourist destination with entry tickets, cafe, etc. and so looks like any other normal place. Kuldhara village looks beautiful and walking down the roads of the abandoned place is a different feeling. Diff. kinds of houses can be seen. Several movies have been shot here as well. Go for it only in case you have time !!

title: Kuldhara village in Rajasthan
review: Kuldhara village also known as ghost village. However once you enter there's nothing spookiness about it. Its just another still village with ruins of the houses. It closes at 5 pm. The entry fee for indian tourist is 50 rupees.

title: Don't miss
review: Actual ruins of a 300yr old village.. The houses, the rooms ..all there to explore. The tragic story behind it is displayed in a plaque at the entrance and inside. Climb atop a house to have a rooftop view of the whole area.. Marvelous

title: Must Visit when you are in Jaisalmer
review: Kuldhara is one of the most enigmatic destinations to visit in Jaisalmer.

title: Must visit
review: amazing place that could be easily forgotten during a long trip. Can't imagine how beautiful it'd be when it was built. Unfortunately, clear descpriton when it was built wasn't available.

title: Surprising History
review: I have been to this place and the driver of my jeep told me the history of this place which is very scary and surprising and amazed to know the history of this place and once a visit is ok

title: Kuldhara village
review: There are lot of stories surrounding this place. It is up to you to decide which one suits your imagination with the village.. nothing much to see here except for abandoned ages old homes (and a few puppies).

title: Abandoned
review: place with history of 84 living villages getting abandoned in one night and no one knows where people went and they have bever returned a nice place to visit .

title: Beautiful place with a haunted back story
review: Its said Kuldhara once belonged to rich Paliwal Brahmins before the entire village got vacated overnight, thus giving Kuldhara the slightly haunted look that it has. Kuldhara is on the way to Sam Sand dunes and is worth a visit. Beautiful at dusk, the village is very picturesque and great for pictures.

title: Amazed
review: This is an ancient village which is on the way from Jaisalmer to Sam sand dunes. This village amazed me. It was built with perfect playing in those ancient days which was amazing.

title: if you are nearby then you should visit.
review: So so place. Can be a good place for great photo clicks, so you can visit if you are staying nearby or are passing near that place.

title: So beautiful
review: Such a nice place to visit, best heritage village in world with so nice history....

title: Haunted place
review: A hunting place having so many stories... 15 km away from jaisalmer..in sam road..having boundary  village...with all old memories

title: Kuldhara the Abandoned village
review: It is really a heart ranching seight to visit the village. Which seemed to be a prosperous village became a haunted place. My heart goes out to the paliwal families who deserted their motherland in the dark night due to the atrocities of the then Muslim ruler. A unique place to  visit. It requires attention of the govt of India as well.

title: Quick trip is enough
review: A cactus park, a temple and many ruins of the abandoned village. This is an interesting sight and I really hope the Rajasthan government develops the museum further to make it more interesting for the tourists.

title: Visit only if you have time
review: I went to c ths village as it was on my way to Sam sand Dunes. Nothing to c except remains of Village. Many stories to explain the condition of village. If u believe its a haunted place or else just remains of abandoned village. Not worth much Time.

title: Kuldhara
review: Waste of time .. the restoration or I can call it makeover of ruins kill the originality..

title: Abandoned village
review: This village has the broken houses abandoned a century back. This is slightly off the city and visit if you have time. 1 hour is good to spend there as there is nothing much other than broken houses and a sample house of the village.

title: Very interesting archaeology
review: It is very interesting to visit this ancient abandoned village of Kuldhara. It is remarkable how the old stone strucrure is still standing after about 200 years.

title: It's a ghost village,  not haunted village as mentioned
review: The abandoned village from 1885, by Paliwal Brahmins cam make a pretty picture but the construction going on makes it look like as if it may turn into a commercial venture,  why is such protected place fiddled so much and not be left alone,  the over zealous attempt may take away the natural beauty

title: Interesting
review: We were a little unsure about going here due to stories we read about it being a haunted village. But the history is fascinating and worth a visit. Takes about 30 mins to see the place at max. Cost 10 rs per person. Don't recommend taking a stroller

title: Abondend village
review: One time must watch. Between Jaisalmer city to Sam sand dunes.. just off road... Few KM's off the way but worth going...

title: Nice 30 minutes stopover on the way to Sand Dunes
review: The village is still being developed as a tourist spot by ASI. A lot of sign posts have been put by them but the rehabilitation work that will make the place ‘must visit’ is still being done at a very slow pace.

title: Beautiful... heritage
review: This is a abandoned village ..ruins are there ...it is maintained well ..enjoyed the beautiful abandoned ruins..worth seeing...

title: Haunted village
review: It's an abandoned, haunted village in jaisalmer district of rajasthan. It's around 20km away from the main city. It was once an prosperous village inhabited by paliwal Brahmins. Due to various unknown reasons, the village got abandoned within a night. Overtime people started recognizing it as a haunted place and government of rajasthan decided to establish it as a tourist spot. There is a haunted story about this village. Some locals says that ghosts roam around there in the night and some people denies this fact. It is also recognised as an archaeological site. I would suggest you to visit this place only if you have an great interest in historical things otherwise it's a waste of time. Because there is nothing to see there. Entry charges are Rs. 10 per person and Rs. 50 per vehicle. You should have your own vehicle or can hire a taxi, car to reach there as there is no public transport facility available to this site.

title: Nothing great
review: Its an old abandoned village, where you can take great photos, other than that, there is nothing great!

title: Good
review: This place is on the way to Sam Sand dunes. Not so great but visit once.... museum and shop inside the village was closed..

title: Kuldhara Ghost Village
review: Now this is a place which has lot of history that it’s a ghost place related to a witch name Kalo but once you visit this village it has complete different story and u take a guide once u are here. A must watch place once you are here

title: Waste of time
review: There is absolutely nothing to see here. Everything seems set up, not recommended at all. Too much hyped.

title: Jaisalmer - Kuldhara Village - Not so haunted !!
review: According to folklore, Kuldhara was an ancient village of the Paliwal Brahmins who migrated from the region of Pali. They built 84 villages around Kuldhara but had to abandon the village almost overnight attributed to various causes, ranging from persecution by Salim Singh, a powerful minister of Jaisalmer state, to drought and earthquake. The village remained abandoned since the early 19th century.

title: Eerie... but Amazing
review: The place is eerie... and yet a must visit.

title: Good
review: Located outside if Jaisalmer city. You have to hire a taxi to visit there. They charge 50 Rs for each vehicle to enter to this village. Good place.

title: HAUNTED BY MILLING TOURISTS CLAMBERING OVER THE HISTORICAL STRUCTURES
review: There is a lot of hype over the 'abandoned village' which is said to be haunted. When you get there, in peak season you will see many cars and buses and hundreds of tourists clambering over the historical structures to take photographs and selfies. The authorities have made some new structures and have even made a restaurant and a place to stay within the historical structure area.  If this is really to be maintained as a historical legacy then there should be control over where tourists can go and what they can do. Not very interesting at all.

title: Kuldhara the haunted village
review: A village near Jaisalmer...having। a mythological story..village was abandoned in one night..some mythological reasons..ghosts roam in night as told by locals..no body remains in night at this place...in the day a good place to visit

title: Ghost Town Kuldhara
review: This was a town of Paliwal Brahmins till all of them abandoned the town overnight. Now the ton is deserted and remnants of collapsed buildings can be seen. It seems to be quite a big town. Now restoration work is underway. Must visit when your on way to Sam Sand Dunes.

title: Not worth it
review: It is pure nonsense and I will strongly advise tourists to stop visiting this place. The journey is not worth the views.

title: A heritage abandoned village
review: An ancient  village, which was abandoned more that 200 years ago by the Paliwal Brahmins, as the folklore goes, due to several reasons!!!

title: Family visit
review: Great achetechal example of living hood 300 yr back, with all amenities,

title: Abandoned
review: On the way to Sam sand dunes a little detour takes you to a village which had been abandoned 800 years ago overnight

title: Interesting place to visit but not much info
review: It was fun to explore this abandoned village but there could be more information about the lifestyles of the inhabitants etc. As it was, it was more just a bit of a playground to climb

title: Scope of improvement
review: There is only one stone, telling the story about the place.Some more information is still required to satisfy the information need of the tourists

title: Must visit place in Jaisalmer
review: Great place to see the old architecture work and the town planning which has been done in those times. This place is considered as haunted because of the past curse of the pallival community to the minister Salim Singh. It is very well planned village but can't be restored again because of the curse. After 6 PM you can't find anybody here.

title: Interesting place
review: Historical significance - good place to visit once. Spend 15 - 20 mins here to get good pics. A bit far though.

title: Is this real story!
review: They say the town is haunted. The localites suggests the story is fake, also some private group has started developing town area.

title: Wastage of time and money
review: Dont travel and pay to visit this place. Theres nothing special about this place. This place is a joke !

title: Ruins to look around
review: Ruins to look around but has been given commercial look with entry fee and lot of people around so you won't get that scary feeling. From the ruins one can think how beautiful the place was built but now has complete deserted look.

title: Good place
review: We have visited the kuldhara as recommended by others as must see place . We enjoyed our visit to kuldhara .

title: Too hyped up
review: It was hyped up as the most haunted place on earth but turned up to be damp squib . Avoid unless you are a ruin buff

title: Haunted Village
review: It is the hunted village. Nicely maintained and requires atleast 1 hour to see the place. Ample of parking available

title: Eerie but worth the trip
review: This old abandoned village is silent for miles around and mostly rubble below the fort. It is worth visiting as it is on the way from Jaisalmer to the Sam sand dunes and many safari and camping grounds. Ask your driver to take the detour for a short break and look around. It is a very eerie place and one of 84 abandoned villages.

title: Kuldhara Abandoned Village
review: Kuldhara Abandoned Village, is one of haunted place in Jaisalmer. This is 20 to 30 km away from jaisalmer main city area. no one is living here from years. and no one should leave here after 6 pm. place is not so clean but it is a historic and haunted place. but there is so much photogenic places. people came here for photography. we have to pay here for visiting this place. this village is made from marbles. and that marbles are cool in every temperature.

title: Fun, intriguing.
review: It's an abandoned village and so called Haunted. Read up on the history and visit it. It's interesting. It's wide spread and everything around is in war like aftermath state. And it's really fun to wander around, consider the backstory attached to it. Worth going.

title: Interesting visit
review: It's one of the most interesting places to visit. The stories are many and difficult to rely and identify which is true. Mysterious but worth a visit.

title: Interesting story of how the village got abandoned
review: Its located on the way from Jaisalmer to Sun Sands. We stopped and spent about half an hour there. A temple and some old abandoned houses and a step well were the highlights of the place.

title: Fun place enroute to Sam Sand Dunes
review: Do visit if you are on your way from the City to the sand dunes. It’s a fun place to spend 30-45 mins or so. You can stay longer if you like posing for and clicking pics amongst ruins.

title: One time visit
review: Place is good for a one time visit to learn about history. Well maintained. No guides. Archeological Survey of India need to make things better and welcoming.

title: Interesting visit
review: Our driver took us here, knowing our interest in wildlife. We saw various desert birds and little rodents. The extensive ruins themselves were good to wander through and the history of the village was interesting. It was mostly crumbling walls but it's easy to pick up a sense of lives lived here and then suddenly abandoned for reasons that are still unclear. It had almost a feel of Pompei about it, without the volcano. If you're in the area it's worth a wander.

title: Not much to see
review: Visited here as this place was a part of safari tour.

title: Historical
review: Historical place and it is located in village. Lots and lots of info and details you can gather if you love historical such places.

title: An interesting place
review: An off the track place in the city of architecture. On the way to Sam sand dunes. Not a not-to-be-missed place

title: Review of kuldhara
review: Its huge village and definatly very scarey...but it shows the paliwar brahmin sanskriti...must visit this place.....

title: Ruins of an Abandoned Village
review: Kuldhara is the site of  ruins of an abandoned village which one can visit by taking a detour on the way to Sam Sand Dunes from Jaisalmer. An interesting place to visit which also has the ruins of an ancient temple.

title: Nothing much
review: It's a protected site... not maintained properly..nothing  much to see...take ur own food and drinks as nothing there..

title: Heritage abandoned village
review: It’s an abandoned village from 19th century. An interesting place to visit on way to Sam sand dunes or from jaisalmer.

title: Abandoned Village near Jaisalmer
review: This was once a well planned village established by Paliwal Brahmin community in Rajasthan. Then the people abandoned tjis village because of a minister in Jaisalmer Kingdom called Salim Singh.

title: Abandoned village
review: The ruins of the stone houses of the abandoned village is all that is there to see. The idea of an abandoned village is quite fascinating but there in nothing much to see or experience. The recreated model houses cannot be considered authentic. The remains of a bullock cart caught my attention.

title: Wonder what is there to see
review: Well this place was still somewhat in original shape couple of years back but now it has also fallen prey to commercialization, in the winters its full of annoying crowds and camera prodding people all around. extensive restoration has nullified the authenticity of this place. only some far off corners are worth seeing. I would give it a miss.

title: Nice and quiet
review: Great place to see past history of a once large town and what the affect of lack of water has in the area

title: Kuldhara the cursed village
review: I dont find anything interesting rather than just taking pictures here. One can only visit here either early in the morning or during sunset.

title: URGENT HELP... PLEASE READ!!!!
review: This old abandoned town has many dogs living here with no access to food or water. They are all starving literally to death and surviving only on small amounts of food from a couple of tourists and locals.

title: Interesting Place
review: This is an interesting place and ask the locals about the story of this place. This village was abondoned by villagers in one night because of one of the ministers Salim Singh who wanted sarpanch's daughter. There is an entry fee for this place and no restaurant around if you are looking for something.

title: Needs better signage
review: We visited it while on our way to camel safari. We really wanted to see the residential tents but we were walking and walking and never found them.

title: Nice site
review: Well done up .should have facilites like water and some shaded place to cater for visits in the day . Wall hace been defaced by tourists inspite of security being deployed .

title: Nice
review: If u r student of history must visit. Nothing is left but the mystery ruins archeological site remains. Some parts of PK, Shouryavansham, barood shooted here.

title: Visited as part of tour
review: Nice attraction but not worth going out of your way for. We visited as part of a tour and were glad we did, ask to have it included in your desert safari!

title: Very exciting and thrilling
review: Must visit when you are travelling from Jaisalmer city to Sam sand dunes as it is on the way. Man it gives a thrilling experience as it has a mysterious history asociated to it and no one stays here after dusk. Only person who sells juice on wheels and leaves before evening. Nice!!!!

title: Heritage village tour..
review: Kuldhara village is a place must be visited by history and archeology lovers. Nice heritage place with excellent source of history knowledge

title: Skippable
review: This should count as the most over rated thing to do in jaisalmer. The govt has concretised most of the site. They have built new model houses, a museum etc. Effectively, any sense of Kuldhara being an abandoned village is killed. One can avoid visiting this place. Khaba fort is a much better place to stop by.

title: also known as ghost town
review: these are actual ruins from past 200 years, it was all broken when we visited this place, but still it was worth, it is on the way to SAM sand dunes, some 5 KM inside.

title: A village of ruins
review: You need to travel a lot for this. but make sure your not looking for greenery. and carry water in the entire vicinity you wont able to find water except a soda shop which is not encouraged to have in sunny day.

title: Stopby on the way to Sam village
review: There are abandoned homes. Just walk around the place to get a feel. It is about 15mnts drive from the city of Jaisalmer.

title: Good
review: This was empty village I been here very old one there 1 ,2 temples  now there and all destroy temple now is good condition I looked been there all day like and yellow stones and their all empty village many year ago many stories hair

title: good attraction
review: Located 18 km away from Jaisalmer. the Kuldhara village is known as the ghost village

title: Nice
review: Nice palace to visit ......,.......it's was good experience.but not to much....I thinks this this story not perfect right...for this village..

title: Kuldhara
review: Not a good spot to visit It's only to see ancient ruins.Nothing there an archeological site.If short of time then avoid it use ur time some where else.

title: intersting
review: All the trips to the desert stop here -. Actually very clean and interesting - but would benefit from some English signs.

title: The lost world
review: The lost village as the ancient story of the abandoned village goes which was vacated over night ... The place is an abandoned village admits the desert city with ruins of the village

title: More legend, and legwork...lackluster!
review: Hushed whispers as a ghost town, or haunted village drum up a legend raising your expectations. In the harsh light of day, it is nothing but an abandoned village, with stone-laid homes lying in abject ruin. If a night visit were permitted (Not allowed currently) it may add to the eerie charm...else, a mere waste of time. Rather, spend it elsewhere within Jaisalmer

title: The Abandoned Village
review: As the name of the place said it's a abandoned village, history of the place stands with the great decisions of villagers who vacant the village overnight.

title: Best place for pics and selfies
review: This is an abandoned village with great history, but if you leave that aside, we got our best pics of the trip in this place. There are mind blowing positions where you can give poses and take great pics.

title: Nothing to see here
review: I have visited this place thinking of finding some interesting things to see. But there was nothing, except for old and new building's those are inside the Abandoned Village there is nothing much to see. One can definitely avoid this place and look for some other place to explore the area ( Sam Dunes) and in and around Jaisalmer.

title: Really haunted
review: Nice village it seem very haunted in evening time,  we came there in car from my hotel and our driver hukam singh described about the history of village..

title: Haunted place
review: Great history of kuldhara village I just heard only in new channel but when I visited there it seems very nice and good atmosphere...  Lovely

title: Great atmosphere
review: Haunted place but seems good , nice history of paliwal cast  , but nothing special to see , anyway u can enjoy there for good photography

title: Stopped off for walk
review: We all liked this place as you just meander around and take it in. The reason for it being a ghost village is unsure which adds to the eerie ness.

title: Ok as an attraction. Nothing great.
review: Kuldhara , locals say it's a abandon village where the pali brahmins used to live and left the place in almost overnight to save their little girl from salim singh.

title: Abandoned place
review: If you have seen some demolished or abandoned sites like Hampi before, this is not really a place that would be interesting.

title: Interesting story...
review: The place has an interesting background ..some more development is needed to make the place attractive.

title: Nothing special but one can visit
review: RTDC is trying to make this location more attractable. Nearby jaisalmer and one should visit to see how an old village looked like. Geologist may find good preserved fossil in bricks of abandoned homes

title: Abandoned villages
review: Kuldhara is one of the 84 neighboring village which were inhabited by the Paliwal Brahmins tribe. There are many reasons given for abandoning the villages, some says its because of the shortage of water or an earthquake made everyone to abandon village. As per local villagers, one of the minister of the Jaisalmer king was attracted to the beautiful girl of the this village and he asked them to hand over her to him. The Paliwal brahmins tribe took it as attack on their pride and honor, but they we're not string enough to retaliate. So all of the 84 villages decided to abandon the village overnight and move to the neighboring kingdom.

title: Village
review: Nice place to visit. This is an abondoned village where no one lives. The temple is must visit here.

title: Abandones
review: surprisingly there is no one who knows the real theory behind this village.among 89 theories its difficult to understand even one. one must visit this place if intrested in horror

title: Kuldhara
review: I was pretty excited to see a dead city,my family was not.On the highway to sand dunes from Jaisalmer,a detour of 12 kms,a single road takes you there. After paying 50 RS for the entrance per car, you see a few decayed buildings.Actually it would have been interesting if the history was written somewhere prominent. If you miss it , not a big matter

title: Hunted Village
review: Good place to visit with rich History and enjoy dinner with Chudel organise by Surya Garh Hotel. Its amazing experience. At Kuldhara you introduce with old rich culture how they live with joint family their storage and lockers

title: Village  with  no one
review: No body  leave  their  but still  you feel  it live the architecture  & the abandoned  cottages  havali  are very  beautiful.

title: “Haunted village “
review: It is situated some 20km from the city on the way to Sam .Kuldhara holds a story in which 64 villages were got empty in a single night to save their daughter !

title: Nothingness in some wilderness!
review: This place is bound to evoke contrasting reviews from the visitors. The place has practically got nothing to like.

title: abandoned place
review: on the way to sam sand dunes approx 20 kms from city. better to add this destination alongwith visit to sam desert, otherwise not so much of worth. some stories are there about why people abandon this place etc. this really mesmerizing how a village is without any native now and why people left from there.

title: Abandoned Village
review: Unusual History of this village but worth a visit as about to fade away with the weather. Tourist department please look into it.

title: Just a pile of stones that is far from being complete
review: Kuldhara was once a prosperous village that is now abandoned and in ruins. Very little is known about the village and the spot too has absolutely no information or direction. The government does seem to be trying to re-build it but it might be a few years.

title: The haunted village as they say
review: Kuldhara is not very far from Jaisalmer and on the route to the great Thar desert.

title: Jaane Kya Dikh Jaye
review: Feel nothing haunted but it was enjoyable.Went in a day time with 5 friends.There we're just abondened houses,animal bones and Black camels.

title: Abandoned village in the middle of nowhere
review: Kuldhara village has a an interesting story attached to it , which will instigate  you to believe in things unreal.. Once you are at the place , the ruin of the village , temple etc , will make you feel , what you want to feel , backed by the story .

title: On your way to a Safari
review: Abandonned village in the middle of nowhere!

title: Hmmm
review: This is really not worth the time to go visit. Unless you have a guide that are ok at english, and can explain you the story right

title: Kuldhara
review: This village is haunted and there's a story about it which was narrated by our guide , though it's perfectly alright to have a visit till the sun is up

title: Lost village
review: Lost village included in most of safari tour. You feel the atmosphere. And nice building around. I loved it.

title: Visit the place for the haunted story you hear about it...
review: I was pretty much excited to visit this place as I had heard a lot about this place and about the paranormal activities that apparently haunt this place. Being suddenly abandoned overnight by Brahmins, this village wears a very deserted and a dead look. The place has a weird eerie silence. When i visited this place, there were only 2-3 tourists around. The beggars over there outnumbered us. It is recommended you hire a guide or take a person who knows the place well. There are many abandoned houses which are mostly ruins. Some of them are really well maintained. The houses had a basement and some of them are open too (but not recommended to venture inside). There are old, antique bullock carts at some houses. The houses look marvellous. It takes you back to an era, only read in the textbooks or heard as stories as narrated by our grandparents. The government is planning to make stay available at this site. It is recommended that you visit this place and enjoy the slice of a haunted history.

title: Ruins of a village
review: These are ruins of a abandoned village. Its located 13-14 km from the city and you can cover it while going to Sand dunes safari. There are no information boards and unless you have a local guide with you, you will only see a few ruins without knowing what they were.

title: Nothing fancy. But bit of curiosity
review: The place has nothing fancy to offer. But the curiosity around it being haunted makes it interesting. Govt. seem to be renovating some of the structures to develop it more as a tourist place. Some of the abandoned houses have Bats inside rooms, kind of interesting and scary at the same time

title: Ruins of an abandoned village
review: Legend is that the village people abandoned their village overnight rather than give in to the demands of a capricious King who had his eyes set on the daughter of the village chieftain. Makes for an interesting narrative. The place is located some 20 odd kms outside Jaisalmer and can be visited through a short detour when traveling to San Sands for the desert safari. Right now there are only ruins of old village but the Rajasthan government has plans to develop it as a sort of a memorial with the village recreated for the modern tourist. Be warned that right now there are no facilities  for food and water so remember to carry them yourself

title: Lots of collapsing sandstone buildings.
review: It was pretty cool to walk around this place.  It is very large.  There weren't any restrictions on where we could go.

title: Juat a visit to know about the abandoned village ruins
review: Got a chance to Visit this site in December 2017. I had heard a lot about this place like its a haunted, abandoned village etc. Well, when I visited this place it was brimming with tourists and never for a minute did I get any feelings of the place being haunted, not sure after sunset though. Abandoned ! Yes, the village is in ruins but the government has understood its significance is trying to build this place as a tourist spot. The project works were in progress when I visited the site. Mobile vans which doubled as soda / snacks shop were parked inside the ruins to serve tourists. You may need to walk around the ruins of the village to get some exclusive snaps or selfies as you will find tourists in large groups. The place has a history / story which I got to hear from my driver. The story is of the wealthy Paliwalbrahmins abandoning the place quietly in the night to save the village chieftains daughter from the king’s lusty official. You will surely come out a wise person after seeing the ruins and hearing the version of different  stories about the place.

title: ruins
review: this place is on the way to the sam sand dunes.There is an entry fee and there is nothing except the remains of some old dilapidated houses all in golden sandstone.some part appeared new and must have been restored.there is a temple inside.visit in the afternoon otherwise it is extremely hot

title: Interesting history, great walk!
review: Before entering this abandoned village, we heard stories like it is haunted and creepy. However, when we visited (which was during the day - our conscious choice of course), we actually had a good time. The village has been preserved beautifully and it made for a great walk. Suddenly, we felt we are in a different era. The main house of attraction is the Sarpanch's (village head) house. This is where the whole story began. The villagers left the town overnight to protect the honor of the Sarpanch's daughter who was asked for in exchange by another ruler (in return of protection of Kuldhara). Luckily, the Rajasthani's respected their women's free choice (in this respect) and rather than handing over the Sarpanch's daughter, they all vanished away, without leaving a trace in history.

title: Not worth going out of your way for
review: We stopped off here on our way to a camel trek, which I imagine is how most people get here. It's fine, but definitely not worth it as a standalone attraction. Some interesting architecture, but absolutely no information anywhere!

title: a long way to go to see ruins
review: when we went it really was abandoned as we were the only ones there, (expect for the man who takes the money and insisted we pay even though he didn't have change!!!)

title: When excitement gone in well
review: This village is on the way to Sam dunes. Expected much to see here, but all goes in vain as there's nothing, nothing at all here. You can finish seeing this place in 5 minutes.

title: A stop on the way to our safari
review: I’m glad we didn’t make a special trip to this place! It was okay to wander around for a short while but I didn’t know enough about it to understand what I was seeing.

title: Not so amazing not so bad
review: Once home for Paliwal Brahmins, This place has many stories. Some says this place has paranormal activities, some says there was a king who wanted to marry this village girl and some says people left it overnight because of earthquakes. I didn't feel anything negative about the place. People think it's haunted because it's secluded and nobody lives there.

title: picturesque site
review: Good site to take photos, you will get atttractive combination of yellow and blue shades in background...nothing erratic mentioned in other reviews, can be visited during day time without getting afraid.

title: Great Experience
review: This is on way to sam dunes.You can see the abandoned houses of paliwal bramhins.The govt is developing this site as tourist attraction.Dont miss this on your way to desert safari.

title: Worth a visit
review: Intriguing place. Worth a visit. Wish it were a little cleaner. Need good shoes and the ability to climb stairs

title: Haunted village- must see
review: The legend has it that this village inhabited by brahmins was abandoned overnight to stop the King from marrying a girl from this village. As you enter the village, an eerie silence greets the visitors and while walking around the ruins, one is transported back in time.

title: Good location for pics
review: Heard a lot of different stories from driver, market, hotel people. Its worth visiting, more yhan 200 houses abandon, some resort is in process of building. Good for taking pics, visited on the way to sam sand dunes, ticket 10 per head and 50 for vehicle

title: Abandoned village!
review: As the name says its an abandoned village. Restoration work is going on. You can visit if you have spare time.

title: Ruins of an Abandoned Village
review: As per story the village was abandoned overnight by the inhabitants. The structures speak of the prosperity that would have existed.

title: An abandoned village
review: We were there in Dec 2017. Kuldhara village is around 3-4 km away from the main road while going from Jaisalmer city to Sam Sand dunes. This place has a entry fee for individuals as well as your vehicle. Its a place to go if you like anything historical.

title: if you believe in story
review: We visited this place but didnt find interesting.. Would not advice to go there if you dont like history and stories and all. However, this place offers very good photography opportunities.

title: Intresting to see the ruind and what abandonent is like
review: We had to visit this place as it ecchoed eeriness and the fact that it got desserts interested our senses. Though buildings remain, its nice to see a haunted place.

title: Ghost town
review: Although deserted, its beautiful in its own way. Do stop by on your way to the sand dunes to check out this ghost town. Also is a very good photography location. Do check your photos later, you might find a creepy lady in the back.

title: On the way to Sam desert
review: Its on the way to Sam desert and its worth a visit. Its being spiced up these days which will diminish its rustic appearance.

title: Ghost village
review: The story tell it is ghost village but tourist allowed only in day time so not having any experience to write about this forbidden village

title: haunted village
review: Kuldhara a haunted village as people say. This village is abandoned long time ago, according to local people some supernatural activities happens in the night. but village is very beautiful although nobody lives here now.

title: Nothing great
review: This is a one time visit place. It has a history attached to it which is a little spooky. There is nothing special to see here.

title: Haunted feeling.
review: This village is on the way of Jaisalmer. The once prosperous village now nothing but an abandoned old site. It left me without words when I heard the story behind this village. If you are interested in haunted places, this one is the best choice for you.

title: Abandoned but not haunted!
review: As we visited the place, tbere were a .lot of tourists there so even if there was a paranormal presence, that could have been lost in the crowd!

title: Village
review: A abandoned village situated on the way to Sams. A must visit place to see the ruins / remains of the village after it was abandoned by the villagers few hundred years ago

title: Waste of time to visit.
review: Abandoned by the brahmin tribe, nothing but a pile of stones.

title: Nothing haunted here :D
review: There are some myths about this place being haunted, and the guide or driver of your cab would tell you the story of it. However, nothing to be afraid of before visiting as the village is a wreck now and it is in open area. The roads to the village are not good too. Even if you don't visit, you are not losing out on anything.

title: they say its spooky, dint feel any
review: Ancient village rumoured to be cursed. Dint feel any though. Good place for taking pictures.Near to sam sand dunes

title: It's just abandoned village
review: The village is over hyped.

title: Wonderful ghost town
review: This ghost town is must visit if you like ghost towns. I liked temple and surrounding area. The road around is not good for parking though. It’s ghost town but still beautiful.

title: Terrible after renovation
review: Don't know why the renovated an abandoned village??? Before it was thousand times better.... I'm really sad, this place is no more authentic.

title: Go only if you are inspired by fancy story!
review: Well in true sense I would not advice to go and see this place. It has very fancy story at back however once you reach to destination you don't feel anything special.

title: Not really haunting
review: There is a story you head about though you does not feel the same when you go inside. Nothing much in day time & night you don't go.

title: Dont waste your time and money
review: This place is a total waste of time. You will end up paying ₹50 for your vehicle and ₹10 per person to enter. It's not the money but the time that you would waste in this place. This place has a few houses made up of tiles which seems to be reconstructed by the locals. Instead explore other places.

title: Sue
review: Worth a stop , very interesting tale ........ and then another Wikipedia story , whichever is true makes no difference I had never visited ruinscthst old

title: Nothing much to see, story is interesting.
review: It was part of the package we took from Damodar desert camp. The story behind the village is interesting. Some news channels have popularized it by calling it as haunted village but that's actually not true. The entry ticket is only 10 rupee per person. 15 minutes are good enough for the visit on your way to Sam Sand Dunes.

title: Haunting village but with beauty
review: This is known as an haunting village in the region. We went their on our way back to Jaisalmer from Sam. Of course you would want to be there only in day light. Because you actually feel the pain crossing the village. These villagers have gone through so much atrocities in the past. Usually we dont see this in other part of the country so a good to know place. Drive to the village is also nice, road of okish

title: Hunted village
review: Real feel of hunted village.

title: Not much to visit
review: Deserted and haunted village by paliwal brahmins... the place has a silence and evokes a sad feeling just by looking at it...

title: Interesting
review: We visited this abandoned village on the way to sam dunes.It was told some interesting story about how this village got abandoned within a night.Nothing is there and we took photographs and the guide told it was the location of airtel add.

title: Abandoned Village
review: We visited this place on the way to Sam Dunes. If someone like historical places then go for it otherwise there is nothing to see. This Village has a story belongs to Paliwal Brahmins.

title: An Example of the need for private business to take over
review: Poorly presented with no signage. Trash and filth everywhere. The employees including the surly police officer need to be replaced. A wonderful story and with the right presentation could be a very interesting tourist attraction.

title: Nice place
review: This place gives some strange feelings that can't be described in words. It's a abandoned place with lots of myths about it

title: How can one just leave home a fortnight
review: Great and mysterious, the sound of wind in your ears and the silence questions the unanswered, how and why did the paliwal brahmins leave into nowhere just a fortnight. Some time it'd have been a place for thousands to live.

title: A good Historic place
review: A good place, but again do take a guide else you will be lost , as in not able to understand much. A beautiful empty village.

title: An abandoned village in the middle of nowhere
review: We left from Jaisalmer full of curiosity, blindly following Google Maps and quickly lost our way!! Remember to type in “Kuldhara abandoned village” that should fix the problem.

title: A haunting sight
review: A quick detour on the way to Sam Sand Dunes will take you to Kuldhara,an abandoned village.Abouit  200 years ago,the villagers of Kuldhara and 80 surrounding villages vanished overnight.Legend has it that the then Diwan of Jaisalmer planned to attack Kuldhara to grab a village beauty who had caught his fancy.When the villagers got wind of this,in order to protect the daughter of the village they vanished overnight.The village stands till today in its suddenly abandoned state.

title: Desolate feel
review: We went here in Jan 2018. It is an interesting walk through considering the history but there is rubbish strewn in some places. Broken beer bottles can also be seen so it looks more like a local after hours hangout rather than a tourist attraction.

title: Seeking
review: It baffles many as to how an entire village is abandoned overnight and never inhabited over centuries due to prevalence of an ancient curse over here . This very intriguing story enrages curiosity in people to visit this desolate village on the outskirts of Jaisalmer City to try resolving this riddle in their own fashion . For those who are planning to visit Jaisalmer I would suggest you Kuldhara in case your stay is more than 2 days . The Indian Army post of Longewala which was scene of 1971 Indo Pak War and Kuldhara are both worth visiting for the ones on a longer trip to Jaisalmer .

title: Rajasthan
review: On way to Sam Sand Dunes,  can be avoided also.. Not a great deal! Place appears to have been over hyped!!

title: Complete Waste of time. Avoid at all cost.
review: It's a complete tourist trap. Nothing to be seen. Please do not waste your time in going there. Nothing spooky about it.

title: Must do in Jaisalmer
review: Beautiful old ruins and also and eerie feel. So long as you jave someone to tell you the history its a beautiful, scary and also inforgettable experience. 45 mins drive from Sonaar Haveli but a must do!*****

title: So nice
review: We come here in Jan 18. A beautiful empty village.The palace was so nice. I would highly recommend for every one..

title: Interesting Story
review: Its interesting to unveil the history of how around 84 villages were  abandoned overnight and never inhabited over  again. The beautiful made houses in golden local stone are beauty spread all over .. Some with roofs.. other without.. Much to explore. Suggest a local guide along.

title: Overrated , fake story , waste of time
review: It is one of those places that make you feel ‘gosh I can’t believe I fell for it again’. Being in Jaisalmer , I got carried away with everything else I was experiencing and expected it to live up to the hype. Now the thing is , it isn’t too far ( only a few kms /15 mins away) so you wouldn’t think much before including it in your itinerary . However when you take Jaisalmer heat and day time optimisation for your desert sunset experience , you are counting every minute. And by that reasoning I felt cheated of my time . There is nothing to see other than a line of empty ruins backed by some built up story .

title: Ruins... but no ghost like feel
review: This is located 3 kms off the Jaisalmer-Sam road and approximately 15 kms from Jaisalmer. There are many stories behind this place but one thing is common that the inhabitants of this place decided to vacate this place.  The legend dated back to 13th century.

title: Confusing but good to visit
review: There are so many stories around this place - haunted, deserted overnight etc etc....not sure which one is real but it is a nice place to visit and view the remains of a 400 old legacy

title: The Village
review: Interesting to see and hear of the history. They seem to be rebuilding parts of it so expect catering in the future

title: Must visit, feels different
review: It's an abandoned village which has ruins of it. A tale to tell. Feels different. Must visit place and meet the old guard who tells tale of this village very interestingly.

title: Special place
review: We were taken there as part of our camel safari, very interesting history and is being restored to its former glory

title: A must visit if you can spend time and absorb history !
review: The most important thing about this place is the story associated with it. Surprisingly not many people will tell you there for unknown reasons. So do your research before going. It's a typical old 13th century Rajasthani village ruins but intact temple. A beautiful scenic view surrounds it and if you want you can spend good amount of time here just absorbing the historic and scenic beauty and taking a lot of pics. Presence of a guide will enhance your experience.

title: Good place to see if you are keen on history.
review: Personally I loved the place. How organised the village must have been. How beautiful the houses were. To imagine the grandeur of the place, was awe inspiring. But again tourist don’t respect that. There were plastic bottles and wrappers lying all around.

title: Place with historical significance
review: The place is on the way from Jaisalmer to Sam Sand dunes. This is slightly off main route ( 5 Km ). One can spend 1 hr to cover this while travelling to Sam . It is of historical significance .  Don't expect any restaurants/ food joints as it is complete deserted place.

title: Time pass
review: This place was very good for time pass. The place was filled with broken houses and  a temple where the maiden use to stay. Without knowing the story of this village you will not be able to understand anything. This place is good for photography. If you have extra time you can go there otherwise it is not worth a visit.

title: Spooky village in the middle of a desert
review: The abandoned village of Kuldhara presents one of the most riveting stories ever.A story that can send chills down your spines.Legend has it that a certain official Salim Singh fell in love with one of the girls from the village. But Kuldhara inhabitants being Paliwal Brahmins were against the proposal of marriage. Fearing persecutions in the form of higher taxes, thousands of inhabitants left this village overnight.Till date, nobody has been able to find out where they went or been able to trace their descendants. It is said that when they left, they cursed this village and so until today the village remains uninhabited.

title: Village named Haunted
review: The history of this place is sad. Kind of example of dictatorship era. Now gov is trying to promote this place for tourism and hence started making public utilities.

title: Drop by to witness the ruins
review: This abandoned village has a mysterious past. Few say it's cursed and haunted... now a sight seeing destination for travellers and tourists.

title: A bit underwhelming
review: Had lots of expectations hearing stories of abandoned village, haunted village etc., etc. But It did look a little underwhelming, and to top it, construction was happening on some of the houses which was a bigger dampener.

title: Intriguing piece of history
review: It was a great experience to witness Kuldhara in person after reading so many stories and watching the village on TV. It is worth a visit and gives good opportunity to click selfies, pics or capture the beauty of ruins via lens. Must see.

title: Good history
review: Not much to do here but the hospital of the haunted village is good. I took some good shots of deserted village. It’s worth stopping for 10 mins to have a look.

title: Haunted village Kuldhara
review: Kuldhara is known as Haunted village near the desert town of Jaisalmer. While roaming around all other sightseeing the Kuldhara is located on Khabha village route from Jaisalmer the 45 minutes drive from Jaisalmer Town. The ruin of Kuldhara has medieval time of history. The place is haunted as it is believed to be cursed by the Paludal Brahmin community. Though the authenticity of this fact is controversial as I have heard the story belongs to Khabha village but on internet the same story has been written for this village also.

title: Nothing special
review: We visited it during camel safari. Nothing much to see here or do. Does not deserve attention. Just pretty modern ruins

title: Ruins
review: There are ruins of many buildings. It was a populated place but now is abandoned and said to be haunted

title: No haunted feel to the village
review: Ruins of 200 years lay intact. Storyline not captured anywhere, and people wander around asking others, looking for signs of what this was.

title: On the way to desert
review: Kuldhara is an abandoned village for many years.The villagers, brahmins were tortured by the current Diwan, Salim Singh of Jaisalmer Fort and they left village overnight.There was nothing to see much except the ruins of the old village.

title: Fairy memories
review: Walk in this abandoned village in the middle of the desert is like exploring a three-dimensional tale. What would have been the life in this city !!

title: Abandoned
review: Picturesque but over rated

title: Deserted but not forgotten!
review: An interesting place to visit!

title: Listed as one of the haunted places in India
review: Worth visiting once to have a glimpse of how the village was set in olden times. The houses are still half preserved though renovation is going on

title: Very Cool Abandoned Village
review: This is a great stop on your way to your desert camel trek.  This village has been abandoned for 300 yrs.  Ruins are everywhere and there is a great temple.  They are restoring it so best to see soon!  I like seeing things the way they were without restoration.

title: Serene, solitary , deserted and yet so captivating
review: Who said abandoned and barren can't be beautiful? Check out Kuldhra - a village abandoned overnight by 400 families (approx) overnight some 400-500 years ago! Some of the houses are still intact. The govt. also confiscated a hidden treasure a few decades ago!!

title: Eerily beautiful
review: Close to the Sam dunes one should plan a short stop here on the way back from the camel safari. The ruins of this abandoned village are surprisingly beautiful and make for a great photo opportunity.

title: Spooky village in the desert
review: Most of you must have already read a lot about this place and the legend (?) of the tales here. I visited this in the late afternoon, and it seemed spooky then too (might be the reading up...). but the sight of hundreds of crumbling skeletons of houses, some in the process of being swallowed by the desert is eerie! The Govt is trying to make this more "touristy" by constructing a temple and completing a ruined house to give a glimpse of what they would look like if they had been finished. but all this activity ceases at sunset....it is said that no one ventures out here after sunset, definitely without getting some "experience" :P i didn't test the "spirits" here..... but the place is an interesting spot to see enroute Sam sand dunes....

title: Pretty Neat
review: This place is really cool. Make sure you have a guide to show you around and explain the history and architecture of the place.

title: Desolate and eerie
review: If time permits, visit this place when the sun is kinder as the heat would drive you away.

title: Just cooked up stories about ruins!
review: We reached here around 11 am and the place was abuzz with lots of youngsters, who were busy taking selfies and not concerned about any "Ghosts" in this town.  Found it to be just another abandoned village and nothing much of interest.

title: On they way to desert
review: We can see the ruins of the old village. Currently work is in progress to re build few important old huts and temples

title: Not so interesting
review: We visited the Kuldhara village, also known as haunted village. Now they have kept entry fees Rs 10 per person and per vehicle Rs 50. There was nothing to see much, only the deserted village. We asked the local about the village and they told that the village had been left by the people because the rajput had a bad intention on one of the girl from the village who was the daughter of the mukhiya, and they didn't want them to give her, and so they all decided to leave the village in one night only, cursing that no one can live there peacefully.

title: Nice
review: Nothing much to do...stories are mentioned on internet about the Village.

title: Abandoned village
review: Kuldhara is an abandoned village which was abandoned by the Paliwal brahmins as informed by the local guide there.

title: Not really much to see
review: Very sanitised now ... i was hoping to see a city being reclaimed by the desert but it is not like that.

title: Village Left Abandoned!
review: The villagers, brahmins were tortured by the current Diwan, Salim Singh of Jaisalmer Fort and they left village overnight and then later Thieves took away everything making the village abandoned.

title: Abandoned village for long time
review: Kuldhara is an abandoned village for many years. Lots of stories are floating about this place. You can visit this village and take good photographs. Its a different experience from other visits. Should visit at night and experience the surroundings and the village.

title: Quite ordinary
review: Nothing to write back home.

title: Good place
review: Very nice... though it's not a must visit place..but still good..we have visited in the dawn time ...they close by 6pm..while returning from SAM one can visit that place

title: An awesome experience...
review: If somebody is visiting Jaisalmer, this is a must visit on the way to the desert.

title: Nice place
review: I liked the place is really peaceful.

title: An uninhabited village whispering it's sighs in the air !
review: An uninhabited village deserted years back by the villagers in order to save their honour ! The astonishing part is the temple without it's idol who was picked up by its worshipers when they left their ancestral homes with a heavy heart. As one roams through this village, one almost experiences the air flowing though the village whispering it's sighs in the ears of it's visitors and narrating the saga of the hapless villagers who had to leave the village on a full moon night in order to save the honour of the girl on whom an evil eye was caste on her by a royal administrator. It's a must visit place if one wants to be lost in the reverie wondering as to what happened to the villagers once they abandoned the village and why Kuldhara was never ever inhabited by anyone else. Was it because of the fear of some haunted spirit ? Or, because of the curses left behind by it's inhabitants. The actual answers may not be available ever but one may just roam around this abandoned village to frame their own versions.

title: Don't go in the day as there is nothing interesting
review: In the day this site has nothing to offer other than ruins of a village, however it may look attractive to shutter bugs.

title: Terrible
review: There are recently constructed building in the so-called "abandoned village". It is like an poorly maintained amusement park with literally nothing to see.

title: abandoned village
review: A ride through an old abandoned village. Many buildings are not in good conditioned. visit during daylight

title: story of an abandoned village.
review: A story of paliwal brahmins leaving their home and village in the middle of night is narrated to every tourist visiting this place.Foreign tourists may find it mystic but actually there is nothing much to see here.There are just half constructed walls made of bricks,without plaster.Government has constructed a sort of demo house which is shown to tourists.

title: Deserted village
review: Kuldhara village in Rajasthan has a sad distressing history behind it. it is also known as the haunted place which is actually an abandoned village comprising of collapsed houses.  From the terrace of the houses  we get a virtual view of the deserted village. There is not much to see at this location, but it has gained importance due to the historical story.

title: Kuldhara - Pride Village
review: This is the place, where 84 villages were vacated overnight. People left there homes as it is to migrate to another safe place. Villagers took the decision to evacuate village due to social curse put on by the predecessors. Kuldhara villagers were the richest people with well cultured society in their times. But they have to left their homes to maintain their pride & honour. Hats off to their decision.

title: Lost village
review: Worth a stop when you are coming to Jaisalmer. Can spend half and hour and click some photos. Remnants of deserted Village can be seen at close quarters.

title: A great experience!
review: Went with family while going to visit Jaisalmer's sand dunes, we all enjoyed this place of medieval era! Enthralling experience!

title: Ruined by Indian insanity
review: We visited expecting an abandoned, isolated village in the middle of nowhere with a ghostly or eerie air about it, supposedly it is desserted with no one living there .. .   The truth is that when we visited at sundown tonight there were still a team of "Indian builders" laying a cobbled Road and spreading mud plaster across the reconstructed buildings. We were also robbed of 50rupees for the pleasure of watching these builders destroy any reminance of history that there once may have been. Not only that they are currently building a huge perimeter fence to prevent the hoards of people who live in the surrounding area from traveling through this supposedly abandoned village.

title: There is nothing out here
review: This place is absolutely ruined. There ia nothing to really see.

title: Nothing special
review: It was part of our desert safari, so we went there, it is an abandoned village, nothing much to see here.

title: Ghost Village
review: Nobody stays in this village abondoned by the villagers .... Government is trying to restore this place ..Max time to spend is 10 Mins

title: A hyped up place of ruins
review: True to Indian tales of adding melodrama - Kuldhara is a saga of villagers uniting against the king Salem Singh - they vacated the villages overnight coz they were against marrying off their Brahmin community girl to the Kshatriya King .. what is left now are ruins of broken walls and houses and a temple worth a see . What saddens me however is some renovation work happening which is diminishing the eerie essence of this place and the stoic history .. Locals charge rs 10 per person and rs 50 per vehicle (make sure you ask for the ticket back) - can be missed unless you really want photo ops with a backdrop of such a kind .. Can be abandoned from your to do list of Jaisalmer of you in a hurry

title: Amazing tales
review: Not much is left but it's interesting to listen to the story while imagining what it was like those days. Might be ghostly, might not be. Some ruins and temples can be of a great sight.

title: Historical place
review: Nice place with abdonad houses and temple. You feel the history. Must visit place in jaisalmer on the way to sam dunes

title: Ghost village before the Thar
review: The deserted village looked very calm and peaceful but it has a terrible history to it. We imagined how it would look at night!

title: Kuldhara Deserted and Haunted village
review: It is said to be a haunted village. The village has its 200 year old mud houses structure. The village was abandoned 200 years ago. No one lives there now. The Archaeological Survey of India has undertaken its repair work, but only during day time as gates to the village are closed after sunset.

title: Good
review: Good this cold ghost village was great I really like I hope see one time again thank you very very much happy

title: old abandoned village
review: 300 years back brahmins of 84 villages around left this place and went to Pali due to local kings attricities.he wanted to mary brahmin beautiful girl forcefully hence chief of kuldhra village abandoned this place and declared that who stays in village will face bad luck,all houses are ruins but worth visiting to know the history

title: Interesting stop over of a ruin
review: I wish the guides made this spot more interesting by adding anecdotes or even jokes about it. It is a 10 minute stop en-route to desert safari camps. Nothing much to talk about. An opportunity to click a few photos.

title: Haunted village in the desert
review: There's a story behind why this village was deserted and is now regarded as haunted. No signs so you probably need a guide. There is work going on to restore sections and you can clamber over deserted buildings and onto roofs with no guard rails. No entry charge for individuals just the car and no one to supervise.

title: The haunted ghost town of Rajasthan!
review: Before going here the manager of our hotel told us the story and we were quite amused to see how this village had actually been deserted by its inhabitants about 200 odd yrs ago. We were told that the villagers had deserted it bcoz Salim Singh wanted to marry the daughter of one of the Paliwal Brahmins and in those yrs inter religious marriages were totally looked down upon. It's interesting and many Bollywood movies have been shot here.

title: Abandoned yet visited
review: Surely a great attraction to visit the abandoned village. The ghost stories trailing around makes it more interesting and thrilling. Must to a guided trip. Select your preferred time, mid-night or day-time.

title: Nice place
review: I visited this place and it was really a nice place. The scenic view of this village is very worthy to visit. Old aged homes gives a mystic feeling..

title: Well maintained Old broken place.
review: Read articles about this place, being haunted and all. We went in a nice sunny morning, so did not find any adrenaline rush or eerie feeling. Though the place is kept very clean and the sandstone look bright golden in the sun. Very few crowd means calmness and peaceful area too.

title: Interesting time pass
review: This is a stop along the way to the camal safari.  It is worth the stop  just to see the buildings and listed to the fables as to why it is empty.  Each tour guide tells a slightly different story.  When I was there, they were atrting to do a sizable repair and renovation of the area so it will loose part of its charm I am sure.

title: Haunted village that was abandoned overnight centuries ago...
review: Ghost towns and villages hold a charm altogether different from that of other historical places such as palaces and forts, mostly because they give us a chance to peep right into the lives of the people who once inhabited them. Being a desert region, Rajasthan has no dearth of ghost villages however a couple of them have received more attention such as Bhangarh and Kuldhara, perhaps due to the legends associated with them. While we were in Jaisalmer, it was quite natural for us to desire a visit to Kuldhara, and so we did.

title: fascinating
review: Had heard a lot bout the abandoned village.. Nothing haunted about it but it sure does give u creeps. the entire village just went away in one night.. leaving everything behind. u can still see how the village is being preserved ... must visit if in jaisalmer

title: Indeed Abandoned..
review: This place has nothing much to see. Just broken walls all around. They have made a sample house to give an idea how the houses would have been at that time.

title: Spooky Folklore but a Delightful Visit
review: Ruins and then 'Haunted Ruins' seems a "NO GO" but then if you simply drive here and explore, you will be amazed and taken back in time too. Offshoot on the way to Sam from Jaisalmer. Better visit during the Day (Broad Daylight) to avoid any 'Hizzibijjies' !!

title: Visit to Jaisalmer
review: We visited this place since my daughter was insisting for it. It is located 5 Kms from the main road. The entry fee is charged by local villagers. You can witness old houses and a different atmosphere in that place. Although we did not get out from our car but did not find any specific in that place. A resort is coming just next to that place. Still people who love adventure, can certainly have a walk around that place.

title: Ruins. Meaningless without knowing a bit of its history.
review: Not much to see or understand. Meybe reviewing the history brhind would have more meaning. I went fossil-hinting to the riverbanks outside the enclosure. Pretty good!

title: Deserted town near the desert
review: This was an eerie place to visit, especially knowing the history. There are efforts to restore some of the buildings which gives you a better idea of how the people lived here. Worth a visit.

title: Haunted Village
review: As the story speaks that this village is haunted, you won't exactly meet a ghost but this place place has a eerie vibe to it. and the place is not fully abandoned people are there

title: Abandoned
review: This village has an interesting story to it.. though not everybody is sure about that story.. the ruins are nice.. if this place is on the way then a visit is cool..

title: Haunted place to visit
review: As per story this place is haunted, must visited place in Jaisalmer. Its great experience to view old house constructions. You get great views and feelings of history.

title: Excite, but everything went off the fuss
review: Heard a lot of stories about the village, so thought to visit the same but after reaching there my views already got changed. It is totally destroyed the tourism is re-building the whole village for tourism purpose. But you can skip it off.

title: History unraveled
review: This place has some historical facts, which are difficult to confirm but are shared by locals. These abandoned houses are getting a facelift to create interest of tourists.

title: A Trip to Abandoned haunted village
review: A little over 20 kilometers to the west of the desert town of Jaisalmer in Rajasthan, lies Kuldhara. The houses are almost in the same condition as they were left behind by their inhabitants. As I climb up the steps of one such home, I can see the entire expanse of the village. Lanes and brick homes, equidistant from each other, are neatly laid out. As the sun sets across the sand dunes, the gates of Kuldhara are closed by the locals of the neighboring villages.

title: Not worth at all
review: God knows what tourists are expected to see. Don't waste time going here . Everything looks artificial set up

title: Abandoned village with a tragic past
review: The village dates back to the 13th century, with beautiful Rajasthani architecture, seen in temples, step wells etc.

title: Hunted place
review: This place is also very haunted because the story of kuldhara was was so hunting and the room and houses not developed since the village has been left by people.

title: Haunted place
review: A kuldhara is village which is famous like ghost area. This village is so old and it's story is superb & haunted.

title: Visited for academic purpose.
review: Excellent place to view the lifestyle and habitats of pali brahmins.

title: Mysterious deserted city
review: This was a pleasant experience, although the town was abandoned for sad reasons.  A good opportunity to see traditional desert homes and walk thru a quiet place away from crowds.

title: Ghost village
review: Our group visit this village it was so great and amazing we see some old house.

title: Very meh
review: There's basically nothing to see here, it's just run- down buildings. The story is a little interesting, but the place is totally forgettable.

title: Deserted village deep in the desert
review: A beautiful ruin with a lovely, if slightly creepy history. A visit to this was included on the camel safari I partook in through Hotel Fifu. Well worth a look! It's very hot though, so perhaps a fleeting visit!

title: A short visit worthy
review: Legend has it that Kuldhara is an abandoned, mystical, haunted heritage site. I was curious to know more about it, the more I read. But in the day time if you visit, it doesn't really seem haunted. On the contrary, it is fascinating.

title: A visit to this haunted place
review: A few kilo away from the city of jaisalmer, an old city which is almost in ruins and is supposed to be a haunted place is a nice place to visit when in jaisalmer.

title: Spook out
review: Visit the place past midnight for true experience. When the darkness surrounds you and fills you . A lot of myth surrounds the place though . Worth a visit at night daytime it's just any other abandoned village .

title: Visit only if you have time to kill.
review: A ruined village with an interesting past. Don't believe the guys when they tell you stories about ghosts at night. Been there at midnight personally. Probably a yarn spun by the people to attract tourists. Nothing great to see. Not worth wasting your time, unless you have spare time to kill.

title: Village of Mysterious History
review: After hearing the mysterious myth of Kildhara village, We have visited this village during out Rajasthan trip just for curiosity. Here I have seen hundreds of abandoned house, temple etc. of ancient village

title: Should visit
review: We had been at Kudhara Heritage Village

title: Abandoned haunted village
review: Kuldhara is Abandoned haunted village near Jaisalmer. Many years back, all villagers left this place as Kings close person ask a girl to marry him else he will kill all. There are many version of stories available by local.

title: Kuldhara ruins
review: Nice stories and glipmses of the past, quite amusing story and recounts narrated by the locals about this village, we went during the day would wonder if there are any review about any nightout in this place to confirm the sory

title: Abandoned village
review: This place may be visited as a part of the desert safari package. An worth-seeing place. Please try to include this monument in your itinerary.

title: nice experience..
review: Calm.. broken homes..

title: I would not pay or go out of the-way to visit it!
review: When should you avoid it or skip this village?

title: Visited this village in May 2016
review: When you visit this village, you get an eerie feeling. The entire village evacuated after the Village Head refused to marry off his daughter to a low caste man as she was a brahmin. This happened 600 years ago. Our eerieness increased when a solitary old woman started approaching us.

title: Mystery
review: We don't know why an entire village left in one night: is it the refuse to marry the daughter with a maharajah or just the increase in taxes? It is a beautiful melancholic place - under construction.

title: Deserted Desert
review: Another fantastic trip by Pol Haveli Desert Tour

title: Village Ruins.. Good view from the top
review: Worth spending 15mins on the way to Sam. There is a great story behind the abandoned village- ask your guide about it. Excellent photo opportunities from the rooftop.

title: Nothing village
review: Find only debris and nothing else. There are some different stories surrounding the village, but nothing special about this place as lot of development activities done by present generation devoid the past glory.

title: An interesting stop
review: It's interesting to see this abandoned village, still largely intact, providing you have a knowledgeable guide to explain why it was abandoned and why it's still as it is! You'll pay to view this - but note that there are a number of similar abandoned villages in the vicinity and they can be seen without charge!

title: Empty
review: Really  empty  village. No public live there 20 KM far from jaisalmer. Not good actually  if you go to desert then this village on the way main road to turn Left 4 KM.

title: Ghost village
review: We visit this village it was so great and old time village

title: Unexpected treat in the middle of wilderness
review: Strange feeling to visit a village abandoned many centuries ago.  Many homes are still intact.  Must see.

title: Nothing great but they show you while going to the Sand Dunes
review: No special efforts required to visit this place. The tour operators take you to this place while proceeding to Sand Dunes. Its a totally abandoned village. The houses are in bad shape. Rather the shape is no more of a house. Seems the tourism department is redeveloping this village. May be after a year or so it will be a nice place to watch,

title: What a amazing place !
review: It's a amazing place with a unique story with it . 15000 people left in one night because of a cruel minister 400 years ago and never came back .. amazing place I love it .

title: Nice
review: This was a very new place to visit. The organisers told us about the story of this place which made it even more interesting.

title: Ghosts, Stories and history
review: Located outside jaisalmer, this place has an interesting storyline and a lot of history to boot. You can spend a lot of time Roaming around the ruins. Please avoid during the noon as it can be pretty hot. If you are  lucky, you might even catch film shooting nearby.

title: Okayish
review: We went there for a half hour visit on way towards the dunes.

title: Nothing Like what stories tell
review: Dont visit this place! You wont find any thing which is told in the stories. Government is just renovating this place just to make it a tourist spot, but nothing like what the stories says.

title: A lot of things are desired
review: This is a piece of history, which caught the fancy of tourists recently. However it is in total wilderness, no guide Though some work is going on and ticket is also being charged for entry into village, but the lack of guide or any signboards is clearly felt.

title: Mysterious history
review: We hired a jeep and driver to visit Kulhara, about a 30 minute drive from Jaiselmer. We allowed ourselves less than an hour to roam around and that was enough. Then we quietly watched the sun go down over the old, tumbling down, long deserted village. There is an intriguing story/legend as to why the villages abandoned the village and what became of them. Most buildings are in a state of considerable disrepair, which makes for some nice photos.

title: A ghost village !!!!! But not so scary !!!
