review: We had gone on 14 th February, 2017 in the day time and one can see the ruins of an old village which has some interesting story about the residents who just vanished and abandoned the village. But now the Govt. authorities are rebuilding some part of the village houses and temple. One must visit.

title: Deserted village...
review: A bit over-hyped place, Kuldhara is about 30 mins drive from Jaisalmer City. Nothing much to offer, except for photography.

title: Feeling of abandonment
review: The Kuldhara village gives you the sense of abandonment. The broken houses, deserted place gives the same feeling. But  no sense of fear is there. A building is being renovated there which removes any longingness of the past.

title: Kuldhara Abandoned village
review: As they said that the 84 villages were inhabited by Paliwal Brahmins.One of their daughter was demanded by the minister and the whole villages were moved over night to a different destination just to protect the girls pride. The remains of these deserted village is seen here with their living stile and historically rich artisan.

title: Doubtful story...better avoid
review: Every tourist visits this forsaken so-called abandoned village prompted by fables from various medium. However, no traces of a 500 years old ruin is visible, what meets eyes instead is a some structure/s in the middle of nowhere which is apparently being reconstructed to preserve the history. It is strange to note that there is not even a signboard of Archaelogical Survey of India, nor are there approach roads to a "500-year old historical monument". The brick inlay appears quite recent work and the ornate facades are available all over Jaisalmer town in almost every other house.

title: ultimate place to visit, but...
review: But visit early in morning or Evening. Otherwise it was too hot.

title: The Haunted Villege
review: Its a world heritage sight. You can experience the nothingness of life over here. Govt can make a short film and plan some other activities so that it becomes more popular

title: The cursed village
review: This,now famous place,can is about 30 Km from Jaisalmer.The best way to visit is to plan short visit to this place while going to Desert safari.As per stories,about 80+ villages were inhabited in surrounding of this village Suddenly all these village were abandoned by villagers who were Paliwal Brahmins.

title: Spooky
review: It will start a thought process I. Your mind and a series of questions: what would have happened here?

title: Interesting Visit.
review: Hi.

title: Ruins which are avoidable
review: These are ruins of an erstwhile village.

title: must to visit
review: Good to know about story behind the kuldhara village, if you didnt ever visited any village than its a must to visit place for you. a real mud made house.

title: Nice quite place to vsit
review: Its ideal to visit this abandoned village on way to Sand dunes. But not so good to visit only for this place far from city. Govt. is also constructing small patches of village & park to this for tourist attraction. The place is missing with informative signs for tourist.

title: Felt Cheated
review: A mere story heard verbally created a curiosity to visit only to be disappointed with nothing worth visiting. A waterhole that is dry and a few abandoned stone structures are all there to see. Thus one feels cheated when they charge  money for cars and visitors with zero facilities or infrastructure

title: Must see location n
review: kuldhara is must see location of jaisalmer city . very well maintained and we enjoyed a lot with family

title: Ghost village (must visit)
review: It was very nice and old village. Village  story was very interesting  if are you go jaisalmer so visit this place

title: Nothing much, little boring
review: This is supposed to be a haunted village on way to Sam's Sand Dune. Nothing much except some deserted huts. RTDC seems to be trying to restore this place as a tourist attraction. Avoid it unless you have lot of time to kill

title: See it to believe it !
review: The concept of an abandoned village might not appeal to all, but that is how it is. Rows of broken houses and dilapidated buildings, all vacant and barren. It is an archaeological site and is undergoing some restoration.

title: Don't Miss
review: This village is one of the 84 villages that was abandoned in the matter of one night as the story goes. When you stand on the roof of one of the renovated houses and look around and think about the people used to live there and how they have left you ought to get a strange feeling.....

title: Not recommended
review: When I visited this place construction work was going on. They are building a village on the same spot. There is nothing like haunted here.

title: Must Visit !!!
review: While on the way to Sam Sand Dune (Desert National Park) from Jaisalmer city we had visited to Kuldhara. Really it's amazing and historical place. Must have to see while travel to Jaisalmer.

title: Nothing of any tourist attracton.
review: The place is totally abandoned. Presently the old rock and brick peices are being restored to mame it a look eye catching for the tourists. Better information can be found on internet. Not worth for common tourists to spend and see the place.

title: Ancient ruins
review: Ghost village abondoned in one night by 'palliwals '  on coercion by a mughal king  demanding  a duaghter of the village .

title: Good!!
review: It is just an abundant village but people told us lot of stories that it is haunted village but it is not true!!!...There are some old houses which are under take care..

title: Long drive and not much to see
review: The village is one of several abandoned villages near Jaisalmer. However, it is quite far from the city and there is nothing much to see apart from half constructed buildings that have been abandoned

title: Disappointing
review: Story about this village is far more fascinating then the actual place. You have to cover great distance from Jaisalmer to visit the village and it is not worth it!!!

title: Good piece of history
review: The place is not so far from city. Only few things to see here and some things are remodeled. This place really needs more information, the stories surrounding the reason why it was abandoned need more credibility but overall its worth checking out.

title: ULTIMATE HISTORY AND NATURE
review: Nice place to visit...i stayed here for 3 nights in dreamline bunglows in kuldhara.

title: Noting going there....
review: No historical evidence of ther popular story why the village was abandoned.If you walk a km further, you can see shell stones and sedimentary rocks.

title: Good piece of work
review: Kuldhara is known for an abandoned village which is at a great distance from jaisalmer. Known for some fascinating stories, yet a good piece of work done by the people on how they built the house from stones. Good piece of silence will be will make your day.

title: Nice Experience
review: The best time to visit this place is after midnight. It'll give you a haunted feeling. and an experience of a kind.

title: Disastrous Kuldhara
review: Some new commercial constructions and artificial designing has marred this old abandoned Rajasthan village. Doesn't look like an archaeological site. Shops selling chips, cold drinks and tea dot the heritage location. Most of the tour operators take there but it is a waste of time.

title: Interesting story to it
review: We went here as a package with our safari one can do that. Not much to see we spent like half an hour here. It's around 30kms from jaiselmer. the feel of being in a place with a story is nice should go if paranormal activites and stories intrigue you.

title: Nice place
review: Kuldhara village is a great place to visit once you understand the history behind the place. Good location to roam around and click some pics.

title: Its ok to miss this spot
review: Theres nothing to see there, the guides will tell different stories about the place, but the site is just like a small village with broken houses. These structures now dont even seem like they were houses once upon a time. Dont go there with a lot of expectations.

title: Interesting story, not so interesting place!
review: We visited this place in Jan, 2017.

title: Good place to visit
review: Nice place to visit it's a must see location  while visiting jaisalmer very well maintained recommended to others

title: Not so great tourist location
review: So this was a village that was abandoned overnight by the residents because someone associated with royal family or army wanted to marry a girl from this place and they were against it. (Story as told by my driver). So they cursed the area and the place. Anyone will tell you that its not haunted or anything but the authorities don't want people visiting a place which is supposed to be a tourist attraction. It has lots of broken homes and to put it in one word its an old abandoned village which can be visited max within 30 minutes. Btw there are many such abandoned villages in Rajasthan because that's how earlier people lived depending on the availability of surrounding resources.

title: great place
review: the place is really interesting to see, def reccommend! It is fairly big  but you don't need much time to see it

title: Must Visit
review: It offers a different kind of experience and it has rich story behind it. One must visit, as its not far from Jaisalmer.

title: Didn't feel anything Scary
review: Poor maintenance, Nothing looks scary only thing is nice pictorial view from one of the only house at that place. Currently used only for Films. Many stories are there but nothing give you a reason to feel fear.

title: Very quaint
review: The visit to Kuldhara was unique as we had not seen anything like it before. There seems to be some work going on to give it more tourist appeal. This is needed too else you are lost on how to understand the experience

title: Haunted?
review: We were taken to this place on our way to the desert. We were the first to visit in the morning. It was fun explaining the ruins. Even the air feels like something is wrong here.

title: The Haunted Village
review: We went to this village on our way to camp. Whole village is abandoned and has an interesting story. The Govt is restoring the buildings.

title: Abandoned village due to a Sin
review: If one has to go by the story, this place which is the entire village was abandoned overnight by the residents because the local prince wanted to forcefully marry the daughter of a family without their consent who left it with a Sin and ever since it is deserted. You will only find broken walls of houses which are being restored. Nothing special to witness at this place.

title: Mostly a pile of stones
review: This is a pretty average place we visited while on our way to the sam sand dunes , there is pretty much nothing left expect a dilapidated stone well and some run down stone houses  from an  erstwhile era , pretty boring as per my personal preference , can be missed , rather visit the more exquisite lodurva temple nearby.

title: A Historical and Interesting Village
review: Kuldhara Abandoned Village is the must visit place if you come to explore Jaisalmer.The Village is situated about 30 kms from the Jaisalmer.The ruins are scattered over a vast area.I recommend you to visit this place with a Local guide who will tell many interesting stories related to this village.

title: Not a must see
review: There is nothing to see as such. You can visit just for the sake of seeing an empty village with some ruins. If you walk a km further, you can see shell stones and sedimentary rocks (I guess), a proof of once existing ocean in Thar (I guess)

title: Abandoned village with not much to offer
review: About 30 kms from jaisalmer.

title: read google before you go.
review: Read google before you go else you will miss the charm of this abandoned village. Anyway this also getting commercialized.

title: Not much to see, too far from the city
review: Believed to be abandoned and haunted, there are just a few ruins to see. The structures look interesting & you could snap a few good photos. Though many of the ruins are being restored, so not sure how much would be the original structure. This place is quite far from the city, so if you don't have too much time in hand, please avoid this place else it would be just plain disappointment.

title: Haunted Village
review: Good place to explore history of people living in this place and know about the story of it ruin and may be curse .

title: Just to tick-off the list
review: We weren't much interested to see this one, but nevertheless went as it was en route our camel safari. Please do try & arrange a guide beforehand if planning to understand Kuldhara, else its not interesting at all.

title: A waste of time
review: Nothing to see there. While we have visited many places which are Ruins this one is just not worth a visit.

title: On your way to Sam Sand dunes
review: Know the history of the village before you go or else there is nothing much to see. A 300 yr old abandoned village spread in the midst of the desert. Its about 20 kms from jaisalmer and you can visit it on your way to sam sand dunes. There is an entry fee and parking fee too, The government is renovating the village to make it more attractive for tourists.

title: Deserted village, with some great intrigue value
review: Outside the town, en route to the desert camps, all tourists make a stop at this deserted village. The completed temples and home look fascinating. However, this place is not necessarily a must see - if one happens to travel this way, one can stop by.

title: Best experience
review: Excellent experience. Lovely stàff . Excellent service with reasonably good food.nice music programme.

title: Attraction under construction
review: The legend of the Kuldhara village is far more interesting than the actual ruins. It is still being restored and being promoted as a tourist attraction in Jaisalmer. There are no toilet facilities at all. The driver told us "khulle mein jao" or "go in the open". This while the city is decorated with ODF (Open Defecation Free) India. Swacch Bharat.

title: Kuldhara
review: If you have the choice please do not visit this place. It was a complete disappointment. Not only there is nothing much to see but whatever there is has been destroyed in an attempt to promote tourism.

title: Amazing
review: This is a must visit. When you go there you feel so different. There is a unique sadness in the air. It is a completely deserted place and there is hardly a soul to be found

title: Ruins badly run down
review: It is too much of the hay-ho about this place but nothing special or worthwhile to visit for now. Kuldhara can be developed and presented properly to the tourists by the authorities.

title: Kuldhara - Depends on you how you look at it
review: 40 kms from Jaisalmer. As per the legend a haunted village. No one stays after sunset. Numerous bollywood movies shot here. Nothing much to see apart from hundreds of ruined houses standing quite. One building renovated by govt where you can climb up to first floor &  take an aerial view of the village.  Felt like it has got some story to tell you. Or do not know if I was overthinking when I heard the story. Some how I liked the place. Hence, My title of the review says 'depends on you how you look at it". Soft drinks are available in a van if you want to buy some. Spend some time, take snaps. 30-45 mins enough. Move ahead.

title: AMAZING
review: The fact that a whole village can move out of their homes overnight amazed me though I was sure there would not be much to see as such. I was right as far as this was concerned but the thought that a whole village abandoned their homes overnight created interest. The cause also leaves one wondering whether this whole thing about caste can ever bring about any happiness to anyone. Apparently it was a village of Brahmins and either the King or Diwan who was crossing it to get married to a princess liked a girl and instructed the villagers to keep the girl prepared to be married to him on his way back. A Brahmin girl could not be given away to a Kshatriya king! This made the entire village leave their homes overnight. What could be more amazing. Some construction work is being done but I hope that does not interfere with the abandoned look, overgrown plants which send shivers down your spine. Those who like history and can relate should go or else give it a skip.

title: The Haunted Village
review: Its a amazing historical sight! Dating back to 250 yrs, this village stands in its abandoned, raw form where once hearths burned, prosperity of the Palli tribe was well known! The village with magical powers of the villagers, are still in in air, it has a deep Mesmerizing effect while walking through those lanes, the spirit lives on. , even centuries later! People warn you not toenture here at night, and no one does, some souls still come looking for their roots and abodes. An enriching experience to be there.

title: Story Attract U, Place May be..?
review: Story of a abandoned Places always attract Human beings. Few believe, few not! Few afraid, few not!

title: Abandoned and ruined but not forgotten
review: Kuldhara is an abandoned village around 30 km from Jaisalmer city on the way to Sam sand dunes. Once a thriving village now what is left of it are broken walls all around. Though there is not much to see around but those interested in exploring ruins can certainly enjoy the visit. Locals with some help from government have tried to restore few houses to attract tourists and give a feeling of what it was to live around those days. There is some nominal entry fee for tourists and vehicles entering here. It is good place for photography so make sure to pack your DSLR's for this trip. Must visit place in Jaisalmer.

title: Haunted.
review: The village is being restored in part for tourists, according to locals it is haunted and one must not bring anything back from this village as it is supposed to bring bad luck.

title: Just for your satisfation
review: There's a entrance fee to visit this village. Very evident that place wasn't conserved to be tourist site. They are now constructing few structures & restoring whatever possible. Houses that can be seen from inside are recently constructed. Original ones very few left.

title: And one night all the villagers abandoned the village....
review: There is a folklore around this village which the local guide would tell you. You should explore what the story is :)

title: Khuldhara Abandoned Village
review: An entry fee of 10/- per head and 50/- for each vehicle applicable.

title: Nothing much to see
review: There's nothing much see except for a step well and some old houses. Its being developed as tourist attraction with a entry fee

title: Nice place
review: Nice place to visit its must see location while travelling to jaisalmer we have enjoyed with families and friends

title: Poor
review: Just demolished houses.Repairing work is going on.Not maintained.Nothing much to see.Only left remains of houses

title: Experience of Ruins
review: Around 30 minute activity. Will be admired by history lovers mainly. Well maintained but there should be attempt to put display boards with details of its historical importance.

title: Visited because its on d way and have heard it's haunted.. :D
review: It's abandoned village. Ruined completely. Now work has been started to redevelop this village. Nothing much.

title: Eerie story
review: 85 villages empty overnight... The story is so terrifying that you cannot stop yourself from goin there to see it yourself. Peaceful pace, 18 km from jaisalmer. nice ride on bike. Visits allowed only during day time.

title: Overrated , absolutely irrelevant
review: This site completely ronger and there is nothing look around. No historical evidence of ther popular story why the village was abandoned. Don't waste time and money on this spot. The tourism department is remaking few houses in the village so as to make it a tourist spot now which is again absolutely goes against the authenticity of the village.

title: Visit for its History
review: You may not like to miss this abandoned village by Paliwal Brahmins some 250 years ago due to unknown reasons. As can be read on internet it is mentioned as a haunted village. Govt is trying to develop it as a major attraction with a museum and a motorable road. The ruins may excite you but there are no local guides whom you can hire, so collect some material if you want to know more. Entry ticket with car is Rs 50 including all passengers, so don't pay extra.it is sad to see beer bottles, plastic waste scattered around by people and surely those are not the remains of paliwal period. Other than ruined houses and an old temple we cannot see household utensils, artifacts as was informed by some.

title: Is it overhyped?
review: A little under whelming after having heard so much about it. While we didn't doubt the story surrounding the abandoned village, not as exciting as what it was made out to be.

title: Kuldhara
review: This place is a bit hyped one. Some say this is a haunted palce but doesnot look like .Good place for shooting and similar stuff. Nothing much to be explored over here. One or two step wells can be seen. Roads are being laid mow and should be ready in a another couple of months. If sort of time can give it a miss .You will not be missing much.

title: Haunted village can be skipped
review: Just a deserted village look with broken down houses around

title: Not worth the hype created of the place
review: It is a good place to visit but not worth the hype created around it. Again the place has few facilities and is very off the road towards the Sam. Its a place again to see the traditional houses that can be found in Rajasthani villages. It would have been worth if the vehicles were allowed to take a trip of the village. Sadly you need to walk the place around which may be tiring in the hot sun.

title: Just ruins, nothing else
review: You would read on internet that this place is haunted, but to be honest even the locals don't believe it to be so. Moreover, the temple and the buildings around it have all been restored and the restoration was still going on when we visited. So I would suggest to skip it.

title: Visit if you want but can be skipped
review: The place has great photography sites and can also be visited for history. The village is just off road from Jaisalmer-sam road. The place is underconstruction by ASI

title: Haunted place
review: If you are fond of haunted place visit this area. It is said after 5 PM no body stays in this area in fear of ghosts who haunts this place

title: Visit if possible, otherwise can be skipped.
review: It was on our way to Desert camp. We got down to take a few snaps of this place. Nothing much to see.

title: Historical place
review: Nice place to visit during visit to Sam sand dunes. Got to see abandoed place but since it is now developing I guess it will loose its sheen.

title: Not such a great place
review: Not much to see, they are in process of creating the village. You can visit it on the way to Sam Dunes.

title: Historic piles of rocks in the desert
review: If this place comes en route to/from a desert camp then stop by but don't make a dedicated trip.  Don't expect much from this spot, it's only ruins (more like piles of rocks) in the desert.  Having said that, I found I enjoyed walking amongst the ruins, and its extensive enough that you can get away from the tourists milling around the entry area (where they have the temple and juice truck, etc.). There is this moment when you're looking down a row of silent empty ruins and feel a profound wonderment about the families that once inhabited this place.  FYI there is nothing haunted here, it was just abandoned, no one died in unusual circumstances.  Overall, a shameless ploy by locals to build up a tourist business, what doesn't make sense is the development they are doing, why put up a temple and other buildings and in many places rebuild walls, etc. when it's meant to be an archaeological preserve?

title: nothing interesting
review: jus the tale of haunted village is interesting.nothing much to see. jus abandoned houses.but you can get an idea how ppl lived in those years.

title: The abandoned Village !!!
review: We visited this place after seeing the Rajasthan govt tourism ad which showed tourists exploring this place at night. But our cab driver said they dont allow tourists to visit this place at night and so we visited this place in the morning. The village has an interesting story being it and it was really sad to see such a big village in total ruins now. It seems they are reconstructing certain parts of the village.

title: beautiful rubble with a sad story behind
review: this place is on the way to Sam sand dunes and is full of rubbles of houses of the inhabitants who left it in one night. The story behind this village is sad and you can feel the sadness when you are there. Few of the houses are being restored to show how they actually lived.

title: The Haunted village
review: The famous haunted village along with 84 other small villages which was abandoned in one night. Kuldhara was the biggest and is the heritage of Jaisalmer. Its beauty can be measured only when one visits the palce.

title: Disappointing
review: The place is badly done up - No signboards, no history mentioned. There is no-one around to explain anything and clearly no ghosts around!

title: A desolate place
review: A great place if the background of such desolation is known. The Government is making up the abandoned village. Some mud huts have been built up. But no habitation around. The place is around 5 kms from the main road leading to desert highland called SAM. Must visit. The entry of vehicles are monitored but has a harrowing parking place with no body to be seen around.

title: really haunted and scary
review: as per its name its abandoned nothing nearby and inside village apart from a van standing outside visit and selling cold drink chips in daytime only.. you won't catch any ghost in daytime but you can spot many poisonous snakes and thier houes.. spend an hour and enjoyed a lot.. 1 hr drive from jaislmer.. must visit when going to Sam from jaisalmer.. 1 hr required to visit. must carry your water bottle and camera.. i alos found an underground room which was very scary and creepy..

title: Still the real deal
review: Great experience to a sight and a story which is on the way towards Sam from Jaisalmer. Not sure why the administration is ruining it by reconstructing the village...should be left as it is instead of jazzing it up and turning it into a fake, dolled up movie set.

title: Haunted village :)
review: Nice place...abondoned village look haunted if u stay there alone but not in day time..there are lot of tourist..

title: Complete waste of time
review: There is nothing worthwhile to see just some empty structures and ongoing construction,possibly due to lack of tourist assistance, there is more to this place than what we saw but despite being a lover of culture and history, found this best avoidable

title: Must go to place
review: As heard from the stories this is an abondaned village. It is situated 20kms away from the jaisalmer city. You can go and visit this village before 6 pm as after that it will be closed.

title: Haunted destination
review: Multiple stories emerging for this village- of love, hatred, revenge, a must see but during day time

title: Nothing to see - can skip
review: 20 km from jaisalmer and on way to sam dunes. One can do it either while going for dessert camp or thr next day morning while driving back to jaisalmer. There is a turn off from main road (watch out for the signs) and 5 km from there. Rs 10 per person + Rs 50 for car. Most of the houses are broken piles of tiles with no roof. 3 buildings at the start have access to terrace for clicking photos. Nothing much to see - one can skip it.

title: Unbelievable in modern times
review: We reached jaisalmer at about 3 pm at the Hotel Rawalkot and the driver of our vehicle insisted on getting freshen up fast. He said we have to reach the village Kuldhara before 4.30 pm. We were surprised as the distance was not much, about 20 km, and there was enough sunlight with time for sunset. But he said it is an haunted village nobody to remain there beyond the given time. It is an old abandoned village, now ruled by ghosts. He gave a story of pandits, who were assassinated by the king as one of them had fell in the love with the princes.

title: Haunted village...
review: Its on the way of sand dunes, and it will not take more then an hour to visit it, so in my opinion its good to visit once, i have never seen such type of place.

title: Only if you love history!
review: We visited this place which at first seemed a waste of time. As we started walking around, we came across a few things which amazed us - the water reservoir built of massive stones, the stone houses and the fact this place is in the middle of nowhere!

title: A village with a tragic past...
review: On our way to the sand dunes, we stopped for a visit at this abandoned village. History recounts that over 200 years ago, a lesser Raj of Jaisalmer who was of the warrior cast wanted to marry a woman from the village, but because she was of a higher cast, Brahmin, the village leaders refused. Angry he sent his soldiers and over 2 days massacred over 3,000 villagers. The rest fled abandoning the village never to return. Although a tragic story, it's a worthwhile visit.

title: Great History of Paliwals
review: Since we started our Jaisalmer trip, we heard about the history of Paliwals and it was really interesting. Moreover, there was a friend among us who was Paliwal to ignore or avoid visiting Kuldhara - but indeed it was worth visiting this place knowing about the planned way this village was constructed and the way those people lived some 700 years ago and why Paliwals left the 85 villages overnight to never return.

title: Hauntingly beautiful
review: It is said to be haunted but it is beautiful. It is associated with jaisalmer  king who fell in love with a brahmin girl from kuldhara.

title: Overhyped place
review: There are plenty of such abandoned villages in India. The locals said that it's Aaj Tak news channel who publicize this village as haunted village.

title: A good to see place.
review: You can just visit there while you are on the go towards sand dunes. They have recently started restoring few of the houses. During day time does not seem to be a haunted place.

title: Nice place to visit and take snaps
review: In between Jaisalmer and the desert camps..this village makes for an interesting stop..This is known as Haunted village..and makes up for some amazing photography..

title: Not worth a visit
review: Rumour goes with haunted stories but this place is not haunted. Just a simple story behind of villagers who left it overnight and a cursed place. There is nothing to see as such that people go & spend money on such village where you will not find anything apart from just bricks.

title: Nice village
review: Our hotel was just 300 meters aways from this place , we have visited this village in morning.. now govt of Rajasthan is developing this place a tourist place and this will be great attraction of place I. Years to dome.

title: Waste of money, not worth it at all
review: We went here as part of the desert tour and had to pay entrance fee. There is nothing to see really, the site doesnt look historic at all. It seems to be a tourist trap.

title: Must see
review: If you're looking for a place full of history, here you can find a great option. It's open  for visit on your way to safari, so it's very good for a stop, to take some pictures and have a great view to the entire place.

title: needs  to be done more
review: No guide  not mentioned anywhere in place history keep looking for 80 year old man to tell u the history. need to be improved if you want vistors to visit this place.

title: Was worth the trip
review: It is a good place to visit en-route sam dunes. The place has history and knowing this place brings you close to Jaisalmer.

title: I don't get this
review: I really don't get why this abandoned village is a tourist attraction.  There are paved roads to a parking lot, every camel safari tour stops here, you get out and walk around a reconstructed empty building.  You can see the ruins of abandoned houses in every direction.  It said to be about 300 years old.  I really don't see the point of this.

title: Nothing much to see
review: Situated between Jaisalmer and Sam sand dunes. This place has nothing much to see. Can skip this place if short of time

title: Haunted
review: Great place to be,scary and awesome, haunted you can be nice click out there,village is disaster  but you get awesome  photos.

title: Ruins of a village that once was
review: The Kuldhara village is a 40 min drive from the main town of Jaisalmer. It will remind you of a place that once was bustling with activity but is in complete ruins today. There are legends abound why the village was abandoned hundreds of years ago. There isn't much by way of documented history at the site so it is mostly a place where you go, see and them come back. You can visit this place if you have time.

title: Abandoned village.
review: There isnt much to write about this abandoned village,  It takes very little time to go round and explore but take a camera as there are some nice photo shots to be had. Some buildings are being restored so in the future it might be an interesting visit. It is on the way to the sand dunes where you can take a camel ride and see the wonderful sunset from the sand dunes. There is also the opportunity to have a meal and watch the entertainment after your evening camel ride.

title: nice place
review: it's a good place to visit but the changes made by government to make it a tourist place will be responsible for it's lose of naturalism

title: Ok to visit

Could be better maintained with some guide and story written. While the abandoned village story adds a lot to it but it still didn't live upto our expectations. Just be careful, SatNav went wrong for us. Had to take help from passerby.

title: Kuldhara Abandoned Village
review: Kuldhara Abandoned Village situated 18km. from jaisalmer, on the road to sam sand dune sightseeing attraction for history lover and romantic and thrill lover.

title: Ok place to visit

title: not worth place

review: Jaisalmer is a tourist place and there has to be some attractions to attract people to visit that place. We also went there but found nothing. Its totally Barren land with broken houses.

title: amazing experience
review: alway wanted to visit this place because its story was so catchy. 600years and the houses stand as it is. well planned society and suddenly overnight abandoned. it is very eerie to spend much time here. entry fee is charged and the person who sits in entrance looks like he has seen this place aince starting. wind was blowing and we could hear its sound that gave a thrilling moment but its all in the mind. overall a must viait if u r on the way to sam.

Its a lot of crumbled ruined buildings... bottom half of houses etc.  Some buildings are being rebuilt and they do not look authentic and it actually ruins the feel of the ruins.  they would have been better off installing interpretive signs.  a good story behind the desertion of the place... several are at play.... but unless you have a distinct interest in the place... I would give it a miss.

title: Kuldhara, An abandoned village, is also a piece of history

review: Kuldhara, when I was there I was so attracted by the calmness and loneliness of the place. Ruined building makes this place really amazing and gives a sense of good culture human life there. The water well is amazing construction.

review: True store attached to this abandoned village , kudos to government for its beautification work going on consideration high attraction tourist point. Many shootings have happened here in past like Ashoka (TV Serial), Karan Arjun ect.

title: Nothing to see
review: Suggest not to go here as there is nothing to see. D village is completely abandoned. We need to pay entry fee. Not worth d visit

title: Overrated place
review: Its a overrated place!!

title: Historical Place
review: This place have so many local stories so we don't know which was true or nearer. This place situated between Sam dunes & Jaisalmer city so when you visit please take food or some refreshments.

title: Give it a go just for 5-10mins
review: Visit to kuldhra is usually clubbed along with the desert safari packages. I bet no person (unless he loves haunted places) will visit kuldhra as a standalone place. Nothing so very interesting in the village. Ruins ruins and just ruins. You will only see wall and no roofs. don't get excited as we heard that some locals of the nearby villages took away the roofs of the house of the kuldhra village which was abandoned due to a curse.

title: Interesting history but can easily skip.
review: Its a standard stop on the way to the Sam sand dunes. The history of the place is interesting. Most of the village is in the process of restoration. There are some bits that still stand.

review: Interesting story and legend around this abandoned village, but as usual our ASI doesn't do much. So all you get to see are a set of fully broken buildings, with half Hearted efforts for restoration. Sharon no descriptions anywhere

title: Kuldhara Village of city jaisalmer rajasthan and here are many different types of animals to see around and peaceful
review: Im living near next to village kuldhara and here many different animal to see it and peaceful walk to look at rivers  and osias and lovely landscape and stay at dreamtime bungalow next to village kuldhara few minutes walk distance. The most amazing place for peaceful around here.best memory

title: Must be the worst tourist attraction ever
review: And I ve been to a few over the years....the road building is quite interesting however, obviously large amounts of funds are being thrown at this place

title: Legendary, but ordinary
review: The myth and mystery surrounding the place is legendary and more interesting than the ruins themselves. If you've been to Hampi, this place pales in comparison. All you see is a bunch of ruined houses, but there is no way to imagine the lives these villagers lived. The vastness and emptiness around is interesting. If it falls on your way, take a half hour stop. Otherwise, safely skip

title: unknown as it is
review: It might be a great place as its told today, but without anythign convincing. All seems a make up story, no maintenance, something has started, but not sure what it is exactly. Not told to any tourists anything

title: Deserted village
review: This place is around 4 kms from the main road connecting Sam sand dunes and Jaisalmer. The entire village has been vacated long back. We get to see the ruined houses and how they have built them using bricks and sticks. some portion of the houses are renovated by the govt for visitors to walk through.

title: A ghost town and haunted village on your way to awesome Thar Desert ...
review: Visiting "Kuldhara" - the ghost town and haunted village - seems scaring! On our way to awesome "Thar Desert" and "Sam Sand Dunes", our tour made a short stop at "Kuldhara Abandoned Village", just 18km outside of Jaisalmer, and whose origins date as far back as the 13th century. The legends about the abandoned village are much more interesting than the ruins themselves. As our guide told us, on one single night in 1825, the whole population deserted the village probably due: 1) to stop Jaisalmer's State Minister from forcibly marrying a village girl (daughter of a prominent local leader); or 2) to scape from unfair taxes levied over the village by Jaisalmer's State Minister); or 3) to a severe water shortage. While leaving, they cursed Khuldara: no one would ever leave here again! As time passed, it went to ruins and remained inhabited. Even today, nobody dares to stay at the haunted village once the night falls ... Adorable legends of Rajasthan! Follow closely your guide and watch out desert snakes and scorpions - that may be hidden in the haunted mansions and abandoned ruins! Enjoy!

title: why to visit ?
review: only stones and stones

title: Cheating the Jaisalmer Vikas Samiti on Kuldhara Conservation Charge tickets
review: On my visit to Kuldhara on 13th October 2016, I was very pleased to see the restoration work going on, which would enhance its tourism vallue many fold, I was rather shocked to see that the Ticket provider at the entry Gate (a kilometer before the village) is openly and brazenly cheating the Jaisalmer Vikas Samiti. The entry fee is Rs. 50 for a vehicle (with driver) and then Rs 10 per head. I was driving and my daughter and a friend were with me. Instead of charging us Rs. 70, the bearded hefty ticketing porson stated that he will take only Rs.50 and allow us to save Rs. 20, but without tickets. When I insisted that I would rather pay the full amount and get valid tickets, he gridgingly took full amount and gave us the tickets. I felt like hanging my head in shame at how we as a nation look for such cheap tactics to make money and cheat the scoiety and the nation.

title: Nice
review: It's really amazing to see a the view out there with lots of abandoned house. Nd If u know the history of this place then it's icing on the cake....

title: Interesting history
review: There are several stories about this village ranging from tax increases to drought. A little spoils by film sets but worth visiting, there are some fabulous views of this village in a photo book that have been taken from a hot air ballon.

Most of the buildings are now in ruins, but there is enough to see the surrounding views and how people lived.  It's helpful to have a guide to explain the different features and the history of the village.

Yes there are many ruins but you still have some standing accomodation with paintings and I loved it. Careful so I had an unexpected face to face with a snake inside a room, more scare than harm :)

title: Quite interesting story.....

title: Discover the ghost town

title: Must visit if you are in Jaisalmer
review: I had heard about Kuldhara and its history years back, but only got to visit it in December '15. It's quite easy to reach with a good road leading right up to the gates. There is a nominal entry fee. You can take your car inside. Walking thru the abandoned village is an eerie experience. Do check out the restored house and the temple.

title: The edge of the abandoned village still feels the same...
review: kuldhara has become a tourist spot now...not the way i saw it 14-15 years back...abandoned and mysterious..Still worth visiting for first time travellers

title: Nothing like Horror
review: We visited there to see but found nothing. like we heard that kuldhara is haunted place but we like that place and story. must visit place... you can go there with ount any tension but keep your self exited to see haunted place.. best of luck if u see and unnatural thing...

title: must visit
review: It an abandon village on the outskirts of jaisalmer.It takes you back in times and shows how people lived at those times.

title: Beautifully Haunted
review: Abandoned village with a haunted story  ( Actually 1 among 80 villages which were abandoned overnight, here the ruins remain till date). Do ask your local driver/guide to  tell you the story. A must visit on your way to the sand dunes but not so much just for this village. Makes for an interesting backdrop for photography. Closes after sunset. No loo/drinking water/food so come well prepared.

title: Desert ghost town
review: This place has a sad story behind it, be sure to ask about it. The homes are mostly destroyed but one can still imagine what it would have been like to live there. The gatekeepers are friendly and hospitable. Recommended.

title: Haunted place near Jaisalmer
review: This place is known as a haunted place near Jaisalmer as many years ago the occupants of this village abandoned this place overnight. There are old remains of the house and you get a strange and eerie feeling. I would not recommend anyone to visit this place at night.

title: Ghost Village of Jaisalmer
review: The legend of this village is also steeped in history. The entire village emptied out overnight.  The village is in ruins. Only one temple remains, this too seems to be a recent addition.

title: a Deserted an Abandoned Village .worth a visit
review: I went here along with my friends.. approximately 10 km short of sam sand dunes and turn on the left leads to kuldhara  village. 5km from the turn. at the outset it looks like you are entering a fort. but it is a bit of a drive inside and one can drive through the village . the village is quite old may be few centuries and history goes that the local king wanted to marry the priest's beautiful daughter whose beauty bewitched the local king.hence the complete villagers gathered and fled the village overnight never to return. there is good literature on google ..so no more history.

title: Deserted Village
review: Its interesting how the full village was deserted overnight ! most of the houses are in ruins now but you still see the structure and  can imagine that place being lively at one point in time !!

title: Mysteriously interesting
review: We visited the abandoned village in the off season so at the time of visit we were the only two tourists. I was amazed to see how big the village was and how well preserved it is, considering it has been empty for a hundred years (or at least that's what I was told by a local). The only thing that could improve this site is a bit more historical background, but I guess that's why we have Google nowadays! Well recommended visit!

title: Good place for photography
review: It is abandoned village but maintained and renovated by govt. A story behind it as everyone run away in a night. Good place for photography.

title: Interesting place
review: The village can be visited as part of the desert tours. It does not take more than an hour. They have rebuilt some of the houses to give a sense of what the village looked like before being abandoned.

title: Must see
review: I went there with my husband and I enjoyed the day. It was a spooky experience after listening it's story. I recommend you to visit there and have the experience. Must see..

title: A must visit place
review: This is one of the best places in Jaisalmer to visit. Very near to Sum desert. This village is abandoned and no one stays here. You can still see the broken houses and empty roads. Many people say different stories about this place. So say that there are ghosts, so say that the place is cursed because of the king's deed. The reality no one knows but you will like to explore the barren houses, land and the surroundings.

title: Wow...wide and thrilling
review: Go there well informed about the history and the place will b live to you ...respect the peoples feelings ....best time to be there is 1 pm ungefär

title: an eerie place
review: this is a must watch during the day time. At night time no one is allowed to visit this place. An amazing experience.

title: Interesting Storie
review: It's just not story but actual village with interesting stories. unity of people. really liked it place & story too.

title: Its special Kuldhara
review: Kuldhara is more noted as a haunted place, People have often complained about uneasiness here. However this place is a testimony to the Paliwal community and their hard work which had turned this place into an oasis. Each new paliwal family was welcomed with a brick and a gold coin from every other family in the village. Never heard such levels of brotherhood and prosperity. Kuldhara is a special place...

title: Mystery. ...
review: Google to know more about the place....really a mysterious place with an amazing history which leave you with thousands of thought.

title: abendent village
review: This Halloween, we head on an eerie trail to a haunted village near Jaisalmer.

title: Haunted
review: Abandoned village with a haunted story . But a must visit and its on the way if you visit the sand dunes . Not much to see except the ruins of a village in the middle of desert a 30 min visit .

title: read the review
review: Best way to go is by ownvehicle/taxy while going on way to Sam sand dunes.Obviously best in winters. Nice place to visit due to interesting story attatched to it.A movie was also made on it recently.no eating place or loo or drinking water there. so arrange for these on way only.

title: Beautiful architecture, good for stop on desert tour
review: Although the history of this place was not clear for us, we enjoyed taking nice photos among all those ruins. The bricks and walls are very picturesque. So if you like photographing, go there during your stay in Jaisalmer.

title: Deserted place..
review: If you be in night, then really you will get the goosebumps.. With some dilapidated homes , small lanes and having a scary background make you more sensible about your own sixth sense..

title: Deserted Village
review: See this while going towards Sam dunes, just a detour of 5-6 Kms from main road.Not worth going specially for it alone. The village was apparently abandoned overnight some 200 years plus ago and the local guides tell you the stories for as little as Rs 25 . There are stones of these houses stacked up, with 2 or 3 houses renovated fully for the tourists to see what they were like. Has a spooky feel , if you let yourself feel spooky ! There is a small fee to pay at the entrance of the village.

title: can be skipped
review: This is abandoned village in the middle of the desert. This place isquite deserted with hardly any visiters. Can be skipped.

title: Must Go to KULDHARA..
review: This abandoned village lies on the way of JAISALMER and SAM AND SAND DUNES. When you go to SAND DUNES you will see a board saying KULDHARA 5km on the left so it is easy to go . I think you all have heard a lot about this place so you should go . You will find some kids who narrate the whole story of kuldhara for some 20Rs. You will see some fine arts in the houses of kuldhara . You can click some good photos . Talking about ghost i didn't saw a single one , may be because i went in the day time :p . If you want to see or experience some paranormal activity you can go in evening .

title: Worth a visit
review: We went here as part of our Camel Safari with Jasmin Desert Safari & Camp.  It was well worth the visit and interesting to hear about this abandoned village.

title: A must in Jaisalmer
review: I don't know, why they don't sell it much but it's a real exciting place. Slightly far from city and on the way to sand dunes, you must keep aside at least 2 hours for this place. This is not a haunted place but a deserted place. A few local boys offer to be a guide for a small sum and it's worth paying them. The story is very interesting and the village homes are worth looking at. It's really a wonder to see a big village completely deserted.

title: Amazing site
review: The size of this village is enormous and it is hard to believe that so many people could organise and leave the area in one night.

title: Abandoned village.. Bhutha Goan
review: Before 200 years people of village left this village due to Salim Singh, PM of Jaisalmer. The many story behind this village. One story - Salim Singh want to marry daughter of Sarpanch of village for one night. This was not acceptable to villagers. all villagers left in the night.

title: Haunted village
review: As the story goes the entire village was abandoned in one night due to fear of Salim singh. The village was cursed that no good can happen to its resident.

title: Must visit
review: Plz do visit this place. Near to jaisalmer on the way to sam and locality have different - 2 stories about it. But still I will suggest you to visit it.

title: Not worth it
review: This place is totally ruined and it is not worth the time at all. It is a good 30 mins drive from Sam Sand Dunes but you will regret it in the end.

title: "Ghost town"
review: This place is known as ghost town because no one live here. There are nice temple to see. Foot well is very nice to see as well.

title: Scaring story
review: ... Mistery in this place that is abandoned since 300 years ago....

title: Not worth going to
review: It was on the way to the camel trip and honnestly we could have skipped it.

title: "Great historical palace"
review: Its about 15km far from jaisalmer on the way to Sam sand dunes. It tells you about the life style of paliwal brahmins. Its only down side is its very huge so you need to take your vehicles inside &they charge you for that. I think that's unfair.

title: Can Be Missed
review: I travelled here on the way to the beginning of my camel safari in a jeep. It was nice, but I wouldn't recommend going out specifically to see this attraction. The village has two or three intact buildings, including a Jain temple. The rest is just some walls of houses past.

title: Just an old village
review: Its simply an abandoned village. The locals guides spin tales around it to create some sensationalism. Obviously, the tales are full of holes, and you just appreciate the stones strewed around. Some houses have been re-stacked, and a few have been re-plastered as models. If you are heading toward the Sum Desert, its on the way.

title: Not Haunted as you may..
review: History and legend says that this is a haunted village. The best place to star gaze in the night where no paranormal activities can be felt. On the way to Sam Dunes

title: Experience the story from the history
review: I am not a history lover but the beautiful,unfortunately cursed and abandoned village of kuldhara was a place that draws my attention.The story was captivating.The whole village is ruined and there is nothing much to see but still the view of each and every stone that has fallen apart tells the story of this village.All the stones that are left here are cursed and cannot be taken as they bring bad luck according to the people there.Its on the way to sam dunes so everyone can take some time to visit this place.Worth watching.

title: Something different
review: Don't go with expectations to see historical place or architecture or some thing adventurous.

title: May visit
review: An abandoned village of at least 200 years old. It gives you a glimpse into what the people lived in our erstwhile villages.

title: Nothing to view
review: Seemed like a hoax me. The local govt has put an entry ticket,some locals have doubled up as guides. I saw nothing to suggest it has much of the story people associate with it. if one wants to visit it for the ruins, by all means.

title: Bhoot village
review: This village is situated 5 km on the side road to sand dunes. Easily accessible and a visit is good to the understand traditional house in rajasthan. The story behind this village is attractive. One must visit the village if time permits. Gives a good opportunity for amazing photographs...

title: The cursed village
review: The cursed village just having ruins -- no houses has the roof -- take a guide to visit the place -- couple of model houses are built for display

title: Apparently Haunted
review: It's up to us to believe in folklore or not, but the locals seem to be wary about this place. According to legend, the village was abandoned overnight due to a curse and there are reports of strange occurrences here. There a few videos on YouTube which investigate the paranormal claims of this place. If you get a kick out of such a claim, this is good place while for others, these are just ruins of an old village.

title: Mystifying place abandoned overnight according to local stories
review: This is a strange place, many villages of which this is one, which were abandoned overnight a long time ago.  The attraction to this place is for you to contemplate the mystery of why they left all of a sudden, but if you go there and have time there you'll be more puzzled by the fact that this is not some chaotic village which grew up out of nowhere, it look planned.

title: Nothing Haunting about this place
review: Abandoned village, Haunted, etc etc. Dint feel the aura of this place to be haunted. People are living in this village, and a new structure has also be created here, which has a roof. So seems the stories are false, and this is not much hyped haunted village.

title: Can be skipped
review: We went there as it has been hyped a lot with the 'Abandoned' and 'Haunted' words associated with it.

title: A village with no people
review: This village is also famous as shapit gaon in jaisalmer. Its  almost 10 -15 kms drive from jaisalmer main town. The king wanted to marry a small baby girl because of which all the villagers left the village. Its a small village of ruins and every where you will find story tellers which will aks for money for telling the story of the village.

title: Historical Place
review: its good stop on the way to/from Sam Dunes. there are plenty of houses. There are couple of hosues restored to have a glance how they look in past...

title: Gud place, especially with the history scoop...
review: We saw it on the way to Sand dunes...Good place to click some selfies....

title: Must-visit place
review: It's a ggod place,must visit with friends.You must have read about this place that it's haunted,but its only rumour.If you go here with someone who is of jaisalmer only,they will tell you the true story about this place.

title: An insight into History
review: A fascinating village without a habitant. Hire a local guide - they charge Rs. 50/- for a 10-15 min talk about history of this village. It's worth it - looking at the poverty around that region. Carry some biscuit packets as kids in that area ask you for food and not for money.

title: Kuldhara village
review: About 25 Km from Jaisalmer ..loads of  local history of this abandoned village  ..the government is developing this site into a tourist destination .. what i found interesting about this place is the size of the village with houses and huts completely abandoned and  history of the village , temple wall inscription at the center of the village ..The local guide had informed that no visitor was allowed after 7PM ..because of reported  paranormal activity ...defiantly worth a visit ..also worth mentioning a nice cactus garden in the same location.

title: Kuldhara Abondoned Village
review: Dirlfferent versions of stories ...find confusing... though the site is in ruins ...but does indicate a lot did happen here...

title: It's OK..
review: Our driver drove through this place,  nothing great about it except for the folklore that goes along. Otherwise I'd rather skip.

title: Haunted village
review: Kuldhara is an abandoned village around 25kms away from Jaisalmer. We visited it while we were driving back in the morning from the Sam Desert Safari to Jaisalmer. You will need not more than an hour to visit this place so would recommend visiting this if you going to the safari. In the evening one cannot visit the village as the place is assumed to be haunted. One can see roofless houses, the girl's (whom the king's dewan wanted to marry) house, a temple, well and planning and structure of the villages. The local guide will cost you as much as Rs.30. There is entry fee to the village as well.

title: Abandoned 84 Villages
review: 84 villages were Abandoned by people in a night...kuldhara one of them....one can see houses without roofs.. many stories why they left & how haunted it is etc....Good place to see entire village without a single person...hard to believe... so a must watch..

title: A visit to past
review: Kuldhara is a abandoned village which you all know but what you don't know is that why it is abandoned ? There is a story behind it, Kuldhara was a village of traders, many of these traders where very rich. Once Maharaja of Jaisalmer came to this village and he saw a girl and fall in love with her because she was very beautiful. He wanted to marry that girl but due to cast system villagers refused his purposel. He gave 2 days to villagers to give that girl to him or he will take her by force. Within two days 80 villages of that traders community left everything and moved to other part of country. Many of these villages are ruined but Indian Heritage department saved this village kuldhara which is very beautiful. It will remind you about Indus Valley Civilization because it's planning and structure is same as it was in Indus Valley Civilization. There is a Temple and many old houses. I know will love this trip so don't hesitate just Go.

title: I liked it.Depends on what are you looking for
review: Ruins. For some its just that. For some its a beautiful insight into how the villages used to be in rajasthan. Its an abandoned village with a spooky folk tale ;) i enjoyed the car ride,walking on roofs of huts and a short visit to temple.

title: Interesting to see
review: If the story is true, it is a good one and it interesting to see the abandoned village. As we went during the day, I did not feel anything "haunting".

title: Village of Ghosts
review: As the story goes no body stays in the after sunset. Is a tourist attraction and the houses are abandoned and not much to do over there just 20 to 30 minutes of time you can spent.

title: Nice place
review: Its a nice place. It is 15 kms far from jaisalmer. You can only watch this village in morning. It is haunted village.

title: I was bit disappointed with it
review: I am not sure what should I say about it. It was in bad shape not due to climate but due to the negligence of the Jaisalmer Development Authority. It is not haunted :P

title: Spooky!
review: Kuldhara actually just looks like any ruins.. The spooky part is that my husbands slr camera and my iPhone camera both started giving shaky images here.. And both the cameras haven't done that ever before.

title: Not for more than half an hour
review: This place is considered spooky and haunted. However, we did not observe anything supernatural and mysterious. One may visit this place while being on his way to Sam Sand Dunes for desert camp. At the end, you will at least have some good pictures as this abandoned village provide some good background for taking snaps.\

title: Kuldhara Village
review: Its is one of the 84  old Village Which was vacated with in a night & also having curse that no one will ever stay in this village. you will feel good that you have visited there, you will have memory. nothing to see there old destroyed homes and one temple with no god statue, one home is maintained by ASI for the tourist. This village is outside the city

title: Historic place
review: We drove up there on our 2nd day in Jaisalmer. Its little bit off from main road. Small entry fees. Only one tourist guide was available but he is really knowledgeable guy. Village was beautifully constructed but they way villager had to leave the city is really sad. A must watch place if you have time.

title: boring
review: went here as part of a trip. Nothing worth looking at and had to pay extra 50 rupees to get in

title: A romantic story
review: But really this is just a pile of ruins of indeterminate age in the middle of the desert.    There is no evidence of the story.

title: Its haunted !!
review: Actually, the stories told were so haunting, but its not so. Don't worry :) But worth a visit. Village is in shambles. broken walls, no roofs, no habitat. Gives eerie feling. At the same time its interesting to see a whole village abandoned overnight and stays that way since centuries. Feel yourself.

title: Nice place to visit
review: It is nice place to visit around 20 kms from jaisalmer. Their is a story behind this abandoned village. Village has incomplete houses, destroyed temples and some paliwal girl story.

title: Different and unique place to visit.
review: This village has ruins of homes of people who once resided in this village. It is said that no one stays here beyond 6pm. This place is a must visit in jaisalmer

title: Interesting place
review: This place though spooky has an interesting history and can be visited if you have time. The beggars inside are a nuisance though

title: not Bad
review: This is a village in jaisailmer lonely feel in this place. not anybody stay there in night . this is a fear factor

title: Please don't waste the time.
review: The place has as many as stories as many guides are available. Looking at the construction I believe the place was never Build fully.

title: Hauting Village
review: This place is also Known as Haunting village.

title: Unity for Dignity
review: The place is a symbol of unity amongst people against selfish & shameless politician of that Ira.

title: just a myth
review: We visited  had to pay an entry fee, its just a story of many years  ago ,not spooky , much of it is only ruins , if you have time you can visit but can be missed.

title: Did someone say eerie?
review: I visited this place as part of dunes + camel safari + bon fire and dinner. Since it is on the way you can stop by and have a look. I was done in 15 mins. Its just the ruins which look quite artificial and do not look spooky at all - atleast not at 2 in the afternoon. Point is since you are there might as well visit it. But if you have something better to do, you can definitely avoid.

title: Good to visit
review: The villagers had left the village cursed along with people of other 83 surrounding villages more than 2 centuries ago. Since then this village is empty and abandoned. People do live in other surrounding villages but not in this. None of the houses in this village have roofs.

title: Lots of history here
review: We stopped in here on our way to our camel ride.  Wasn't keen on visiting but once we heard the story it is really quite amazing.

title: A must visit!
review: It could be depressing once you hear the story of why this village was abandoned.  But it has its own charm and attraction. Strongly recommended.

title: a village abandoned overnight
review: Kuldhara is a short trip from Jaisalmer. Combine Kuldhara with Kaba Fort for a single tour and stop by Jaishri lake to watch some beautiful birds too.

title: "Kuldhara Village"
review: Another place less explored around Jaisalmer city which lies on the outskirts of the village is the ruin Kuldhara dating back to the 13th century. It 'was the largest village in the community which consisted of 84 villages, but in the 19th century, all the people in Kuldhara and neighboring 83 villages disappeared in the darkness. The reasons are still confidential stage, but it is said that the village was cursed, and thus is considered as one of the infested villages in India. However ... the place still retains some fine buildings such as temples and step wells which ensures a planned solution of seven centuries. a nice place to visit as a unique experience Thanks Goldsmith

title: Abandoned village
review: The village had long been abandoned and there are remnants of the houses made of stones. The government has started restoration work on the same. Good treat for photography and yes there is nothing eerie about the village. Its just give you an ancient feeling. A little further from the village is a 'baoli' - - which is a well with lots of stairs for you to climb down. Its all dry now but once upon a time it was a source of drinking water.

title: Kuldhara - En-route to Sam Sand Dunes
review: These are ruins of an abandoned village. One can take a short detour whilst en-route to Sam Sand Dunes and visit this place. There is  also ruin of an ancient temple here. The whole place makes for good background for photos.

title: eery
review: This was an interesting place. Confusing to we British as there are no clues.  Luckily we met a great couple from Bangalore who could tell us the history.

title: Hyped Up Place
review: This is just the hyped up place nothing great about it. Handful of rock houses and some architecture temple.

title: Hauted place
review: As the folk tale goes nobody can stay in the village as it is haunted and has paranormal activity. Lots of hindi movies have been shot there. They say at night nobody is allowed to stay and all those tried had a night to remember. Daytime nothing to see except ruins.

title: Haunted village
review: If you have read about kuldhara village you would know the story behind why its called haunted. We also heard some amazing stories from locals and our hotel staff. And hence i was more curious to visit. There were two more tourist cars there, hence i could not feel anything unusual. Its just a huge chunk of abandoned land.

title: Good place to go
review: The place is unique historical place. The story is that the whole village was abandoned overnight (infact 84 villages) because Salam Singh was forcing the villagers to marry off their daughter to him. The place is in complete ruins now, except for a couple of restored houses to give a feel of how people used to live here. We came to know about this place through a show in Epic channel. This place is very close to Sam sand dunes and a visit to the place can definitely be done.

title: Abandoned ghost village - one of its kind.
review: Unusual place and home to several shoot scenes of many Hindi movies. It has several abandoned houses. It was once home of Paliwal brahmins who are known to have vacated the village upon insistence of the king. They set upon a curse that nobody will ever occupy the village again. Not that there is any dearth of space in the vast barren land  to develop any new property ;)

title: It's a ghost city
review: Story tellers will say this city was abandoned suddenly in one night all habitants where gone. Some houses are damaged by local shepherds who believe ladies are keeping their jewels at home, and some may forget them.

title: Haunted place
review: A place must visit with a local guide, who can describe all detail. The story is very surprising & full of thrill.

title: Abandoned Village
review: This place was simply awesome. How the people had designed it, the roads, the buildings everything. Though very little remain now but a delight. Plus the story associated with it is also breathtaking when suddenly one night all the villages left the village including nearby 85 villages.

title: Would have been better with a better history...
review: Well the village has been abandoned.. Some say it is haunted.. cant say for sure. doesnt make much difference when you visit it in the afternoon.. You can skip this, unless it is part of the desert safari package..

title: All broken buildings !!
review: They charge Rs. 50 for the vehicle and also Rs 10 per person (excluding vehicle charges).

title: Jaisalmer
review: Jaisalmer is fantastic! Advise everybody to visit! 900 years history/sometimes it looks like you are on a different planet

title: Mysterious village
review: Story behind this is more amazing than this.........

title: Not worth it
review: The abandon village has nothing great to watch. Few ruins and few structures created for taking photos. For this they charge an entry fees too.

title: Kuldhara: a significant site of subaltern history
review: We visited Kuldhara by chance. We had just left Sam Dunes for Jaisalmer city, when Amritji , our driver, said he wanted to show us Kuldhara. As we drove on he told us the story of the place. Kuldhara used to be a flourishing village and all its inhabitants were Brahmins. One day the King saw the daughter of a Brahmin and expressed his wish to marry her. In those days marriage of a Brahmin’s daughter even to a king was unthinkable. The villagers could not refuse, instead they left the village en masse, overnight. Where they went, no one knows. To this day the village lies abandoned.

title: Walking into the Mystery Village
review: As per Google and local review it's abounded village. The exact fact is still mystery. but whatever I found is - " Kuldhara was village of very knowledgeable community. They knew the technique of cultivating water intensive crops like wheat in a desert. They had knowledge of planning and construction both.

title: Sad History
review: This place has a very sad story attached to it - seeing these old houses and the step well and the temple, it makes one wonder how the people must have felt when they were forced to abandon their village and wealth so long ago. Most of it is in ruins except for a couple of houses and temples. a nice experience.

title: Recommended. Must visit to see the marvel of olden day architecture and save our history.
review: It is an abandoned village, our hotel proprietor said it was abandoned 180 years ago. I am not sure whether it is true. But it is worth a visit, as it gives us the idea about the architecture at that time in the desert. All the buildings were built without using water as there was no water around. Couple of the houses are redone to give the idea how they looked. It is really amazing to realize how cool they are inside in the scorching sun of the desert. It would take about 30 min to go around as all the houses are closely located. Yes, there is an entry fee 50 rupees. I was told that money is used for maintaining the village. I feel it should not pinch you to spend a bit for saving some historical structure.

title: Ghost village.?
review: Looked like a film set....bt w,where did those ppl go?  How unite they were to understand the situation and act accordingly... simply amazing..!

title: Ruins of Kuldhara
review: Visited this place during a recent visit to Jaisalmer, Kuldhara is around 15 kms from Jaisalmer towards Sam village.It is believed that 84 villages were abondoned  overnight  because of Saalim Singh, the other villagers returned to their respective villages but people of kuldhara never returned because of a curse. This place is amongst most haunted places in India. This place is now under government of India and there is a nominal fee to visit this place.

title: Abandoned Village
review: The village is on the way to Sam Dunes village from Jaisalmer.The place has nothing much to see except abandoned village.This can be skipped.

title: Old Abandoned Village
review: A good watch for one time as its a little away from city. We did this trip during our trip to Sam Sand Dunes. A little Picturesque but nothing else to see beyond ruined old houses.

title: GHOST VILLAGE EXPERIANCE
review: We visited this place, after we studied most of articles about this place. We didn't get any abnormal feeling. Might be worth trying after 6.00 p.m

title: Nothing to see
review: The place has become popular because of a story which is interesting to hear and lends the place a mysterious character. But there is nothing to see unfortunately, just old, ramshackled buildings.

title: Surreal
review: Amidst the backdrop of the barren desert and sparse vegetation, lies this surrealustic abandoned village which reflects a rich historical past of the propserious paliwal brahmans,who originally hailed from Kashmir. Legend has it that they orchestrated an overnight exodus, failing to cope with the atrocities of the local minister called Salim Singh, who took fancy for the village chieftains beautiful 16 year old daughter. Replete with folklore of ghostly hauntings, this village is what legends are made off. The locale is a photographers delight as it has a deluge of artistic angles, only to add to your canvas. A must see for people for a penchant for photography.

title: interesting
review: great place for stories .they are more magical(chilling)when u visit this place after dark.

title: One of the Finest place to visit Jaisalmer
review: you must must must visit this place.

title: Desert Beauty
review: This place has beauty, culture, history, fantastic ruins etc.. and you cant ask more for great photography and urban backpacking tour.

title: a little excursion out of Jaisalmer
review: We hired some scooters and it was an easy drive to visit this fascinating place. Well worth it! We went for an enjoyable walk around a lake which you can't see from the abandoned village houses.

title: Visit to kuldhara
review: Been there with family. The abandoned village speaks the story of cruelty of diwan Salem singh n how villagers abandoned the village. Interesting place but poorly maintained.. Nearby pond has crystal clear water and beautiful view. Must visit once.

title: Ruins of old village but nothing great during day
review: Located slightly off road from Sam. Lots of interesting stories on Net, but nothing very exciting about that place when you visit.

title: haunted place as per local people saying
review: Its haunted place looks alike as no one is living in this village. A short story is behind this village. Many myths are connected as well.

title: abandon village
review: the kuldhara village is a must visit in jaisalmer it is the village abandon centuries ago by palliwal bramin in a single night along with 86 village

title: Not spectacular, but worth a brief visit as part of a desert safari.
review: It's not worth making a special trip to the village but it's a curious stop on the way to a desert / camel safari.

title: So so
review: Visited this place while going for a camel safari. Village is totally abandoned and has become a tourist spot now. Only walls of the houses are left. Goverement has rebuilt a couple of houses so that tourist can view the whole village from the terrace.

title: Photographer's delight
review: Must visit for someone who loves photography. You can capture amazing shots !! From the kids running around to ruins of houses/ temple ,Few tunnels.. To top it all the villagers staying around that area have some interesting stories to tell about this village !!

title: Looks artificial
review: According to story of this village it is haunted but it looks artificial .... Looks like they have done it for tourist attraction .

title: Good one...but can make it more promising
review: Its a great old village ...reminded of mohanjudara harappa civilization seen there...great for historians

title: A village which was abandoned years back has many stories from different people
review: Nice stop-over place to have photo-options. Some kids will try to sell their stories by offering guide services.

title: Creepy.
review: Really interesting place to visit. Nice that some of the buildings have been restored so we can imagine how it looked. But like the rest of India kinda ruined by litter.

title: Take the Guide with you
review: Guide is required to make the familiar the the place and history. Looking into there temple, houses and village structure you can feel how intelligent were those people

title: Spooky Place
review: The place is spooky, find the locals to give you guide services. you take some nice photographs especially towards evening

title: Deserted village in the midst of the desert
review: The village has enumerable houses all abandoned but surprisingly none have the roof but most have the walls

title: Worth a stop, but won't need more than an hour
review: Interesting place to wander, but you won't need more than 30-60 min to see it all. Truly an amazing story about this place, so seeing it in-person is nice, but I wouldn't necessarily go out of my way to see it with so many amazing sites in the area.
