We saw it on the way back from a night in the desert (camel safari, etc), and I don't regret stopping.

title: Must visit on your way from Sam Desert to Jaisalmer city
review: This place was suggested by Sam Dhani hotel manager as we were travelling to Jaisalmer city from the desert. This is an abandoned city with a history that surprises many of us. The place is really great if you are a lover of ancient history and architecture.

title: abandoned town
review: just an abandoned town, with a temple in the middle. What makes it eerie is the back-story. The ruins are not must-see but can do a detour if on the way.

title: Overrated
review: The ruins here are not exactly very ancient. The place looks quite well kept with some amount of restoration done. What is the bad part is that the restoration is done with modern cement so it stands out at once. Plus the place is supposed to be haunted but there was nothing spooky going on there. But the place has a rich history its worth a visit.

title: Average place
review: Went to the village. Surrounded by beggars there.

title: Thrilling and mysterious story behind
review: This is a village believed to be abandoned overnight by the residents as an ill famous King wanted to marry a girl from village which the villagers didnt not approve of. All the houses and in the state they were left with and is spread across vast area. There is a temple and well too.

title: An interesting place.
review: Not a haunted place but its an interesting place to visit. ASI has restored/recreated  few of the houses. There are fews guys and a old woman who would tell you the story behind this ghost town.

title: Quaint village
review: Abandoned village...looks like a movie set...en route to sam sand dunes from Jaisalmer...you can spend 1hr here

title: Ghost village
review: On our way to Desert Camp we visited to the Ghost village. on entering the village you can feel that the place has lost its life and you can feel that the place is mourning for some thing

title: Rating only for road condition now,not able to visit
review: My rating is only for road conditions, I heard a lot about this place online and with localities also.

title: Loved it
review: Loved this place for some reason,possibly because of the history.its an emptu village and as told by our driver, it was emptied in one single night.the remains looks mesmerizing.on way to sam, so must visit.

title: It's your wish to go
review: I had read about this place on Internet and I just thought to visit this place. Locals say its not haunted. So believe them and go and visit the place to see the architecture and construction strategy. Do not go if you are scared of all those stories.

title: Deserted village
review: You can visit this abandoned village on the way to Sam sand dunes. There's a story attached as to how overnight all villagers left the village and moved. Over a period houses are broken and few restored. It's attached with a historic event and how a few hundred years old village was planned

title: An Untold Story
review: The village of Kuldhara is a ghost village that has been abandoned since 1800s. It is said to carry a curse of the villagers who migrated to other places. Kuldhara lies about 15 Km west of Jaisalmer in western Rajasthan(India).No one lives in Kuldhara, as well as its adjoining 85 villages, as these are believed to be cursed. The village now lies in ruins.

title: Go back to old times!!
review: Kuldhara which now stands lifeless, is a major tourist attraction. It fascinates me with its built and architecture made of sand stone. You can imagine the times when it was inhabited and full of love and life. An unfortunate beautiful village midst desert.

title: Different, unique, intriguing site...
review: Had heard about this place, being one of the abandoned villages in Jaisalmer. This site seems to be one of the better preserved and somewhat restored to demonstrate the dilapidated remains of houses ages ago. Do not miss to get various versions of the story(-ies) behind why the village was abandoned supposedly overnight. It is a very different place to visit among the others in and around Jaisalmer. Some walls are restored and painted to give a better view of how the houses were when the village was habitat-ed.

title: unique expernience
review: must visit, though its an abandoned village but you can feel the history. something very unusual to experience for those who want to see offbeat places.

title: eerie
review: ok they keep saying the village is haunted. i dont know bu the  village does have an eerie feel to it. definitely worth a visit especially if you like visiting ruins

title: A good place to visit !!
review: We were planning to stay in the desert and we tooka diversion to visit kuldhara. Though many complain that there is nothing there and waste of money, i beg to disagree. Though it may not be a seesh mahal, the place has its own history and it was very different to stand there and experience a village emptied over-night !!

title: Creepy or not so creepy !!
review: People said that the place was cursed - when I visited didn't feel like it was - Heard few versions of stories - The story of King or an old smuggler - not sure which one to believe !!

title: Vanished Village
review: Dont go at this place. Nothing good to view, One will find old house destroyed structures with lots of dust.

title: Worth one time visit
review: It's an hour's drive from Jaisalmer.  There are ruins of the houses.  I wouldn't write the story of the village here.  You can pay 50 bucks to the teenage boys and they'll explain you the story.

title: remainings of kuldhara village
review: it is said that..it is haunted..many stories for the reason to abandon 84 villages..Interesting to see the remainings

title: Can be skipped
review: Ruins and only ruins. The mysterious story about the village is intriguing enough for tourists to flock this place...however that's all is there. The place in itself doesn't offer anything more apart from ruins...a part of which is in the process of getting restored. If in need of saving time this place can be skipped!!

title: Good place for history lovers...
review: Only ruins & abandoned architecture; so find yourself in middle of history, awesome place for history lovers. But not worth for family people as one need to walk a lot..

title: Okay to visit
review: It's good to see and stroll around, one could have a look at the baoli  nearby. It has an eery feel to it, but nothing more beyond that..

title: Different experience
review: First and foremost this is not haunted place as you might have heard on internet or reviews. If you visit this place thinking as haunted place than you will surely be disappointed. This place have very interesting story and you feel some different feelings on visiting place. Visit once for something unique and different experience.

title: it's all in your belief
review: Visiting this place is absolutely your own choice. If only you believe in the super or  trans-natural powers, you may please go ahead & try to explore the ruins. Else its  good to avoid. There are innumerable stories about this haunted village which you must have heard or read from multiple sources. There is no habitation in this village apart from a few broken walls/houses. However within a 1000m or less from the vicinity of the village, there are multiple habitats / villages where people are dwelling for a long time. There is an entrance fee for individuals along with a separate fee for vehicles. Daytime visit it permitted. Approx. 20 kms from Jaisalmer

title: Memorable experience
review: Worth visiting!

title: Good View In the Evening
review: This is a place where most of the people do visit on the way to the sam sand dunes / khuri.

title: May as well look if you are on your way
review: This is a standard stop on the way to the desert for some camel treks, so it's worth a quick look if that's the case. I wouldn't bother traveling to this, though, if you aren't going past.

title: Good place to visit
review: Nice place to visit, deserted town, an interesting story. Once u visit there u will find a lot of locals and small children's who tell stories about the town. An interesting story though. The locals don't dare to linger near the place at night, even they don't pass through the nearby roafs.

title: Historical Place
review: The Village is on the way of sand dunes from Jaisalmer, must need to be visit in day time. cause no one living in this village. all Houses are in debris condition. only one temple and one house in good condition. some story of rajputs and brahmin for this place..very interesting (Kids may not like this place)

title: Okay but not great!
review: Just a piece of page from History, there is not much attraction here. If anyone is doing some documentary on Jaisalmer this can be visited, otherwise people can choose to visit other Havelis/Jain Temple at Lodurva or spend more time at Dunes. We noticed some people breakout here to have sip of beer!

title: Nice detour
review: The architecture was original.  But could have been maintained better.  Could take some nice photos but nothing much to do.

title: Kuladhara
review: Good to visit as it has a story linked to it. However, nothing outstanding and the story is not what you are made to believe with the stories  written on the net. Good to take a few pics. There is no spookiness at all.

title: Amazingly beautiful and unique
review: It's must visit place  when you are in jaselmer one of its unique.Do take guide to know about the  history behind this place.

title: Not much to see
review: In kuldhara you can see only the remains of the houses. Some houses are maintained to attract the tourists. Not much to see here. Visit if you have spare tie.

title: well maintained
review: Going thru the village was nice.......to judge and have an idea of ancient living.....was informative. Various stories tells the reasons of evacuation of the village.......one of them being the idea by the villagers to show their anguish  and to oppose the decision of the king to marry one of the girl of the village.......the villagers decided to lave the village overnite instead of agreeing to the king.

title: Reminder Of True Unity & Integrity
review: This place belonged to the Paliwal's and was vacated overnight along with 84 neighbouring villages. This was due to the threat of the then King to marry one of the daughters of the village which was disapproved by the villagers due to the conduct of the King. The place is breathtaking, with beautiful views for photography of abandoned village, temple, houses etc. Must visit place.

title: Pathetic scenic/ story behind this site
review: Can't believe such naturally abandoned village which otherwise seemed quite well off. Real Indian Historical Tragedy.

title: Abandoned Village - So what?
review: This place is a classical example of commercialization. Since the place lies on the way to sand dunes, travel operators has promoted this location as an tourist attraction. There are better sites like Khaba fort, where you can see an abandoned Village as well as a deserted fort.

title: A reminder to the arrogant by simple villagers !
review: The story goes that Kuldhara along with its neigbouring 84 villages were abandoned by its occupants overnight. The local King wished to marry one of the local girls and the villagers decided to leave en-masse rather than submit.

title: Visit only if you are curious about the story attached
review: The place has nothing much to see and experience apart from the story that is attached with this place. The story is that the entire villagers left the village overnight when the king eyed on one of the beautiful girl of the village and send a proposal to get her married to him, they say nobody knows where the people went and the place is now haunted with the spirits of those villagers. The place has similar left out of the houses which looks artificial made during bollywood shootings. Overall if you have extra time  can check out the place but no need to manage extra time for the place.

title: Ghost Village
review: It seems the village was abandoned due to atrocities committed on them by a Chieftain called Salim Singh! Its small village and all houses are in ruins. The trust that maintains it has restored 2-3 houses. For a small fee that is charged, the trust has been able to keep the village clean which is commendable. However, something more should be done to make the visit more memorable.

title: Amazing place for the adventurer types...!
review: The drive is not too far away from the city of jaisalmer but may look like one. On your drive you may feel a bit scared because the way to the place is itself a abandoned one with nothing on both sides of the road to a long distance. On reaching we found an old man and rather a scary one who took entrance fee from us. Then we entered through the gate and man it gave us chills we were expecting. The place was totally deserted with many broken houses. Just look for the old lady who will tell you the story of the place.

title: THe place has the resemblance of a deserted town with huge history associated with it.
review: the temple has  huge  architectural value is definitely a watch and a must visit with the locality. the place is on the way to the desert and it is worth a halt of 30 mins -1 hour.

title: Mind Blowing Village
review: Kuldhara village is a haunted village and really mind blowing. I had nice time. I always wanted to this kind of village and finally I did. I am so much happy. You can cover this village while going for a desert safari.

title: Lost Village of Paliwal Brahmins
review: If you want to see the lost village civilization you will find lot of things. A place for photographers delight. You can spend whole day with camera and selfie stick among the golden wals and ruins

title: A very different place
review: Its a very different place. Feels like a bomb blast or an earthquake effected area.

title: Nice interesting spooky place......
review: One of the highlights of the Jaisalmer visit...The drive to Kuldhara was nice ..good roads and open desert scenery.. After the rundown condition of the Jaisalmer fort, this place seems reasonably well maintained.We made a small friend there, Jeetendra who guided us around the village and took us to the step well nearby and the small lake there which had water.... the story is suspect as there is no historical proof or link shown.

title: Not up to the mark
review: I went here with much excitement but all my excitement died down upon visiting here. Overrated and can be avoided.

title: However the Government destroyed it?
review: It was really a stupid idea to repaint over the nice walls for a bollywood shooting. It totally lost charme.

title: Lovely place to watch sunsets
review: Kuldhara is full of brooding desert atmosphere, giving you the feeling of long lost community, drama, history alive. It is a beautiful thing to climb to the second storey of an abandoned haveli and watch the sun sinking over the desert and abandoned sandstone structures.  Driving out late afternoon is easy and interesting in itself. Traffic not much. The desert at sunset is hard to beat folks!

title: See it for its Unique Value.
review: The place has only the historic story as attraction of a village abandoned by it's residents. One can see a large village of above 200 houses that stand abandoned. Not a single house has the rooftop.

title: Awesome Place to Visit when in Jaisalmer!
review: This is one of the superb historical places to visit when you are in Jaisalmer. It is is bit far from main city buy comes in-between when you visit Sam Sand Dunes. A good place to visit and see the history of the village abandoned by it's people.

title: its not horrible !!!
review: i can hear about this village..now i exactly know what that is.

title: Abandonded village...
review: We had that visiti planned as a part of dessert nightover. A completely abandoned village in the middle of nowhere. Make sure your guide explains you the reasons of abandonement, in one night, not much to do, just pass through and keep up

title: The haunted place Kuldhara
review: The story of the village differs but the important thing is the history of this place. If those Paliwal Brahmin didn't leave or that incident didn't take place than this village would have been the economic zone of Rajasthan and would have been more popular than Jaisalmer. The old man at entry gate is very decent person you can find him on youtube as well. Approx 400 years ago the Paliwal Bramin were so managed that they had garage for their carts, there is a temple at the center of village.

title: A deserted village
review: Kuldhara is a deserted village almost 20 kms from the main city of Jaisalmer. There are many stories associated of Kuldhara being deserted place. It was an inhabitant of almost 600 people at some time.

title: Abandoned Village which overwhelms you with its tragic tale
review: Kuldhara village was abandoned by its brahmin residents more than 300 years ago due to its refusal to marry off the village chief's daughter to Salim Singh, the then Prime Minister of Jaisalmer. The village is full of abandoned houses which are now slowly falling into ruin. The chief's house however has been renovated nad gives a glimpse into rural life of the period including kitchen, living room and stores. A must visit for its uniqueness.

title: A lost world
review: one night, two thousand paliwal  brahmins left this village, keeping back their homes as they were. nobody knew where they went and now where their decedents are. the village is a full of houses, temple and also a well. Nobody stays in this village till date. a lost world. worth visit. mysterious..!

title: Mystery Unresolved....
review: Kuldhara village and its mysterious story will leave you thinking about the night when the people of kuldhara village one of those 84 villages disappear in one night.......

title: What is the truth about this deserted village ?
review: We combined a visit to Kudhara on our way to our camel safari at Khuri.It is quite large and was obviously quite an important settlement before it was abandoned. It is quite interesting to walk about the temple is still intact and you can go into a number of buildings in various stages of dilapidation. I would not make a special journey to visit but worth dropping in if you are passing.

title: Over-hyped
review: The legend surround the place is more interesting than the place itself. Its several piles of stones thats about it- any ruined or abandoned place anywhere else would look just the same.

title: Spooky!
review: Classic example of how tales can lend an aura to a place. Huge sprawl of abandoned villages - you can see that the villages were abandoned in an hurry. The locals tell takes of the place being haunted - which makes it all the more spooky. This place doesnt take too much time - you can make a quick stop on your way to Sam Sand Dunes from Jaisalmer. There is an entry fee to the place - got to pay to see a bunch of rocks and stones...but then thats the tourist circuit for you :)

title: Absolutely must visit
review: Tour to Jaisalmer is incomplete without this place in your list. It's a remain of a well planned village with roads and grid planned houses. There is an old man who tells the stories about the village do listen to them it adds to the mystery of this village.

title: Ruins of an Ancient village
review: There is no authentic source or depiction of the history of this village. The local folklore, however ascribe it to one of the rich man of Jaisalmer, a Rajput who forcefully wanted to marry a Brahmin girl due to which the residents of the village abandoned this village. There are no guides available. Place attracts many film shootings.

title: Abandoned village
review: Part of the 84 villages which were abandoned due to the tyranny of the king. A few houses and the temple have been reconstructed but otherwise things are untouched. Gives a small glimpse of village life in those times

title: Below expectations
review: We visited this place when going to khuri and enjoying view of lonely desert over bike ride....it has nothing haunted ...but a different feeling to see abandoned village.

title: Spooky/Cursed village, worth a visit if you visit Jaisalmer and especially the Sam Dunes
review: Kuldhara is a cursed village located around 5 - 7 Kms off the main road which connects Jaisalmer with Sam Dunes. The village is an Archaelogical Survey of India monument and has associated entry charges. It has a well connected road and you can use any SatNav to visit this place. The entire village consists of ruined houses left over from 1825 (since the time it was abandoned) surrounded by a wall in 2 sqr Km periphery. To know the actual story please google.

title: ghost village
review: there are different stories attached with this village but you will see only the empty houses in between the desert. not worth to travel to see just the khanders

title: Interesting
review: The village seemed to be well laid out, as one can make out from the ruins. One house has been somewhat restored and one can get an idea of how the villagers lived.

title: beautiful but not worth it
review: The visit here was part of a camel safari. It was a typical touristy photo opportunity activity. We were taken there by jeep and we had about 15 minutes there. The place is nice but filled with tourists and the goal here was to take some "I've been there" pictures and leave fast. Not my cup of tea, we didn't get a chance to enjoy the place.

title: Nothing spooky but still its worth it
review: I read here, that its not spooky anymore and that new construction and redevelopment has started. I was almost disinterested to go but somehow on what locals told me, I thought of giving it a try. There is nothing like redevelopment or new construction there, just 2-3 buildings have been developed to attract tourist. Village houses are beyond recognition and seems to be placed arbitrarily to signify houses, but somehow it fails to generate awe. The only feeling of being in some spooky area is nice. The location is very interior and hence no one would dare to go after sunset.  However its worth to feel the awe.

title: Heard a lot for this place
review: The place is just fun being out of time and should also,

title: Nice to view
review: Nice place to view while going towards Sand dunes. If you Indian you can like the story rest there is nothing much to view other than empty house.

title: Fascinating history
review: Worth visiting - spend time exploring. Knowing the story behind this archaeological site & having a knowledgeable person point out some of the features is essential. Examples- the stepwell, the underground safe.. This community was a leader in town planning so long ago.

title: Is it really Haunted???
review: The impression till the time of the actual visit to the so called "haunted village" changed immediately upon the actual visit. The sequence of events heard at the site and the pain the villagers had to undergo then, was something contrary to any so called "haunter" or "frightening" experience. The villagers had to evacuate the village overnight due to some Royal threat. The villagers left the village which since then is abandoned and is devoid of any population. The remains of the houses give an impression of a very deliberate planned layout to give tourists an attraction. Rest you decide after your visit....

title: Nice place..
review: Been to kuldhara..Nice place..you can see the house of Mukhia (Head of village), the Temple where the actual story of Kuldhara starts. To know the actual story of Kuldhara meet the person while entering the fort....

title: Village Without Life
review: Twenty km away from Jaisalmer Kuldhara village is abandoned village though maintained by tourism department.The walls of houses are made of mud but cleaned and plastered by soil are worth appreciation.You can go on upper side on roof by steps and also look a temple.The floors of house are also clean and lased by dung.

title: Intriguing place
review: A very different place.. Worth a visit.. The story is very amusing. I couldn't help but keep staring at the remnants of the village for long.

title: Interesting and Intriguing place
review: Wow! an abandoned village, full of ruins and not a living creature - hard to believe but you will be really surprised when you land up there. I was just wondering what happened to the whole village, the story is very interesting and I cross checked the story at a few more places in jaisalmer and it was the same. ruins are old, a small temple like structure is interesting so are some of the houses with pillars, courtyard etc. If you are interested in history, archeology and some interest to visit uncommon things - this will surely attract you.

title: Disappointed
review: Total carelessness by tourism department. I have heard/read about Kuldhara, but totally disappointed. Personal visit doesn't added any value.

title: Touch of history...
review: We had our brush with history when we came face-to-face with Kuldhara Abandoned Village. Few of the houses were being renovated to show how the village looked at its peak.

title: Mesmerising and intriguing
review: The place has colony of 100s of abandoned village homes.... From the size of houses it seems, these belonged to well to do community......its really intriguing why they abondened such developed setup ....the restored houses seem similar to 50 years old village homes....yet this was 300 year old colony .....

title: Slightly hyped
review: The eerie story of an entire village evacuating overnight is quite unique..however there is nothing much to do or see except a line of deserted houses..you can make a quick stop to click some snaps and hear the detailed story told by a guide

title: A very spooky story
review: Actually did find the place that spooky. But the story is bit spooky. Advice visit the place before 6 pm. As after that the place is closed for the Day

title: Overrated !!! Nothing to see
review: We visited this place out of curiosity after reading the story from various websites. We were very excited to see this place. It was a total disappointment when we reached there. We paid Rs.10 per person and no receipt was given to us. Nobody was there to guide the direction once you enter the main entrance gate. Somehow we managed to reach the main spot which was a redeveloped building. Broken houses, wells, nothing special to see, only barren land. Most of the stuff from this place is shifted to some museum nearby. Guide told us some stories of hidden gold beneath the village. But actually we don't even know if it was true or not or it is just the man made story. I would not recommend this place to visit unless you are in love with history.

title: must visit place
review: It is 200 years old village. I visited this place early in morning. It has one temple in premises. No roof on village houses. No one lives in this village now. One of the scariest place i have visited.

title: Ghost Village
review: Driving down the road to the Desert Safari brought us to this abandoned village. Ghostly wind swept area absolutely no one around. History says it was a thriving brahmin village and a local overlord wanted to carry away the ladies in the village. This led to a mass exodus and overnight the village was abandoned.Houses temples and other buildings still stand mute witness. Do visit but strictly in the daylight. Hopefully not haunted !!!

title: An imagination into history
review: Kuldhara tells story of Paliwal Brahmins cursing and abandoning its centuries back, which led it not to be habitated ever. It is not place which every tourist would love. Deserted ruins give you an imagination, how village would have been centuries back ; broken statues of god gives you the feeling of some catastrophe happened at that time.

title: Its an Amazing Place
review: Its   one of the most amazing village  you can see after 200 years .The story about how  population vanished is incredible The village is welcoming for a ghost village .we visited the village with our guide Anand Shripat  he made this trip wonderful with all the stories  about the village people and the invaders.  When visiting Rajasthan  we recommend this place.

title: Eerie..Spooky & Tingly
review: Heard a lot of Kuldhara-The abandoned village &so on visiting Jaisalmer, it was in my bucket list of "Places to be" & trust me guys, it was worth it. The fact that the entire poputation of the village vanished in a night 300 years back & the fact that Kuldhara is listed in one of the most haunted places of India made the trip even more exciting.

title: Golden hue pervaded throughout the "ghost village"
review: The idea of an abandoned village brought in interesting thoughts. What could have happened that the entire village residents just decided to abandon the village leaving their homes and probably all other material things. I did not get an answer to this question; was it a cruel king or some superstition or some epidemic that drove the villagers out? Or maybe i did not ask enough:) However the beautiful golden hue surrounding the entire village due to the stones made half broken houses/temples is worth at least half an hour to look at the structures and wonder what could have happened

title: nice
review: Rajasthan is full of variety even in its tourism. Apart from luxurious palaces and beautiful temples it also houses haunted places. One haunted or abandoned place is the Kuldhara village near jaisalmer. It has many stories and legends behind it but no one knows the true story behind the 200 year old vanished village. Still its a tourist spot to admire get frightened and have an adrenalin rush. Places like Kuldhara make you terrified and love the safety of palaces even more.

title: Kuldhara Village, a place worth of visit
review: We had been there at Kuldhara abandoned village, last week October, 2015 by afternoon. Having a history of bravery and determination from the dwellers of this village, this place really provides a sense of suspicion. Not much far from Jaisalmer city, this place is reached by taking a left turn in the mid of National highway approaching Sam Sand dunes.The broken homes, balconies, staircases and structures which are surviving till date are of potential interests. The broken temples, one of them is being revived back by the Govt with the help of local people, carry the essence of devotion and disciplined life style of the then-villagers. As, the Sun downs, all people move away leaving behind an uncanny sensation under the shades and whispering shadows.

title: A big hoax
review: Visited the place despite repeated protestations from our Bengali hotel guide, as all of us had heard a lot about this place. Turned out be an entirely disappointing experience. Forget spooky, it in fact is a very well maintained place and some restoration work has definitely helped. Even some new construction in form of a temple has happened. The story of an entire village disappearing overnight is probably a cultivated one to bring in the tourists.

title: Just Remains of a village
review: Nothing great to visit the place. just remains of an old village. but the story behind this is very interesting and make people to visit the place once.

title: Linked to a very Sad Story
review: Kuldhara is in outskirts of Jaisalmer where you will find the ruins of an ancient village. Its believed that entire village was abandoned by the Villagers over night and thereafter no one knew as to where did they go. Reason they abandoned the village was that the Ruler of Jaisalmer wanted to marry a Girl from the Village who was very beautiful. This was not acceptable to the Villagers. Finally when the Ruler set a deadline for them, they took the most unfortunate decision of abandoning the village. The Ruler could never trace them thereafter.

title: The deserted village on the way to the Desert
review: This village was on the way to SAM dunes. Totally abandoned.We could see only few tourists and some camels. A very good experience.

title: Hyped !!
review: Waste of time and money. Go only very interested in folk tales. But then everyone one has a new story to tell about this village. Noone really knows what happened. They charge u a hefty ticket at entrance compared to what is offered inside the village- Nothing!!

title: Tragic and unbelievable
review: The entire once-upon-a-time-prosperous village abandoned their homes overnight and vanished without a trace. Is this a fact or fiction? Well, there is no official version of why this happened, so you better believe what you hear from the others.

title: Interesting place
review: One must try if you are spending two days or more in Jaisalmer. You can get a good sunset view if you go during the evening. Otherwise not much to expect from.

title: Good to visit but nothing special
review: There is nothing special but good to visit this place from historical perspective. This is abandoned village and good to know why its abandoned by visiting it.

title: Heritage kept as is - must visit
review: A lot of rumors of the village being haunted... All false.,, We met an elderly man who manages the gates of the village and he shared the entire story.  Surely a must visit place.

title: This is something which a lot of people are not aware of
review: Worth visiting for its mystical value. The facts behind it are quite interesting. For complete details one should check it up on youtube.

title: Abandoned Village
review: On the way to Sam sand dunes lies the abandoned village in sand stone. The legend which I heard was that Once upon a time it was well to do. When the royalty wanted to marry the girls forcefully, the village decided to abandon without leaving any trace.

title: Kuldhara abandoned village
review: It is about 20 km from Jaisalmir city on the way to Desret. Car is required charge Rs700/- up down.Before going there one should read history

title: Haunted... Really Haunted
review: One of the most haunted place in Asia. One can get a feel in day time why one should not go there in the night. All the houses are mostly without roofs and noone around.

title: Ask for a stopover here while visiting the desert
review: Stop at this village for at least 2 hours if you are on your way to the Thar desert. If you have a package for visiting the desert, most often the tourism people will stop you at this abandoned village otherwise ask for them to stop in here. I had an opportunity to meet the locals and have a chat with them and also share a cup of chai. It was interesting to meet kids at this place and spend time with them. This abandoned village has a lot to offer and you can also view some mysterious structures at this place. Worth for a stopover  for 2-3 hours

title: Interesting Place to visit
review: Its the place where you think about the people lived and vanished. Its amazing to see the place. Not very far from main city.

title: Don't miss this one
review: It is between sand dunes and main city. Tour operators may try avoiding taking you there. But don't miss this one.

title: A bit of a sad story.
review: After a very influential men walked in the village many times to take advantage of women the villagers went to the king who had his hands tied so the peoples from that village decided to leave everything behind to end the tyranny...  This was again a very nice place if you enjoy photography and as a bonus there is a little lake or pond nearby that looked so clean that we all had a refreshing swim to cool us down from the afternoon sun.

title: Really abandoned...
review: Huge village... Entirely abounded.... Quite an experience... We visited it while going to the dunes, I would say visit it to experience it.

title: Machu Pichu of India
review: This place is huge! Interesting history attached to it. Great place to take pictures if you enjoy photography.

title: Awesome experience
review: It was an out of the world experience to visit this place.

title: a abandoned village
review: It ought to be believed that unity is strength, when one hears the story of the kings who ruled over these areas and the unity of the villagers living over here we can say WOW.

title: a bit anti-climactic
review: Although the story which explains why the village was abandoned is interesting, the village buildings as they stand today just seem empty and pointless.

title: A bit of a let down!
review: Was hoping to see a village from the previous century. It looked more like a restored piece of work. With no clear write up of the historical facts..too me it was a bit of waste of time. Driving through stone structures without roofs did not give any sense of affiliation to the visit.

title: Over hyped
review: We made a detour to this place on our way to the desert camp. It wasn't all that! Just a bunch of old abandoned houses.

title: Really Hounded
review: Its an abandoned village..and it is evident from the remains..I bet it needs a lot of guts if you wish to visit this place in night...Totally horrific...I am sure

title: Nothing much to see here except few good clicks
review: If you are going for a tour/stay to dunes, chances are that this place is already covered in your package. So you will be taken there whether you intend to our not. It literally is an abandoned village with nothing else but broken houses. If you have never been to a village before , this might intrigue you.

title: Jaisalmer Trip - September 2015
review: All of us have had an encounter with a ghost or heard an eerie ghost story.

title: No Spooks!
review: I have read so much about the place Kuldhara and the sad story surrounding it that it was a must go place for me in my list. The place is said to be haunted since it experienced a tragedy where 4 or 5 villages packed their bags and left overnight and cursed the place. The place they say cannot be rehabilitated and has no settlements in its surrounding area ( none that I saw). More than eerie the place is sad as it reminds you (if you have an imaginative mind) of the times the people must have lived and the gullies and lanes must be filled with people and kids playing...what must have been and what is now. All you will see is ruins here and yes of course a lady who claims to be someone from the village who villagers left behind. You will probably not believe but do give her some money to make her happy.

title: Waste of time
review: Not really worth going..waste of time .its far and just has two houses restored..didn't like at all.

title: Absolute disappointment ##
review: Inch hyped & a must see in the tourist list of to do things in Jaisalmer.  But absolutely no board or literature describing the history of the place

title: Good to see in daylight
review: We heard the story of this village from too many people so went there to see and witness the houses and ruins, no such haunted thing in daylight

title: Good as an experience - The story is more interesting
review: This is mosty done as a visit on the way to the desert safari package you choose at Jaisalmer. The history behind the place is impressive. Although,there isnt much to see, it's a historic place and nice for photographs :)

title: Eerie experience
review: A century old village mysteriously abandoned by locals. Stay after 6.30 pm at your own peril. Old dilapidated structures add to the atmosphere.

title: Unique place, haunting memories!
review: It gives you a chill, imagining how families from 84 villages left everything and abandoned the place. It is left to you to believe the story that exists, it is really one of a kind place and highly recommended.

title: No body lives
review: Rarely seen any empty village

title: Eerie feeling, unique place
review: It was an eerie feeling to visit this unique place. It is a ghost village with ruins all around - the folklore is that the village was abandoned overnight. I would recommend one to spend some time looking at the ruins from the rooftop (of a house that Govt has reconstructed)...

title: abandoned village
review: we really enjoyed this desserted village but were unsure of the stories told by the locals about the villagers being forced out

title: Interesting Spot to See
review: Interesting story behind this ghost town. It was weird walking through abandoned buildings and temples. You can get some cool views by walking up some of the buildings' floating staircases. This is definitely a tourist hotspot.

title: spooky!!!!
review: this place as two stories attached to it. which one is more accurate i can not tell you. have to visit and experience the ruins

title: memorable experience
review: it is a 200 yrs ago ghost village.i went to this place by morning.one temple in the premises.no tops on the villagers houses.no one lives now.it has a ticket to enter in to this village.it is one of the scariest place in india.

title: The Abandoned Village
review: Just 18 km  west of Jaisalmer, on the  Sam sand dune road, is the village of Kuldhara.   Once a bustling and prosperous settlement of the Paliwal Brahmins, all the residents of Kuldhara and the 83 nearby villages abandoned their houses and vanished suddenly one night in 1825, having lived there since the 1300s. Nobody knows where they went and no one has ever been sure.

title: Stunning, haunting and take u back in time
review: The kuldhara abandoned village is a stunnung view. haunting and beautiful remains of a once prosperous village. The remains take you back to another era with stories from  the guide

title: Abandoned of Paliwal Brahmins
review: Great heritage of jaisalmer rajasthan, awesome place to visit before 6 pm. Only. 18 kms from jaisalmer, please take water with you.

title: Spooky or not,definitely worth a visit.
review: On the outskirts of Jaisalmer (approx 20 kms) lies the' haunted village' of Kuldhara.Long deserted by its inhabitants and now in ruins,a visit to this village should be clubbed together with Sam ( sand dunes) There are many interesting stories about how this village came to be deserted,whatever the case, this place is definitely worth a visit.

title: Memorable Experience !
review: Very interesting but tragedy story about this place. You must take a guide to hear the story of this village. Govt.restored the houses & temple. If you are interested to see & hear something different than pl.visit.

title: A very good experience
review: Visited this village in December'14. Situated near Jaisalmer town, this village  was abandoned by Paliwal brahmins in only one night. And thereafter there was no inhabitant in this village. During my visit, shooting of the hindi serial Ashoka of Colours channel was being done. There was a lot of rush. Still managed to visit the remains of the village. It is so called a haunted village. A must visit for all the tourists to Jaisalmer.

title: the haunted village
review: an abandoned village. it looks the people just vanished from there leaving all their good intact. don't know the mystery behind it but i don't believe that there was a witch behind this disappearance. anyway unique place to see in a world where not even single inch of land in not left unoccupied. it is lonely from the zenith to the horizon.

title: Good place to visit
review: Guide will tell u many stories we don't know the truth but the village is like a desert no one is staying there it looks people just vanished from this village u must take guide to hear the story of the village.

title: Must visit..
review: An eerie feeling getting into this abandonded town. The scenes might remind you of many hindi movie songs shot here.

title: Abandoned Kuldhara village
review: Wonder how the entire village vanished overnight... Despite the long veil how did the king see the beautiful girl's face and want to marry her ? The view from the roof top of a house is well worth a sight just before dusk ....

title: Worth visiting !!
review: What a feeling!!!! People abandon the village in One night. Very big village still holding its stories. Few houses still have the roofs and you can see what technology is used to keep it cool

title: Ancient Ground of Mystery Where You Hear Silence.
review: Some experiences stay with you for life. It was the first time ever I heard silence. GO there with least no. of people possible to experience its serenity and calmness. Spend some moments on the window pales and roam freely in the ruin houses. The village has a very captivating story that takes back you in time. I was there 7 years ago, but my memory still serves fresh slides of images.

title: Interesting
review: It is a relic of an old village that has been deserted for many years. there is a very intriguing history of the incidents that led to its desertion. you can see broken relics of houses and temples. good experience.

title: Kuldhara - One Night and 84 villages turn into Kuldhara!
review: Hunted Abandoned Village, where you can not stay over night!

title: Spooky Village
review: The remains of abandoned village are a site to behold, few of the dwellings have been reconstructed to give a glimpse of the houses of that time. While moving in the village site one feels a kind of anxiety keeping in mind the history behind it. We visited the village in the evening hence the atmosphere was more quieter than usual.

title: Nothing but ruined bricks.
review: A lot of stories have been attached to the history of Kuldhara.

title: Ghost Town
review: Its an abandoned village. nothing seems scary as such during the day, post sunset might be another story altogether. The structures which remain standing give a great insight to the living conditions of the people of this village years ago.

title: Stories more romantic than the village
review: We stopped here as part of a half day safari trip. Great story about how it came to become abandoned and nice to hear the men folk standing up for their women. All that is left of the village now are the ruined walls of houses. Those that are more substantial and have roofs (two or three) have been restored by Bollywood film shoots. OK as part of a safari trip but I wouldn't do it on its own.

title: Good but ....
review: Worth visiting, but hyped up little , so many travellers go disappointed . When we were there we didn't anyone to talk. Met a guy and he said so many fictitious details going around. Most of them not true.

title: Visit to the Ghost Village Kuldhara
review: We visited this abandoned village as part of  half day safari organized by Trotters of Jaisalmer. The place except the temple is completely in ruins. The village head man's house at the height is better preserved and some exhibits from the time it was occupied. No shade on the various abandoned mining towns in Western USA. However, the visit makes one realise the tyrannical rulers under whom the people of this area lived and had to leave the place just in one night.

title: Interesting
review: Interesting place of visit. If you visit after sunset, its sure to be spooky. A must see place. I recommend it to everyone visiting Jaisalmer.

title: A place of peace
review: Despite its tragic history, the abandoned village of Kuldhara is a place one has to see during a trip to Jaisalmer.

title: The Eerie Charm of an Abandoned Village
review: About 15-20 km off Jaisalmer, this village has many notorious linkages! Often termed as the Ghost town, a haunted place, deserted, abandoned and a cursed placed. The village was occupied by Paliwals, the Brahmin community.  There are theories that one of the high ranking officials of Royal family wanted to forcefully marry the daughter of the headman of the village, against their wishes. He gave the headman couple of day’s time to agree or be ready to face dreadful consequences. All the villagers in that area disappeared without a trace, and while leaving cursed the place that no one will ever be able to live here. The ruins and remains of the abandoned houses, it seems, supports the veracity of the story. Indeed a very interesting place to visit. Such is the eerie charm of this place that several movies have also been shot here.

title: Conservation in progress
review: Our driver, VIP Vicky Tours, took us here enroute to Jaiselmer. Thank you! This heritage site is currently going through major renovation and it's cool to se the old and reconstructed. Only a few workers and a big job that will take years to complete. Cost is meager 10 pp, there is a also great story about why it's a ghost town.

title: In pursuit of ghosts
review: I had heard a lot about this place before so thought about visiting it . Its situated inroads from jaisalmer- sam . It is a site protected by the Govt . Entering here u will see so man ruins of houses . The multitude makes you realize that it must have been a huge village at that time  .It did seem to have a strange air making you realize why this village was never inhabited again . Couldn't find any ghosts there but its definitely a worthwhile visit .

title: History attached
review: This has got history attached to it, however, only plan if you are planning to go to Sam sand dunes, as this is almost on the way. Not worth going as a standalone destination. Going with a guide would help, as you wont be able to figure out much on your own.

title: Something unusual
review: The abandoned village is on the way to Sam.. so one does not have to make a detour for the site. It is reminiscent of the Indus Valley Civilisation sites (as I havew seen from oictures) .. though of course it is built in sand-stone and not bricks. There were 2 things I could not understand. A.>  All the houses were laid in a neat East-West/ North -South grid . This is VERY VERY unusual for INdia. B> All the houses were comparatively large... giving the imoression that only rich people lived there... no huts or smaller houses.

title: Ghost Village or Movie Set?
review: Located en-route Sam sand dunes off Jaisalmer, this place will definitely remind you a Bollywood style movie set. It's an odd 7-8 Kms lonely drive from the Jaisalmer-Sam main road. It is a protected heritage. You will be welcomed by a lone guard. The moment you get inside, you can realize it is a long abandoned village. 4X4 vehicle is preferred. There is indeed an eerie feeling inside the village. But it offers some splendid views and the village is worth visiting. Not a standalone destination.You can club it with desert safari.

title: Nothing Amusing here
review: It's just an abandoned village nothing amusing here.. Just a temple and many abandoned huts. We went there while on our way to sam and were out within few minutes. For faint hearted it could still be spooky but don't expect anything you hear from locals..  no ghost to see here...

title: spookey not so much
review: well we have read about this abandoned village and we had to see this place for ourselves. It was not as thrilling with so much constriction work going on .. Its hardly the spooky village that its made out to be, but is an exicting place to see

title: A Ghost Village near India- Pakistan Border
review: some 17 Kms ahead of Jaisalmer, lies a totally abandoned Village,a desolate village  or a Village which has been cursed, and brings sadness to heart.

title: Not worth it
review: It is an old abandoned village which looks as if artificially created to rake in more tourists. Nothing exciting about this place.

title: Haunted village
review: The story has it that it was a thriving village with hundreds of families  living. A nawab saw a beautiful girl in the village and wanted to marry her. He gave an ultimatum for marriage falling which he will kidnap her. One fine morning it was found that the whole village was empty with no one knowing where villagers have migrated overnight. Today the houses are in dilapidated condition with mud streets. There is a village temple also. One house is restored as a sample. It is located on the way from Jaisalmer to Sam, the sand dunes.

title: average place
review: there is nothing much in this place.there are old homes and local will tell you the stories of ghost and why this place got abandoned.

title: Over Hyped
review: There are lot of stories associated with sudden immigration of residents hundreds of years ago. The ruins look less authentic. It seems to be more of a time ravaged village than a village narrating a story in modern times. You hardly get the impression of life being lead at that time and system. Not worth it. Being promoted by Tourism Department which charges an entry fee as well

title: Pretty good
review: it was not amazing or spectacular but there was actually ruined houses for a large area, it was very interesting. There were people living next to it however. It seems that some of the buildings and temples were rebuilt, whether for tourist purposes of for worship I couldn't tell. But it seemed like a touristy place.

title: Not worthwhile
review: We went there on route to the Sam Sand Dunes, on a pair of bikes... Its okay if you stop over at the place for 10 min enroute Sam. But I would strongly recommend not to make a separate plan to visit this. High chance of disappointment.

title: The Village
review: We visited Kuldhara Village while travelling to desert safari.It is a abandoned village nothing much to see, but it is good for some one who has lot of interest in history and art.You can simply see stones lying on ground which resembles it could have been a home years ago. So in a very large area you can find stones lying abandoned.Spent some time and move on.

title: Brings history alive
review: It is the amazing story of a resilient clan that refused to buckle under a tyrannical overlord and decided to simply vanish one night. And you look at these solid, carefully built houses and the temple and appreciate how cornered they must have felt to abandon homes, security and property...a silent but really powerful protest because in all, more than fifty such villages emptied! If you like history, you have to visit.

title: Eerie place
review: An abandoned village about 18km from Jaisalmer, it was once a prosperous village to the learned Paliwal Brahmins.  This village was deserted when the lusty king laid his eyes on the beautiful daughter of the village chieftain.  Gusty winds blast sand into the eyes and give an eerie feeling in the 20 minutes you are there.

title: A walk among the ruins
review: It's similar to bhangarh i.e. it is also having a mystery around itself and the houses are similarly unroofed. The place feels as if an aura is accompanying you. This leaves you thinking that where did the 84 villages disappear in just single night. The locals believe it to be haunted but there is nothing as such. The government is also not concerned in promoting this spot, but if you have time and a love for folklore stories then go for it....I hope you will not regret.

title: Abandoned for 500 years
review: There is an interesting story behind why this village was abandoned. This is on the way to the desert and takes half an hour to explore. There is a cactus park just outside the village gate. Do visit that if you are interested in flora. They charge a nominal fee for car entry, irrespective of the number of people in the car.

title: Quite and peaceful for sunset
review: This palce is my second best choice for sunset in the desert.

title: Ghost Town
review: I loved the story behind this place.

title: Haunted place
review: Haunted place surrounded with stories of real life into deserted place. Preferably don't visit with small children or after dark.

title: Must visit just for History and not a Haunted place
review: Place is about 15km from sam sand dunes. Myth that this is a Haunted village however there is nothing like that . Though the History of this village is quite amazing to hear from the locals.

title: Not much to see, just an abandoned village, but..
review: Seriously, in my own views, it was just a wastage of time to visit this place but the story attached to this place is good enough to have a look at this place.

title: Tourist trap and a waste of time
review: This place is nothing but a tourist trap, you will only get charlatans who will tell you some made up story for money. If you are with a tour guide, insist on directly taking you to the desert instead of wasting time at this place.

title: Picturesque
review: Early morning or late afternoon are the best time to visit when the sun is slanting - gives a warmth to the pictures.

title: Haunted village
review: Visited the hunted village at 1:30am, hoping to see a ghost, nothing of that sort happened but sky and its full moon were spectacular

title: Excellent Place to visit
review: Old left overs of the village worth watching.. Advisable to visit during the first half of the day.. Worth Visiting once.. Carry your own food if u would like to spend some more time at the attraction to enjoy the local music & dance.

title: very rural Rajasthan
review: Very little to see but several of the houses have been partially restored and you get a feel of what this place must have been like when it was still occupied.  Very few visitors get here, but well worth an hour or so if you are anywhere near.

title: Surprise
review: We must respect the Lady. It’s a live example of the village. Whole villagers left the village within a night for a girl respect. Everyone should salute those villagers.

title: Not really worth it.
review: Went here as part of a camel tour/trek as a warmup stop.  Empty ruins with a bit of litter - not scenic like other ruins

title: Amazing
review: Though deserted now this village was fully occupied few years ago but was abandoned in just one night as all the villagers fled away due to kings brutality. But it looks amazingly beautiful even though it has broken houses. Its a must visit place when you are at Sam.

title: A spooky experience at Kuldhara Abandoned Village
review: Suryagarh Hotel do a midnight ghost tour of the village.It was interesting to be out at midnight  in the middle of nowhere and enter this abandoned village. Our tour guide Sheetansh was excellent i was so frightened  i didn't want to get out of the car, we were the only ones in the village and it was spooky . A must do for a bit of a ghost scare.

title: GOOD TO VISIT
review: This is a new experience to visit the ghost village. I really wonder about the existance of the ghosts. Good architecture of the ruined houses,. A broken village with lot of history behind...

title: Dissapointing
review: Went with a lot of expectations . At first glance it looks very interesting but there are no placards to explain anything .came to know its history only after visiting some other haveli in Jaisalmer .a sound and light show would certainly bring about a lot of value addition

title: waste of money
review: waste of time and money. Very poorly managed and seems like not cleaned for years. Just the mechanism of Govt to mint money

title: Nothing haunted about it
review: Really nothing haunted about it. Too many stories and myths about this village, but god only knows the truth. They charge nominal fees to check this place, but its sad that there is no information about this place. Maybe they really don't want to share the true story.

title: Old and historical
review: It is a very dusty walk around the village but an interesting walk around history. The abandoned village is worth a visit. Narrow roads and small homes give an impression of past lives living here. Some good guide can weave around a good story but not sure if you should believe in them. They are more fables than facts. Would recommend a visit here for sure.

title: Don't expect too much
review: The story behind the village is interesting and mysterious (where did they all suddenly disappear to?) but all that is left is a lot of half collapsed stone walls and a couple of reconstructed buildings.  It is worth a brief stop on the way out to a camel safari perhaps, but it's not a destination worth going to any trouble to get to.

title: The dead village
review: People who had visited this place before me mostly said they got an eerie feeling visiting this place. But truly speaking, I felt sad for this village which feels like it was once a throbbing hamlet bustling with life and activity, which one fine night the inhabitants decided to abandon for reasons best known to them. All there's left now are mounds of stone where once the houses used to be, barely speaking of the structure. Maybe you can make out a window here or a door there but that's all there's left of Kuldhara, which leaves you thirsting to know more as to why it is now nothing but a skeleton of a past which perhaps has its real story waiting to be told.

title: A place to visit : only story
review: place is just a story. to attract tourist , the re-construct some home to show visitor about the village life. making this a tourist point by publishing story about it.

title: Completely deserted
review: The village was abondoned 300 years ago. It's scary to see how a village is vacated due to fear of ghosts. We were advised not stay there after 4 pm and we complied with the same.  It was unbelievable but when we reached there,  we didn't want to challenge ourselves and stay there for long. Overall,  positive recommendation for a visit.

title: Old ruins of a whole village
review: Just ruins of a village, about 600 families lived here. Story goes that the village had about 600 Brahmin families.  The King wanted to forcibly take away the girls from the village and get married to them.  So, overnight, the whole village decided to abandon the place and run away to the neighboring state.  These ruins still exist. Also is a ruin of a temple and the village head's house. Worth a quick visit on the way to the Sam Sand Dunes.

title: Where Time stood still
review: The folk lore around this village is really interesting. Place is preserved but now getting into shambles.

title: Nothing ghostly about it!
review: Known as the 'ghost town', this is a must visit from Jaisalmer. It is around 30 km from the main city. There is a legend associated with it which is best heard from the locals.

title: Great place to visit
review: Kuldhara is a village near Jaisalmer town, which is now in its ruins. Nobody stays there. Tourists visit during day and then leave. You can hire a car or auto-rickshaw at the city and come down for  some time. It has its own story, like why it was emptied within one night, but better you hear that story from the locals. One story will then need to another.

title: go in the evenings
review: We were 2 couples and reached kuldhara just before its closing time at 1800hrs. We did experience something weird about the place about 3 men talking amongst themselves of how the place was not the same when they had died. Not reacting to it, we walked out of it.

title: Kuldhara
review: Kuldhara must have been an impressive village at one point of time. Few of the ruins have been restored to showcase the division of rooms, courtyards and even a small basement.

title: lots of history but ill managed.no strong reason to visit
review: located away from the city on a road off the sam road, kuldhara makes no compelling reason to visit.

title: Abandoned town..
review: what make people to vacate their home..disease, poverty, attack or some other supernatural. one can not get correct answer for Kuldhara town. good for walk among the town and see why every one just left houses and still no one dare to stay here or occupy one.

title: Spooky and sad but definitely not haunted
review: 5 km off the jaisalmer-Sam highway, a broken road takes you to this old, abandoned town of Kuldhara. Nobody is around to guide you, or tell you what is what except a moustached man at the main entrance who charges a small fee for entering.

title: Ghost town in India
review: This is an unusual sight to see--a ghost town in India!  When trade routes changed, the village fell into ruin.  It's worth seeing.

title: abandoned village
review: Different people tell different stories about this village. but certainly doesnt seem to be a haunted village. interesting, only if you  are with a guide...else just a dirty, broken house village.Not at all maintained. No facility.

title: Worth a visit.
review: If you have a vehicle it's worth a look-you can make a worthwhile outing of it by tying in some other places not too far away.

title: A place with a different VIBE
review: Yes it should be a must visit place if you are planning a trip to Jaisalmer. And if you like spooky places, this is THE place. And also a story goes on with this place which will allow you to relate more to this place.

title: Amazing history
review: The history about the place is amazing. The place also shows great planning and architecture in those days.

title: haunting
review: this is such a sad story and evidence of what seems like a legendary story. very haunting to see and walk around.

title: Forgotten lands! Worth a visit!
review: The kuldhara village gives an amazing experience of an village in ruins and now getting reconstructed. The dismantled houses and baoris make a picturesque view. It is a must visit place on your way to the dunes from the city. The site sends a chilling quiver -- takes you back to the era of Mohen-jo-daro type history which everyone would have studied. Broken houses, stairs, chulhas, etc. give a glimpse of the centuries old India. there isn't much to do except stroll around the area and click some good pictures atop the houses. There is also a deep baori which one can see from the top. Once in Jaisalmer, these places add to the charm of the city and hence must visiting once.

title: Abandoned / Cursed / Ghost village
review: this place is around 15 to 20 kms from Jaisalmer.

title: History
review: It was a eye opening visit .. one must not miss this visit during their jaisalmer trip ... 86 villages left the village in just one night ... just to save their girl ...

title: Haunted Village
review: The village has a history unique to its own. people evacuated 84 villages overnight and left behind a curse on this village of Kuldhara in the ancient times.

title: Curse of death
review: This ghost town is still spooky. A sarpanch had cursed it 1500 years back. The delhi paranormal society visited here and still found traces of spooky ness! Unsual rise and fall of temperature, noises and hand prints when no one was visible

title: ancient Village
review: this is the best site..... the whole village was destroyed but some of the structures were reconstructed, it gives a nice glimpse of how people lived some 300 years ago. its worth visit.

title: Interesting
review: Well...sorry to kill the myth...but the place is not haunted. But whats really great is that even inspite of the myth - that of its being a haunted village - its so insightful, so interesting to visit the abandoned village. There's so much to learn in terms of the nice planned houses - that were....

title: Abandoned Ghost Town
review: A nice and chilly experience for travelers, especially for those who love ghost stories and like to travel to such places.

title: Overhyped place
review: there's a history to this place which marks this place as mysterious.but it can be skipped.Its on the way from jaisalmer city towards sam sand dunes.

title: DESERTED VILLAGE IN DESERT
review: Kuldhara is a ruined village in the middle of the desert. Not only this village but 84 villages of Paliwal Brahmins were left by its inhabitants around 400 years back left village one terrifying night, leaving everything behind. It was informed to us by Sumer Ram, who is a caretaker of the Kuldahara Village.

title: Can be managed better
review: The village has a fascinating history. And the village is really a nice place to see. I just wish it was maintained better. Too many urchins demanding money at every turn. And no official guides. I felt sad at the lost potential of the place

title: What a mystery
review: It is amazing that 82 villages are emptied in a night or two and no body knows where they disappeared. This is the story of Kuldhara, Khaba and 80 other villages. The walls stand, silent a testament to people who lived here and disappeared one night. Apparently to escape a cruel ruler who wanted to marry a girl from the village. It is surreal to stand there and look at these walls. What secret do they hide? Who knows. One has to see these villages to believe this story.

title: The story is interesting, but the site is all but rubble
review: My partner and I are history and architecture lovers, so ancient abandoned cities are right up our alley. Kuldhara, however, is mostly piles of stones and the sense of it being a city is mostly lost. It was an interesting place for about 5-10 minutes, but then you realise that everything looks the same. If you'd like to go, keep low expectations and enjoy it for what it is: an advertisement for a famous folktale and a common site for filming.

title: Just Skip
review: Not worth going to this place as there is hardly anything to actually see. You would also be met with bus loads full of people trying to get into a small old building.

title: Eerie and haunting
review: At 9 pm, on an open jeep with family .... The moment we entered Kuldhara, felt something eerie. 400 year old Abandoned houses, a well, a legend dating the 1600's ....

title: Abandoned village with no authentic version why it's abandoned
review: Kuldhara is an abandoned village in Jaisalmer district of Rajasthan. It is situated around 18 Kms from Jaisalmer city. Paliwal Brahmins used to live in this village till 170 years ago. Theer are numerous stories about this village that how people left it and why it is considered haunted. Villagers abandoned this village as ruler of the area Diwan Salim Singh had tried to force marriage with a girl of the village and villagers did not agree rather they left village with a curse that this village will remain abandoned forever. There are stories that ghosts roam around in night time but our driver who is local told that ghost stories are not true. You should visit this place once, but keep only 15-20 minutes slot for this visit, its not worth more than it. You will find abandoned houses and rubble only and no authentic source to tell story about it.

title: Can be skipped
review: This one can be skipped if you have  short tour plan. This is a deserted village with an interesting story. Better do your homework to learn the story don't believe in local ppl there,  they all will come up with their own version of the actual story.

title: Haunted Village, haunted mood
review: We drove to Kuldhara, which is a detour on the road between Sam Dunes & Jaisalmer quite by chance. It is a gated village & strangely all houses have no roofs. There is a temple right in the middle & from most roof tops the view of the city is spectacular. The village has a history due to which it is supposedly inhabitable during nights. Travellers have reportedly encountered strange noises & sights during past attempts of night stays. However, we felt quite comfortable moving freely in the village, more so because we went in the broad day light. However, a must visit just for the sheer sense of mystery this place has.

title: Interesting
review: We visited at night. Just to make it a little scary! Very interesting part of history in the area. Heard that during the day it can be very busy.

title: Ruins but no ghosts
review: The place is cheap and a distraction so if you are in the area and have spare time then Definately visit, if nothing more then you can make up the next ghost story about this place.

title: Deserted place
review: Well maintained by ASI though a scary palce. Towards the evening few tourists who visit the palce are in a hurry to leave.  Approach road to the village is in a bad condition. We reached late there and found that we were the only people there as all had left by that time. Moved around and discovered the ruins and left as soon as the Sun set.

title: a story in depression
review: Though the name is kuldhara, its an abandoned village, and gives a sad feeling on visit.Strange that the entire village of 85 or so houses vacated the entire village overnight to save one daughter, who was being forced to marry  a man thrice her age, nothing much to see, the villge is slowly turning into a haunted village..

title: Must see
review: This place is amazing, the story goes back some 300+ years and when you see those abandoned houses, you feel a sadness in the air. Slightly out of town but should not be missed at all

title: deserted place
review: it is a abondened village with a history of 500 years. The roofless houses through out the village sends a scary feel down the spine. but must visit place although approach road is not in a good condition.

title: An imagination into history
review: Kuldhara tells story of Paliwal Brahmins cursing and abondoning it centuries back, which led it not to be habitated ever. It is not a place which every tourist would love. Deserted Ruins give you an imagination, how the village would have been centuries back; Broken statues of Gods gives you the feeling of some catastrophe happened at that time.

title: No big deal
review: The story of this ghost town will be told retold and then told again multiple times with additions, subtractions, garnishes and plain by one and sundry during your stay at Jaisalmer.. I think I heard a total of 7 versions of this town's abandonment history... Go if you must.. No biggie...

title: Worth a Visit
review: This one is a must watch. How would you feel if your town empties in a night. Well Kuldhara is a ruined village in the middle of the desert. The town is as is as it was left by the inhabitants. The legend says that in the early 1800's a landlord threatened the people with death. While leaving the town the people cursed it. Since then the town has not been inhabited. Legend also says that the village disappeared due to paranormal activity. Well worth a visit. This village is clearly marked on GPS and Google maps. Approach road is a litte in bad space. Takes about 15-20 to reach village from Main road.

title: Far from the madding crowd
review: You have to be there to soak in the bizarre beauty of this deserted dusty expanse. You can feel the heaviness in your heart. Of those who left the village one terrifying night, leaving everything behind. They cursed as they left. And, yes, no one could ever settle down here and build a home. That's how the storyy goes. Our bus dropped us on a dusty tract of land. It was mid-afternoon and the October sun was lukewarm. A gentle breeze was blowing. There was no one around. No one except us. Suddenly from amidst the ruins emerged two human figures. A little girl and an elderly lady. They seemed to be the only ones left behind when they all left many many years ago. We asked them to click a group photograph with us. We stood among the ruins. Only a mournful history of the place separated us.

title: Worth a visit
review: Worth a visit. Learn about the story behind the village. However, its not something you cannot miss as well

title: Nice place
review: This is a good place to visit. It has a very interesting story associated with its abandonment. Plus a number of movies and TV serials are shot here. In fact we got a chance to see the shooting of a TV serial.

title: Fascinating story.. great place for legend-buffs
review: The abandoned village of Kuldhara has a great fascinating legend and when you view the place along with the driver narrating the sad story, the place come alive.

title: good photo session
review: there is entry fee  for it. visit it while travel to sam count 1 hour for it from main road travel and take some memorable shots in this ruin village. good pictures when you see at home stories about the village may be true but nothing horrible like some reviews in back. also take some snaps on the main road yellow marble stones.

title: Great destination for Photography
review: You need to pay for entry fee for entering into Kuldhara Village. You may have heard of great haunted and horror stories of Kuldhara and they are true which you'll realize when you visit Kuldhara.

title: Nice place to visit
review: Well, in the 80s, we saw many Bollywood heroes entering an abandoned village where houses have been evacuated due to some evil power. The entrance to this village is exactly like that. The village is nice with a small newly constructed temple where it is worth to have some good photos.

title: Recommended
review: The abandoned village will show the types of houses villagers had century's back. It will show you how rooms were back then. Must visit to know more about the history. Many stories you will hear about it being haunted.

title: OK
review: It was different and i guess not that bad.It's just an abandoned village from hundred years ago.somehow some of the buildings still stood and it was a bit creepy.I can see a horror movie being made here.hehe.I always wanted to see this so it was a bit of a letdown.

title: kuldhara,not to be missed
review: A must-see place.The village abandoned by paliwal brahmins.History still resonates here.There is an air of sadness all around and an eerie feeling too.Nobody dares to spend a night in this village.We would definitely like to revisit to listen to the whispers of the past.

title: Walk through the ruins
review: Kuldhara as it stands now is just the ruins of an old village. Ask any local and he will be able to tell you the history. It's amazing to see vast stretches of very old roofless broken stone houses. There is also a temple right in the middle of the abandoned village.

title: Hauntingly Exciting
review: Delhi is built on the ruins of seven cities.. Kuldhara hauntingly offers itself to be seen as completely ruined abandoned Eerie village,with roofless bricked houses in narrow lanes..you can enter those hundred of years old houses and feel the presence of No one from Nowhere in an eerie way..an out of this world experience for sure.Loved it thoroughly as it was uniquely different.

title: Ruins of the once lively town
review: As the story goes, the town was abandoned one night and left to ruin. So all that we see there are ruins of the town and a lord hanuman temple in the centre. The yellow stone is what makes it a beautiful sight.

title: Haunted Village
review: Locals claim that spirit of the people(Palliwals) who left this village to Jodhpur and Pakistan's Hyderabad in the 18th Century are still exist. It is on the way to Sam sand dunes, so go for it to explore.

title: The deserted village
review: The place is worth seeing, if you want to do some good photography of ruins. The village is completely deserted and in ruins. However, we found that two of the ruined houses have been renovated. Our driver told us that they have been renovated to facilitate shooting of some TV serials.

title: Place to visit
review: The story of the village is so painful but truth is truth. We learn lessons from our own history.  But its a must place to visit for all tourists going to Jaisalmer

title: Scary yet interesting to visit
review: This village is full of broken and half collapsed houses. There was 1 house that was rebuilt for tourism and a temple in the middle of the village. Had heard many stories about this place and was little scared to visit but couldn't ignore.

title: Worth a detour
review: We were advised by locals that there was nothing really to see there, but the evocative atmosphere of a town (normally described as a village, but too big for that) simply deserted overnight was impressive.

title: worth visit
