review: History of 300 yrs back. Around 84 villages abandoned the area due to the harassment of one of the Vajir. Story is not probable, it might be due to drought or any other natural problem.

title: Interesting to see empty village
review: It was told that 84 villages were abandoned in one night due to one of the ministers around 2 centuries ago.

title: Abandoned Village
review: Good to see empty temple and houses. on the way to Sam desert. Roads are little bad. but worth seeing.

title: Huanted Village
review: We visited at the time of sunset. As we entered inside we saw an entire village was empty with broken walls and bricks

title: great
review: heard a lot about it. Got to see it too. nice for clicking pics. it is an abandoned place and is a sight for history geeks like me. do not forget to click pictures. try to get out of your vehicle and walk around

title: Ruins with not much to see
review: These are the ruins of a old abandoned village inhabited by the Paliwal brahmins. It was the chief of 84 villages that were abandoned overnight and this village is said to be cursed, so no one lives here.

title: best heritage village
review: heard a lot about it. Got to see it too. nice for clicking pics. it is an abandoned place and is a sight for history geeks like me. do not forget to click pictures. try to get out of your vehicle and walk around

title: place that meets the myth history and people ......
review: an abandoned village with a history of people vanishing from all 84 villages where kuldhara was the main village ... story is that a king got attracted to the daughter of the head of the group of villages and wanted to marry her .. else he would destroy all those villages and people .. all heads of each villages decided against and on a night all those people abandoned their home and left unknown where to ...

title: a worthy visit on the way to the Desert
review: An abandonned village by the miths.The village shall be re-made soon, government is working very hard on it.Within a months time the restoration work should be complete.

title: Eerie and mystical
review: There is this eerie thing in this village whos inhabitants have said to leave in one night following a threat from the Raja's minister. There is this silence all around which can at times transport you that era. Dont move alone in this place, better move in groups. There are snakes and mongooses at places. What is interesting is the structures of the entire village still stands erect which proves architechturally it was strongly built in those times too.

title: Historical
review: The story of events that led to its abandonment. It takes about an hour to see the entire ruin. Amazed at the chariot sitting in the palace quarters . See how simply even royalty lived at the time.

title: Worth a visit if you have time.
review: Folklore has it that people of this village and 85 other villages  abandoned their homes almost over night some 300 years back. There are two stories of why they did it. As per one story, they didn't want  a local minister to marry one their daughters or face persecution that was to come for not doing so. Other story has to do with huge loss of men the suffered in one of the battles with the Muslim king of Delhi on Rakshabandhan day.

title: One of key attractions of Jaisalmer
review: We heard a lot about the place and has decided to give it a shot. Its approximately 20KM from the city and can be seen while going for visiting SAM Sand dunes. We liked the place, the story behind it and the way its has been maintained. A kind of must watch place during your stay at Jaisalmer.

title: Expected something else!
review: We expected it not to be a touristy place. But it perhaps was!.. Worth going there on your way to the Sam sand dunes. Nothing much to do apart from some creative pictures in the ruins. The ruins have loads of bats inside so be sure you want to explore.

title: amty village
review: Anyone visiting Jaisalmer must not miss Kuldhara Village which has been abandoned since 1800s. Now ASI has taken care of the village. If you see from the tourist point of view you will just see a demolished and abondoned village. But if you go to History of this village you will be astonished so as I. It was heard that almost 4000 villagers were escaped from this village in one night and migrated elsewhere.

title: Interesting place but scary story
review: This place is really good but feels somewhat sad/sacred when you get to know the story behind the place. Go around the place spend some time  and take some photos..

title: Surely an haunted experince in broad day light
review: Got to know the history of this place through locals and decided to visit aslo listed in top 20 haunted places in India

title: Abondoned Village
review: Nice ruins of houses which was left by brahmins family over 300 years ago. Nice story of Cruel king and Daughter of Village

title: Thrill to visit manless village
review: This village can give you some scary movements if visited in the evening time alone. As such its just empty village with broken houses. But its sad  history gives it unique feel. Nothing much to see though.

title: Epic place too be but scary
review: It is rated as one of the most haunted place near jaisalmer. When u go their u will feel some negative vibes, my mom and sis were not at all comfortable. I was the one who pulled the whole family to kuldhara. My car key was going to be in the car if i didnt happened to remember to pull it out and i really got scared as the sun was going off.

title: Apart from a history that is made interesting nothing of note
review: The so called haunted village has one story about it other than that the ruins are quite bad and almost offer no insight into the old life style that might have been.

title: Interesting story behind this village
review: As per our driver-cum-guide Mr.Khan, some 1000years back, the Rajkumar of this city/village was after marrying many girls. One pandit's, girl was to be forcibly married and the pandit gave a curse saying that nobody will live in that city/village any longer and evacuated the whole village/city overnight.  There are lots of abandoned houses and also we saw a temple.

title: The associated story is more fascinating
review: This is one of the 84 of the abandoned villages. The houses are all reduced to heaps of stones. Worth a visit as the story around it gives you an eerie feeling

title: A stop on the way to Dunes
review: Just an empty village with borken strucutre of old houses. No need to spend too much of time there if you are going as a part of tour package coz it will eat our time which you can spend on dunes but a 10 min stop is ok.

title: EERIE BUT WORTH A VISIT: THE HISTORY IS HEARTBREAKING
review: I personally feel this is one of the best places to visit in Jaisalmer. The village has an eerie feeling when you enter. The old man at the gate charges a minor entrance fee. The Tourism Dept has done up the village to an extent, the temple is intact, while one odd house has been renovated. The story of the Paliwal Brahmins and their exodus is somewhat heart-rending. I went done to another of the abandoned villages Kaba Fort and the state was the same. Imagine 84 villages being vacated in one night. Phew! Do read up on the history prior to your visit. Just outside the village is the bed of a stream, where if you dig around you might be lucky to pick up a few fossils of aneomite etc. Worth a visit any day.

title: Skip it !
review: Nothing great about this abandoned village.  just old houses, under constructed ones... and a temple ... only interesting part is the story ... which you can hear from anyone in the town itself.  Avoid it, if you have something better to do ...  or spend a quick 10 min there en route Sam

title: One time visit
review: It is one of those places you visit and then tell others not to. Nothing great about the abandoned village, apart from the story. One can skip it if the schedule is tight. A long, silent road leads to a gate where an old man will charge entry.. once you enter the gates you see broken homes, utensils, a temple and a glimpse of life that was.

title: interesting story
review: The abandoned village is very close to Sam dunes and can be visited enroute... the story is quite interesting and is good to hear it from a guide.. was a good experience... would make sense to visit ponly if you are going to Sam...

title: Nice Old viilage
review: The village has his own story .... nice place to see old houses. ofcourse it is abandoned village but must feel it

title: Not to be missed: Out of world experience
review: If you visiting Jaiselmer, one thing you should not miss is Kuldhara. The drive is solitary drive when it take a cut  between Jaiselmer  and SAM sand dunes. I have visited this place twice and would not miss third time. There are some stories associated about this place being haunted... but all that is crap.

title: Quaint and dusty village
review: A nice village enroute to the dunes from Jaisalmer. Spend an hour exploring the abandoned houses in this village. See the style of construction, the stark dry landscape and reflect a while on what the stories of this village may have been. The local tourism can do a better job of showcasing this place, have some walking tours etc.

title: THE LOST ERA
review: Anyone visiting Jaisalmer must not miss Kuldhara Village which has been abandoned since 1800s. Now ASI has taken care of the village. If you see from the tourist point of view you will just see a demolished and abondoned village. But if you go to History of this village you will be astonished so as I. It was heard that almost 4000 villagers were escaped from this village in one night and migrated elsewhere. But till today the history is silent about where they had gone.Visit and enjoy.

title: Interesting Story
review: The village has his own story .... nice place to see old houses. of course it is abandoned village but must feel it

title: Haunted
review: This place is haunted as told by local people. Once can find empty structures+ there is temple which one can visit

title: haunted village
review: We were two families travelling together. From Jaisalmer we took a package tour which would show us the real desert and cultural evening followed by rajasthani dinner. It was rs 600 for adults and rs 400 for children between 5-12. This did not include the taxi which we had hired separately. Started at around 3:30 pm and reached Kuldhara village which was a bit out of the way (we had to take a little diversion). Our driver told us about the history of this village. All villagers had left their belongings behind and moved out in just one night. Reason being forced intercaste marriage of a village girl which her parents resented. The village was in ruins. All we could see was walls of the houses and the streets. It was quite a big village and imagining leaving everything behind in one night really gives a chilling feeling. The place had a haunted feeling and the locals avoid this place after dark.

title: Feeling of Attachment
review: My Mom's Grand Father was also Paliwal. After Reaching there it was a emotional feeling of visiting village of my ancestors. Its very hard to believe that so many persons just vacated this in just one Night.

title: eerie!!
review: the whole place is spooky but yet hard to understand the folk lore. a must visit. the place is good for a one visit on way to the dunes.

title: Kuldhara
review: Ummm. What can you say about an empty village. It looks spooky, because it is abandoned. Visited it during the day, with other people, so it didn't feel haunted. However it has a feel of history.

title: Waste of time
review: There is nothing in village without stones.just waste of time. One more love story.please dont go there.use that time for sand dunes

title: Evening Erie experience
review: Go there at sunset and as it gets dark, make sure you take a long walk to experience the so called haunted feeling

title: no courage
review: Did not have the courage to take children

title: Nothing great
review: We went with high expectations but it turned out to be a real bummer. Nothing but bunch of diliapidated huts and a temple.

title: Haunting ! Indeed...
review: We reached there in an auto-rickshaw. The road to village itself is eerie and silent even at afternoons. Just like the place. There are numerous stories about the village how it got abandoned in a single night, that adds more fuel when you reach there. You see broken homes, with earthen pots lying there. Some, lying under dunes of sand. Some open. Some having bushes grown and some dunes, having signs of reptile creatures that just passed.

title: An Abandoned Village
review: Nice to visit in view of Historical. An abandoned village. One can skip this place if time is not premiting to travel much

title: avoid
review: avoid nothing there to see its wastage of time and no guide to explain the reason of all villagers to leave

title: Worth a Visit on way to Sam sand dunes
review: This place is worth visit on your way to Sam Sand Dunes. This is a village that was vacated over night by Pali bharamins.

title: Deserted Village
review: The story behind the exodus from this village is very moving and makes a big impression. Your guide will tell you when you are there. It is also a beautiful place.

title: Good Place
review: Good place to visit. Lot of stories to be heard of the hauntedness of the places. A nice experience. But night visit can be very thrilling and intersting

title: worth a visit
review: Kuldhara, is enroute to SAM from jaisalmer. it is worthwhile to go there if you have the time. it is an abandoned village and nothing else. there are two stories going around, but the most likely one is that the village refused to pay extra taxes (due to wars being waged) to the king. they were told of dire consequence if they dont, since they did  not pay, they vacated the village and redistributed themselves over one month. the village disappearing overnight is a myth.  30 min is all that takes to visit the village.

title: d haunting...
review: u  may feel as if the place is cursed, which it is as per locals...however, u will love to ride through the village

title: Nice place
review: It is very unique and magical place where you feel so spiritual and relaxing. The empty village make very good expresion, the empty houses, temple, you can see how the people build the houses before, for shure if you in Jaisalmer please visit this place

title: An interesting and unique sight
review: The abandoned village's structures show the level of artisan's mastery over their subject. Few structures appear to be restored. The stone-work is amazing. But one wonders if the tales surrounding it are true!

title: Kuldhara Abondoned Village in Jaisalmer
review: When on Jaisalmer Tour I want to know what are the interesting places to see,My City Expert Shaan  told me story of Kuldhara village. The story was really filmy type and interesting.

title: face to face with folktales
review: Kuldhara - read about it in books, on the way to Sam Sand Dunes, this was a 5Km detour from main road. Worth a quick stopover !

title: The Ghost village
review: Perfect place to visit during sunset. Can imagine how rich the village must have been. Gold diggers still get lucky even now. Last, I heard was just a couple of months ago. I really do wish that the local government should cordon of this place and ensure tight security.

title: great to teach kids about olden times
review: not too many tourist, so you can spend about 30-45 mins, admiring the ruins and taking pics. Its a good place to show kids about olden times and the houses

title: 400 years old abandoned village
review: The abandoned village is specially for those who want to click good landscapes with the abandoned houses, temple, "Chhatris".

title: among the best places i have seen
review: nothing was there to like because this is proof of disatar of a well developed & prosperous city 400 ago.

title: Kuldhara-Jaisalmer
review: On way to Sam give some 15-20 mins to this place. An old abandoned village. Looks very calm if there are less no of tourist

title: serene , with history
review: this is an interesting place of large numbers of abandoned dwellings . it is on the way to sam dunes from jaisalmer with about 4 kms off the road , so easly accessible .

title: Good for click
review: Abandoned village - approx 20 km from Jaisalmer. The village has entry fee. There is no map of village. There is no one to guide you. There is no ficilities - washroom etc. It is good for old landscap clicks. It may take approx 30-45 min to visit. If you have time and interested in photography then worth to visit it.

title: AVOID
review: Very secluded, not worth a visit just some broken houses and open area. No description nothing also doesn't feel safe going there.

title: Entry fees is too much
review: There are remains of village but some of the building has been made up which doesn't match with old building

title: Amazing history..
review: The story of the Kuldhara abandoned village was interesting. We heard two versions of it. One about the girl being forced into marriage and how the united village decided to vacate the entire village overnight. The other story was about the increasing tariffs that the villagers couldn't give and decided to vacat the village overnight.

title: Strange experience
review: It is a strange experience to see a whole village in ruins and abandoned. There is a local folklore behind this. Many of the houses had old rural design of rafts.

title: No Spirit, only spirit bottles, he he!!
review: Before going there heard it was a haunted place. But soon after reaching there found the place was a let down. Rather than finding the unholy spirits, found a lot of broken spirit bottles. Most amazing thing of the place is the caretaker who is amazingly a hundred years old young, fit guy..he he!!

title: Disappointing
review: Nothing to see. Deserted place with houses which only have walls and no roofs. Nothing at all, a time waste

title: The abandoned Village
review: We visited the place in evening while going back to our camp as it was on the way. The place has ruins of the village and they have now constructed a temple and a haveli for the tourist to take pictures. Only go there if you have extra time...otherwise it can be given a miss.

title: Its abandoned village after all
review: Kuldhara is a small village enroute to sand dunes, and its been shown by almost every tour operator. Legend says that this village was abandoned about 300-400 years back. Now it has remains of houses (made of stacking stone bricks) connected by narrow lanes. They have managed to preserve one temple and couple of houses to depict how people use to build and stay in those houses. Nothing much as its abandoned village after all :)

title: Amazingly preserved heritage village
review: Must visit and see the architecture of multi story sample houses of those days.  The village appears to be pretty big and these must be over couple of hundred abandoned houses.  Vehicles are allowed right upto any village house, this may be restricted.

title: must see place
review: if you r travelling jaiselmer the on should watch khuldhra village and must know the history of this place its very unique  and for photograpy lover this will add new topic to your pics

title: Temple without an idol and a village abondened
review: Here's an abandoned village , on way to Sam desert and approximately 20 km from jaisalmer which has many stories. A little search on the net will get any one details about this village. While there is settlement before the village, in this village, you will find a complete village in ruins. What impressed me was the dead silence in the place amid ruins of houses, and one central chawk there in the centre of the village is a temple stripped of the idol but temple  generally intact or preserved by the archeological department.

title: Abandoned Village
review: Kuldhara is a deserted village on the outskirts of Jaisalmer. It’s on the way to Sand Dunes. There are many legendary stories associated with this place but all points to one thing that the village was abandoned and is haunted. One can find remains of around 100 houses which are made of stones. There is a small house and a temple which are preserved and one can have an idea of how the houses were in those days.

title: An Empty Village
review: Nothing but empty houses set aside.. dont really believe they are original..looks like made up place..none of the houses have roofs, however their walls and staircases look absolutely perfect..total waste of time

title: Serenity !!
review: I would not recommend it as a must visit place. If there is time, you can give it a visit. It is just an abandoned old village reduced to ruins now. There is nothing interesting to go deep inside and visit. We just stepped inside, had a look and passed by. Only a few days after visiting the place, I came across an article which said that the place was "haunted" !! I don't know how far this is true....but... Oh my God... had i known this, i would never have visited !!

title: Don't Stop, Just passby
review: Seriously couldn't find anything interesting apart from the filmy story behind it. It's on the main road to Sam dunes from Jaisalmer and around 10 km from the city. The abandoned village has broken walls, and no establishments. I was amused to see a few hawkers occupying the huts and doing a living. I was told that they are Pakistani immigrants who have found a "free space" to live supported by Govt :)

title: I did not take anything with me from there.
review: Our Guide, from Jailsalmer hotel, told us a very thrilling story. It was with quite some respect that we entered the village and also felt a bit unsure if photographing would be a problem, well you never know. You may be hunted....Just don't come a dig for the gold, the you will land in prison as the german guys did. I think they got 15 years...., be careful

title: The Unusual Quiet Village of Jaisalmer.
review: The Unusual Quiet Village of Jaisalmer lies almost 10 km from Jaisalmer. The history of the village is due to incessant pressure on the Paliwal Brahmin by the former ruler Salem Singh to marry a girl from the Palliwal community, a decision was taken by all in the village to teach Salem Singh a lesson by leaving the village totally deserted. Since then there is everything in the village except people. The visit should be made in the day time.

title: Visit to the abandoned village
review: Stopped over at the village while we were returning from the sams dune to jaisalmer. Takes 30 to 45 minutes detour. The ruins are mystic and need to know the history of the abandoned village. My cab driver was able to provide the history but I am sure one can get it from the internet as well. while you are there do visit the cactus park for some variety of cactus plants. good photo opportunity.

title: Just another ruins
review: It's just another ruins in middle of nowhere. The taxis are very expensive to get to here. It is a good photography location, but historically, not very exciting.

title: Great story for the ruins!
review: The story about this deserted village is quite interesting. The king wanted to marry a girl from this Brahmin village and inter-caste marriage was a quite sensitive topic. We were told that these Brahmins vacated around 84 villages overnight because of this caste threat from the king. Hence made it a point to visit this place which is just a 5 KM detour if you are traveling towards Sam sand dunes for camping. A large area of ruins and not a single soul there. Not sure why people have not come back and started living there again. Locals told us that recently a pot of Silver coins was found there. Natural rumors for any such places.......

title: Eerie and exciting
review: The village is an abandoned collection of ruined houses. Go in the evening, to experience the excitement.

title: Kuldhara Visit
review: Not worth a visit, just empty village (broken houses) , there are some people collecting entry tickets thats all it has with no sign boards how to go about and one can easily get lost.

title: Good one!!!!!!
review: A good place to see. It is on road to Sam Sand dunes. so you need not to arrange a separate trip to it. It has a lot of background history and they say that it is a cursed place with a no. of souls roaming in it at night. There is a major treasure hidden beneath at this place.

title: What a story!!
review: We were quite excited about the trip to Kuldhara after we heard the story of the abandoned village  from our driver. We visited Kuldhara on our way from the fort to Sam Dhani village. The village was inhabited by the Paliwal tribe, which was known for it's strikingly beautiful women and men. The village now only has one house remaining, which is used to depict how the people stayed and the techniques used to keep the houses cool and well ventilated. Otherwise, it's just bricks strayed here and there. The place also has a temple, however, there is no idol present anymore. The place feels a little eerie as it's abandoned.

title: Average
review: There is nothing much to see over there becuase the king demolished the whole of village and one will only find bricks lying all around over there!

title: Interesting
review: What an interesting place.... interesting story behind the whole place. You can easily get lost in history here. The only thing bugging was the begger kids who keep asking you for "rupees".... they keep nagging until you give them something. Otherwise, beautiful place that one should see when in Jaisalmer.

title: An ideal place to watch a sunset
review: About 20 km from Jaisalmer, a town of some 700 years old but well preserved because of the weather and lack of erosion. I visited in the evening to see the sunset when it was quiet. Only the gate keeper was there and he played a couple of tunes on his Indian Flutes. The sunset was beautiful. None of the buildings are actually complete, many ruined after being destroyed hundreds of years ago. The village was deserted overnight to avoid a conflict concerning an arranged marriage.

title: Something Different
review: I  havent seen anything like this and for me its was just amazing to see a deserted village, though there are many such villages in jaisalmer, I must see if you are at Jaisalmer may be you never get a chance to see such places ever :-)

title: A empty village which left by villagers
review: this village has become a tourist spot hence Govt of Rajusthan has taken it in their control as a tourist spot. 20 to 25 km from jaisalmer city in the route of sam dune desert .

title: quik stop
review: Quick stop on the way to the Sam dunes..There's an abandoned temple and ruins of a deserted village. The temple is quite nice, worth it for a quick stop.only broken walls were their.

title: Off the beaten path
review: Quite often it’s the more secluded off the road places that give the most enjoyment. And this is very true for the Kuldhara village. The story behind the village is fascinating – best told by the local guides. The village consists of dilapidated stone and mud houses except for a sturdy temple. There is an eerie silence all around and that adds to the mystique of the place. The temple top offers a great place to watch the sunset and some very scenic backdrops for photographs. The village offers a quiet atmosphere and is a welcome relief from the hustle and bustle of Jaisalmer fort or the Sam sand dunes close by.

title: You Can Dream to Be in History
review: .Kuldhara.... Where the souls of past residents still Haunt......

title: Worth a look if you're near.
review: Nothing dynamic, just a set of ruins but certainly worth a look if passing on the nearby road. The story of it is fascinating. You can stop at the top of the hill and take pictures of it. The attempt at a sort of museum at the top there is a typical Indian mish-mash of a mess, BUT it's just about worth a wander and nobody charged us for it. You'll get a nice pic of a peacock up there. Steve Riches, Northampton, UK.

title: Ghost village ........must see
review: As the story goes, the village used to be the residence of the rich and learned paliwal Brahmins. The daughter of the village chief was a doe-eyed beauty who'd just stepped into her sixteenth spring. The notorious king of Jaisalmer happened to lay his eyes on this beautiful girl and wanted to take her as his wife. The king was famous for his debauchery and some loyal friend tipped the chieftain about his mal-intentions. The entire village of Kuldhara evacuated bag and baggage in one night and all that remained was an empty village without a single soul. As the paliwal Brahmins left, they cursed death upon anyone who ever came to live in that village. Over the years, a few skeletons had been discovered in the village.

title: Ruined..
review: Quick stop on the way to the Sam/Khuri dunes..There's an abandoned temple and ruins of a deserted village. The temple is quite nice, worth it for a quick stop.

title: Good place to get pictures clicked, rest is a waste of time
review: As people claim this place to be haunted and stuff, its all gossip and visiting this place specially for this reason is a waste of time and money. If you are staying in the Sam sand dunes and travelling to the city or vice versa then you can stop by in the afternoon to get pictures clicked since the abandoned village with sand and a bit of greenery provides really good frames for shooting. Overall its a sheer waste of time.

title: Very Interesting.
review: Its a very interesting place which is worth-visiting. Its said that this village was abandoned in one night as the king wanted to marry some girl from this village against wishes and traditions of their community. There are a number of abandoned and broken houses which presents an interesting picture.

title: Ethereal
review: Being a paliwal, visiting a village which my ancestors abandoned centuries ago was a surreal experience. It felt like i finally connected with the anxiety and hardships they must have felt while uprooting themselves from here.

title: Deserted village & Cactus Park
review: Kuldhara, the abandoned village is situated 18 km west of Jaisalmer on way to Sam. Once a prosperous settlement of the Paliwal Brahmins, all the residents of Kuldhara and 83 nearby villages vanished suddenly one night in 1825, having lived there since 1291.The Prime Minister is believed to have developed a lecherous eye for the chief’s daughter.For the pride and honour, the chiefs of the 84 villages decided to go away in a single night with whatever they could carry with them. It is very surprising why roofs of most of the houses are missing. On the main entrance of the Kuldhara complex is the Jurassic Cactus Park. Many varieties of Cactus plants are maintained & grown there. Nice to see different desert vegetation in a small park.

title: a different experience
review: 18 km west of Jaisalmer on way to Sam sand dune one will come upon the village of Kuldhara. Once a prosperous settlement of the Paliwal Brahmins, all the residents of Kuldhara and 83 nearby villages vanished suddenly one night in 1825, having lived there since 1291.

title: a place with a beautiful history
review: a very nice deserted place to go for a sunset and go with somebody wo can tell you the history about it

title: Lonely place
review: I did not like to see an empty village because it was sad to see no life in a place but I liked to at least know what an abandoned village looks like

title: Brilliant!!
review: Do it! Go see this abandoned town and learn its history. What an amazing story..... I like the fact that my 10Rs entry goes towards restoring the town, but I'm glad to have seen it now before it looks too perfect.

title: Desolate ruins of an abandoned village
review: Very atmospheric, haunting ruins. On the way to Sam dunes, and almost everyone stops for a quick look. The village has been used a movie location and I suspect the one house remaining in reasonable condition has been renovated for such purposes.

title: One of the 5 abandoned Village
review: Really nice place, a haunted village ruins with various stories and folklore. there is a dry river with stone bed, which looks like iron ores.

title: Kuldhara: An Abandoned & Cursed Village of Rajasthan
review: Kuldhara story is one of the weirdest and inspiring stories I’ve ever heard. About 15 Km. west of Jaisalmer a city in western Rajasthan lies the ruins of a village which was called Kuldhara. The first sight of Kuldhara village, more a town actually, sends one imagination running to the time it may have been inhabited. A well planned settlement, the straight and wide streets ran in grids with houses opening into them. All design elements kept both aesthetics and utility in mind. A kind of a garage opened into the streets to park carts in. Temples, step wells and other structures were all signs of sound development over the centuries.

title: Must visit
review: This village was the prime one amongst the 84 abandoned in 1825 by pali brahmins due to fear of Salim Singh, Just experience the place , you feel transported back 200 years ...

title: Kickin' it Indiana Jones style
review: Kuldhara is the ancient ruins of a Palival town abandoned only 100 years ago when the local lord kicked the entire village out of his domain after being refused a bride from the village.  The Palival are cursed and can't flourish on the land here so they up and left... more recently Rajput settles are starting to move in but the village of Kuldhara is site to behold with collapsed stone home after stone home in many cases with intricate stone work and adornments scattered around.   I even tried my hand a re-stacking and old stone column so that the carvings lined up... I did it but tried after the first 3 heavy stones...

title: Interesting place on the way to desert safari
review: Visited Kuldhara on my to desert safari. It has an nteresting story of why it was abandoned and stories related to movie shooting done nearby. Not much to do here but a nice place to click some photographs

title: It looked like a lot of bricks
review: They called this a ghost town and it was on our trip out to a camel ride....Well - there was a film crew there (complete with craft services) and a bunch of people rebuilding some buildings.

title: Looks restored
review: The ruins are not so much of ruins and it looks many houses in the village have been rebuilt / restored to look like ruins so that people like us can see something and remain interested

title: wow
review: its like you are in ghost city... beautiful view from the temple, and magical story beyond this.

title: nice
review: We visited in December with my family. It was nice to see the empty house. You can feel after visited this place about the story beyond. Such a mysterious place. Thanks to keep original still.

title: A night tour
review: We went on a haunted trail to the village organised by Suryagarh Hotel and besides giving us the chills it was quite an experience. You definately do feel a presence which will send shivers up your spine but you have to go there to experience it for yourself

title: Pituresque
review: Felt like i was in a movie set..reamins of a once a prosperous village...nice experience being there.

title: Scary and beautiful
review: The place is deserted and it gives a sad and scary feeling. But if you are in a jolly mood its a good visit and you can always enter all the roooms of the village to extract more information

title: brilliant
review: I'm glad we stopped here. It was magical and the stories around it were evocative. Again, we got here in the afternoon when there was no one else around and enjoyed the serenity (as well as the one part they're trying to reconstruct) with no one to disturb us.

title: Must see at Jaisalmer
review: This place is true to its name - an abandoned village. People avoid it as it is slightly far from Jaisalmer but I think it is a must see. It gives a very weird feeling to see so many houses empty and abandoned. The driver told us that 84 villages were abandoned in reality.

title: Worth a visit
review: Not something you come by every other day - a whole abandoned village, apparently abandoned overnight, because of the atrocities of Salim Singh and the indifference of the then king.

title: captivating story, interesting to see --ok for a short visit
review: The story itself is captivating--- and that was the draw to get us to visit.    But the ruins are pretty basic--- even with the 1-2  main buildings being rennovated.    Worth a short visit en route to the sand dunes.

title: gives you the jitters
review: the sense of abandonment still lingers on in the village after all these years. it has an eerie feeling about it even today.

title: haunted trail
review: that was quite an experience...must recommended..the hotel had quite a wacky name for it"chudail trip"..but must recommended..

title: It' on the way, anyway
review: When you are at Jaisalmer, you would surely visit the sand dunes, and this abandoned village is on the way, so it's worth a visit. As my co- reviewers have pointed out, it has a nice story, but the ruins are just that - in ruined condition. Some very basis stone semi-structures is all that stands there.

title: Haunted for you; Location for me
review: Just go and enjoy Phogotraphy. especially in the evening time. Light will be so soft that you just cant resist clicking more than 500 pics at the same place.

title: Nice place to visit
review: We have recently visited this place. Its old village where people were staying and suddenly it was vacated on one night. Worth visiting.

title: Slip back to the past
review: Story says this was the village of Paliwal Bhramin and due to the wish of the King to marry a girl of this community, the entire community fled away from the village overnight. Since then, this is the abandoned village. You could see the advance architecture and drainage system in this 200 years old village structure.....which looks like the haunted village.

title: Interesting place
review: The history behind the abondoned village is really interesting. It is bit off track but do visit.

title: Different
review: The village gives you a glimpse of the past. The abandoned homes, which are still in their origional form give you a strange feeling.

title: A haunted place
review: This is the place where I would love to go whenever I have chance to visit Jaisalmer.This desert village of paliwal brahmins is very quiet place to experience and visulise the living style of those who used to live in this area.Evening are much much better to visit this place.

title: Mysterious History
review: Kuldhara is a very large abandoned town with a very mysterious history given the entire town population of Paliwal Brahmans disappeared overnight never to be seen again.  The town has a lot of paranormal activity associated with it.

title: Just a abandoned village
review: On the way to the Dunes, we stopped to see this abandoned Village. They even took away the Idols from Temple. :-)

title: Memories of the bygone.
review: The village stands in the middle of the deserted land, reminding you of the old memories of the bygone.

title: Kuldhara, the mystery
review: Obviously, the highlight of  my Jaisalmer tour is visit to this abandoned village Kuldhara. Why such a developed village was abandoned is a mystery. So many stories are there, but nothing authentic. The model houses built by the Govt throw a light on the design of houses during that time.

title: Worthy twin of Fort Khaba
review: Amazing place to be visited during sunset or at midnight for the more adventurous  at heart. No local people visits this place as it is cursed, go there to find out why.

title: Unexpected Surprise
review: We were totally in awe of this place.  It's truly remarkable and is said to be 400 years old and apparently the residents left overnight - unsure what led to this desertion!!  A ghost maybe?

title: Cursed village is a must see!!
review: It was pretty hot during the day time, but we still dared to go to this village and it was worth the visit. You can very well see the building architecture that was used a century back which I found pretty fascinating.

title: The haunted experience
review: It gives you a kinda creepy feeling. The folklore says that the entire village was vacated by the Paliwal villagers due to the exploits of women by the Head Salim Singh (his haveli or house is still in the city, & an attraction. Though visitors are not allowed as the family still lives there). Lot of conservation work is on at the moment

title: Imagining the past ...
review: The feel was a different one. We usually go to visit place with historical importance but to go to a place which was a proper village where many families lived once but abandoned the same all at a once ... could imagine how the people would have lived then..

title: Ghostly place!!
review: Kuldhara was not a part of our itinerary. Went there while going to Sam Sand Dunes. It was a few kilometers detour from the main road. Not a single soul was there when we visited the place. I never knew the history before I went there.

title: Off beat !!Golden Abandoned Village!!
review: When i went to see this place, didn't know about the history of the place but believe me.. the place didn't give any ghostly feeling..It takes about half an hour from Jaisalmet to reach this place.The only thing is that through out the place, there are no sign boards for visitors to follow..we drove through the place..stepping out only once as it was pretty hot that day..but there were no other people, but reading other reviews makes it scarier..hahaha..so guys..have fun & GO TO SEE THIS ADANDONED VILLAGE..the distinguishing feature of this place is the height of the houses, which is really low..now i can't say whether it has been act of erosion,,as the houses are done in clay/mud kind of material..but like the wholw of the jaisalmer, THIS abandoned village IS ALSO GOLDEN...SO check this out for sure!!

title: Curiosity lead us here!
review: This place was very close to our hotel (Suryagarh) and we had done a bit of reading on this. We had a self driven car and visited the place at day time. You may walk on foot inside the village.....for a charge. There is not much to see here, but just the experience of being in a place which claims the disappearance of 83 families overnight. Some say they migrated.......but the previous story is the one that circulates more. Our hotel also had arrangement for a tour of the place in an open jeep...which could prove to be quite a thrill on a moonlit night !

title: on way to sam sand dunes...
review: this place is a few kilometres detour on your way to sam sand dunes and shouldn't be missed. there is a nice temple and chhatri apart from remains of houses. a cactus park is also alongside showcasing different varieties of cactus.

title: strangely interesting
review: this was very interesting esp the story behind the entire abandoned village.A must see.

title: ghost or spiritual village
review: Kuldhara village near Jaisalmer has a very unique history! .... Awesome and great work..looks like a ghost town in the middle of the desert.

title: The deserted village
review: This deserted village has an interesting tale. Go to Kuldhara and experience the "vast emptyness" and ask a local to tell you the story of why the people in this and surrounding villages left - overnight - never to come back again.

title: Amazing time travel - only to find out things have not changed!
review: Legend has it that the overlord of the village raised taxes, and all the villagers left one night. It is an eerie place. You always have the feeling that somebody is going to turn up at the next corner. Amazingly the village, without inhabitants for hundreds of years, could be any village in current India. A testament to how little things have changed on this subcontinent.

title: The abandoned village ...
review: We stopped by in Kuldhara on our way to Sams. Actually there is not much to view. It not like a tourist place, just an abandoned village. The story around the place is very interesting. The village is truly deserted. Local people believes that the village was cursed by the original dwellers who left over-night , and that is why the village is left abandoned. Since it not much away from route to Sams, so one can plan a visit but do not expect much. If one is running short of time to Sams then easily skip it.

title: A different sense of history
review: Whilst most sights tend to concentrate on their historical heritage, this offered something different in terms of its story, its abandonment and its simplicity. A bit tricky to get there, and not much to actually see when you do, but worth a detour if you're nearby, or have a car.

title: An eeirie place
review: It was a place worth visiting. We have seen many ghost villages but this one was different. The temple in the middle of the village is a must see

title: so dull
review: ...we were taken here on the way to the desert for camel riding but it is DULL. Nothing to see - nothing to do - just foundations of buildings which are not that old and have no story other than 'everyone left' but nobody knows why - visually unimpressive and I'd give it a miss

title: Amazing place
review: Its a deserted village in the desert with lots of ruined buildings and a great stepwell.Very atmospheric and not touristy.

title: Horror story!
review: It is worth a visit enroute the desert,provided you have a knowledgeable local accompanying you.The village is a ruin,with stories of it being abandoned overnight after the then Dewan of Jaisalmer,Salim Singh asked for a girl from here.The story goes that the parents murdered the girl,smeared few houses with her blood and then along with the rest of the inhabitants left the village,cursing the dewan and vowing never to come back.There are two houses still in good condition and a good guide can describe the entire set up well.I happened to watch a programme on this place recently,hence needed no guide.But there is a spook factor to this place.No one is seen here after sunset!

title: Nice outing
review: The Kuldhara village is a deserted old village which is now in ruins. Our driver took us through the history of this place and we could relate to the existing culture of the place and its significance. The government is now refurbishing the ruins to recreate the old houses.

title: Beauriful site, but defaced
review: Enthralling site with a lot of mystery... was disheartened by the way it's been defaced by the crew of a movie shot there recently.

title: Excellent location
review: Ruin of abandoned houses of all 84 villages is exotic location. The story behind is equally interesting and tell the apathy of poor-man in princely India. Ruins offer fantastic opportunity for film shooting. Area actually gives feeling of pain once experienced by Paliwal Brahmins who abandoned their villages and fled to Ujjain overnight because of atrocities of then Prime Minister Salem Singh

title: Not much to see...
review: We visited as a jeep stop on our way out to desert for a camel safari. Alas, although the story of Kuldhara abandoned village is fascinating, and sad, there isn't actually much to see other than some crumbling dwellings. There is no information boards, no guides, just some stone walls in the desert...

title: A Must see place when you are in Jaisalmer
review: The story / myth behind the deserted village is amazing and the architecture of the houses and the entire village makes you think that we feel that we have progressed and our ancestors had no clue but I guess we are the dumb ones and they were way ahead of us when their were no tools and machinery

title: Don't miss
review: This village is one of the 84 villages that was abandoned in the matter of one night as the story goes. When you stand on the roof of one of the renovated houses and look around and think about the people used to live there and how they have left you ought to get a strange feeling.....At least I felt like that..

title: nice
review: this is nice veleg of jaisalmer city i loveit i also want go back agan and agan lot of person of jaisalmer stil not viset this even thay from there like me

title: Must visit
review: A very different experience - it is located at a distance of about 25 km from the jaisalmer city. The drive is through a very desolate area, and since I was driving alone with my family, there were moments when I felt I had taken a wrong route and wanted to turn back. I am glad that I visited this so called "haunted" place - a truly different experience. Unlike Bada Bagh, wouldn't advice you to visit near dusk.

title: Great place
review: Restoration activities in process the place has a strange feel to it, the destroyed houses are really unsettling.

title: Nothing special
review: The village are basically ruins, there are some old houses still undamaged, but the rest are just rocks. Nice to see, but nothing special if you don't have a guide at least. The safari usually includes a first stop here, so it doesn't worth to go there just to visit the place

title: Overhyped!!!
review: This place is definitely overhyped, rajasthan tourism has advertised it too much.

title: Tad disappointing
review: Well had high hopes with the cursed and haunted village where inhabitants are supposed to have vanished leaving behind their stuff as well.

title: Can skip this
review: There are just ruins of villages abandoned by the people for reasons unknown. There are 2-3 theories but no one knows for sure. It’s out of the city and would need a cab/taxi to reach. They usually take 1500-2000 rupees to visit the village and a Jain temple on the way.

title: Nothing much to boast about.
review: As this was very close to Jaisalkot resort I went early morning to catch the abandoned village with the sunrise. I did get some lovely shots of the sunrise with the village entrance and of the small pond just outside the village. Could not enter as it was locked. Came again later in the day to drive in, gave ₹50!at the gate but the drive in was done in less than 10 minutes and not even worth one picture. Waste of ₹50 and no receipt.

title: historical remains of a village now haunted/inhabited.
review: ASI has done well to preserve this 200 year old haunted village amid a sandy desrt. once vacated by villagers under duress, was never habited again . slightly off from way to Sam sand dunes from jaisalmer. worth a visit for history enthusiasts.

title: Abandoned village in between desert
review: Abandoned village in between desert. Govt have mage this a tourist spot. There is a saying that ghost comes at night. We are not allowed to stay there at night. All are broken and houses. Only one temple is standing. Govt restoration mark is there.

title: Creative photographic opportunities- the old mixed with the new!
review: Like bada bragh, this abandoned village photographs better at sunrise. Still, the evening sunsets taken from behind Kuldhara village can be surprisingly, breathtaking. Here, you will see the old with a healthy mix of new restoration..

title: Nothing creepy, pleasant visit
review: Sunset is the best time to visit for lovely photographs. Parking available, could not see any F&B outlets, quite walkable, interesting history, nothing really spooky about it. Great place to visit if u have your own car. Don’t rely on google to navigate, ask around, we had to take a really long detour for a missed turn.

title: Great place
review: Restoration activities in process the place has a strange feel to it, the destroyed houses are really unsettling.

title: Nothing special
review: The village are basically ruins, there are some old houses still undamaged, but the rest are just rocks. Nice to see, but nothing special if you don't have a guide at least. The safari usually includes a first stop here, so it doesn't worth to go there just to visit the place

title: Overhyped!!!
review: This place is definitely overhyped, rajasthan tourism has advertised it too much.

title: Tad disappointing
review: Well had high hopes with the cursed and haunted village where inhabitants are supposed to have vanished leaving behind their stuff as well.

title: historical remains of a village now haunted/inhabited.
review: ASI has done well to preserve this 200 year old haunted village amid a sandy desrt. once vacated by villagers under duress, was never habited again . slightly off from way to Sam sand dunes from jaisalmer. worth a visit for history enthusiasts.

title: Can skip this
review: There are just ruins of villages abandoned by the people for reasons unknown. There are 2-3 theories but no one knows for sure. It’s out of the city and would need a cab/taxi to reach. They usually take 1500-2000 rupees to visit the village and a Jain temple on the way.

title: Nothing much to boast about.
review: As this was very close to Jaisalkot resort I went early morning to catch the abandoned village with the sunrise. I did get some lovely shots of the sunrise with the village entrance and of the small pond just outside the village. Could not enter as it was locked. Came again later in the day to drive in, gave ₹50!at the gate but the drive in was done in less than 10 minutes and not even worth one picture. Waste of ₹50 and no receipt.

review: Abandoned village in between desert. Govt have mage this a tourist spot. There is a saying that ghost comes at night. We are not allowed to stay there at night. All are broken and houses. Only one temple is standing. Govt restoration mark is there.

title: Creative photographic opportunities- the old mixed with the new!
review: Like bada bragh, this abandoned village photographs better at sunrise. Still, the evening sunsets taken from behind Kuldhara village can be surprisingly, breathtaking. Here, you will see the old with a healthy mix of new restoration..
